author: {'steamid': '76561198098325894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1739, 'last_played': 1703522543}
review:
This game slightly changes up the formula so that it doesn't quite feel like the first 3 games. Probably to compensate and balance out the large roster of characters. 

Haven't played the first three games? That's okay too. The game gives you little bits of info on most characters so that you won't be confused. As none of the games really have connections to each other, you can definitely play this as your first one. 

I feel like this game is the closest to a visual novel than all the others. Sure, all of them have too much talking, but I think this one takes the cake. It's been a long time since I've played the first three though so I could be mistaken.

Anyway, the game is huge, and if you wanted to, you could probably spend close to 100 hours to 100% it.

The gameplay is the same, the story a bit more complex, and if you get the dlc, using the auto-equip function means you've got a dozen women walking around in bikinis, so that's nice.

If you like this series, this is probably the best one so far. If you haven't played the series, this is basically a bizarre, unique rpg that's essentially like playing an anime of sorts.

And honestly, any game that has a character that starts a battle saying "I'm not your run-of-the-mill fish" has no choice but to be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124470300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6091, 'last_played': 1702749089}
review:
I was striking to get the True Ending without a guide by doing the usual grind and making sure i didn't miss a single event. It was easy not to miss for me.

I'll Note out the good and bad of this game right now.

Good:

- Dynamic attacks. Yes the word dynamic comes into mind a lot when comparing new EXE and skills from previous games to this. Look at Superior Angels (CPU candidates Attack) of then and now and you can see how cool they made the attack, actually, look at old CPU Candidate attacks of then and now and it's very clear they rework a lot of them, Uni is by far the most noticeable. Old attacks for CPU are here and unchanged so you can see the day and night differences between the new and old attacks. Uzume attacks are also Dynamic and COOL. It's makes a difference when they use the camera angle correctly and much fluid animation plays.

- New Soundtracks, Will be Venus was a bomb of a soundtrack, overriding mobs musics but can't override boss ones. The fact that it can OVERRIDE a music to play this one which reminds me of SRW games, is already the best thing I've experience in Neptunia games. Some of the new dungeons gain a new music to follow as well, the Scene ost is nice, Sa - Ka - Ku Full bloom was nice too and so is Voltage.

- Skip-able Transformation Sequence. The FACT that we got a Transformation sequence at all instead of just transforming in the next scene, is a major improvement in my eyes. I hated how we don't see the transformation in previous rebirth titles when it's easily just 10-15 seconds of animations, skip-able even. THIS plus Will be Venus playing makes it soooooooooooooooooooooo good! NEXT form was Dynamic as heck.

- The stacks. The stacks this time is much higher as this time our antagonist are out for revenge, it's almost the same as Victory but hers is a calculated phantom.

- Characters. Neptune gets character development, instead of her usual upbeat self she's more responsible here. Noire gets a friend that's a little too close. Blanc, well Blanc is still her usual self and Vert gets to spend time with Nepgear, which also brings out that *wanting a little sister* personality she didn't get to use a lot. When I saw the dream sequence, the wishes these CPU wants, Vert was slightly depressing and sad. Uni is being more capable, Nepgear gets to show off her tinker/engineer side, Rom and Ram didn't get much besides the usual. The Gold Third I liked are C sha and B sha, I've played Monster hunter and SRWs to know these 2 references. I know the other 2 as well like S sha Cloud like personality and Omnislash EXE, and K sha Metal gear reference and her Metal gear backpack but I've not fond of them much. Uzume was definitely a fun character.

- Game looks good visually. The character and new dungeons have better qualities to them when comparing to previous titles.

- New enemies/Mobs. A lot of new faces. I'm glad they didn't reuse a lot of the old ones.

- Detail descriptions for enemies. From where this enemy you can fight, to recording what it drops before facing it and what type is it so looking for its specific section in EnemyInfo is much easier but where exactly one encounters it is unknown until your scouts locates them.

- Voiced Enemies. Now Mobs have noises they would make for any kind of action instead of being quiet.

Bad:

- Over leveling. Since this is an RPG like game, You'll likely grind until you don't feel like grinding to progress the story, but you don't know if you've over grind and the boss up ahead becomes a cakewalk afterwards. To fix this issue, I've played Trails of the SKY recently and what they did was give enemies a meager 1 exp each if you reach a certain level in the story without progressing, this way you'll find it pointless to continue and the boss up ahead is still challenging and you can't blitz through without some casualties on your end that may ended up taking out the whole party. 

- Reusing old soundtracks. Seriously some of these old soundtracks are really really old, dating back to rebirth 1 maybe.

- Mobs on map nodes. This. Is. The. Worst. Implement. Ever. I would need to travel 10 nodes and if I'm unlucky I'll get attacks by worthless fodders interrupting my journey. 20secs battle, and I have to manually tap on the place again to resume. This is wayyyyy too frequent if you're travelling in 15 nodes, for up to 4-5 battle interruption. I heard NG+ has a way to disable them, but I don't play usually play for NG+ so it's worthless to me.

- Neplunker was the worst dungeon I've experience as well. The game wasn't build for platforming but it was doing fine, which means doing risky jumps are doable, but this stupid dungeon has a *touch anything and you'll be sent back to the entrance* kind of game, so can't touch the falling bat poops, can't fall more then 30cm or you'll die and go back to the entrance. I nearly lost my mind doing Neplunker Zero on the 1st run. I did it though. 

- Unrelatable struggle. I mean like the story implies during a scene there's many more monsters to come, but the battle commence and it's just 4-5 fodders easily dispatched, then afterwards the character would be panting like it was the hardest battle they have faced. It might have been if they ramp it up to 3-5 continuous battle, getting harder each time, trails of the sky has those moments where they make you battle without resting a few times and THAT WAS HARD, but It does feels incredible went you beat it and understand the characters panting.

- Equipment forcefully changes. The game will swap out character during some sequence of events, and each time they came back the game forcefully equip them with accessories I didn't ask for. Their processors, clothing choice, and disc gets swaps out constantly, I don't know how to prevent this. It is the most annoying hindrance just under random enemy nodes.

- Scout system. It's fine in increasing your overall performance, or reduce them. What isn't fine is that everytime they returned they make annoying beeping sounds that CANNOT BE TURNED OFF. If you have gather 40 or so scout by the end game, prepare to have 40 or so scouts with different beeping noises bothering you for the next 2 minutes.


That's it. That's how I feel about the game. It's the best thing to come out among it's previous titles but also not comfortable yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561199147230102', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6033, 'last_played': 1698599278}
review:
hahaha I forgot to make a review, usually after finishing the game I make a review. 
[h1] Story [/h1] (9.5/10)
Of all the Neptunia games I've played up to this moment, I think the Neptunia VII game has the best story. I didn't expect that compile heart and idea factory would create three different stories, three different plots, but still connected to the storyline. I think this game has a rich story, and it doesn't get boring if you play it over and over again. starting from the Uzume story with dimension 0, and returning to the Neptune dimension with different bosses and enemies. Plus we were asked to choose 4 different stories. I didn't feel like I had 100 hours after playing this game. A little spoiler for this game tells about 3 dimensions, zero dimension, heart dimension and hyperdimension. You Neptune lovers must play this game


[h1] Graphic [/h1] (9/10)
The characters in this game have many variations. starting with the addition of new goddess characters, new enemies, and even new friends which make the journey in this game very enjoyable. especially the character C-Sha in this game is very moe in my opinion. I like C-Sha's character design in this game. besides c-sha there are also b-sha, k-sha and many more. All of these new characters are quality guaranteed and are undoubtedly drawn with the best quality. I like the Neptunia series games because the quality of the anime graphics is the best with cute characters.


[h1] Gameplay [/h1] (9/10)
Idea factory and compile heart really thought about and upgraded all aspects of the main neptunia series games. starting from the story, the characters, and now the gameplay has also been upgraded to new gameplay. At first I was a little confused with the gameplay combining power, rush and standard attacks (formerly called breaks). Usually we can only choose one type of attack, but now we can combine it with trait attacks. This causes the resulting combo to vary greatly, and it also depends on the weapon. But what's interesting about the new gameplay in this game is when you fight a very big boss. we will be faced with zero dimension when fighting a very big boss. really unique and interesting. you must play this game.


[h1] Sound [/h1] (8/10)
Usually I sometimes like to complain that the soundtrack of the Neptunia game series likes to be taken from the previous main game, but this time I said no. Because there are so many new places such as zero dimension, heart dimension and hyper dimension, more soundtracks appear and are very varied. It turns out that the game developers were actually able to create a new soundtrack and I really appreciate that. I think the new soundtrack is really good.

[h1] DLC [/h1] (8/10)
There are many and various types of DLC in this game. Starting from DLC about new areas, new quests, new items, even DLC to get new characters which of course helps players to get achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329198621', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3240, 'last_played': 1699025810}
review:
Compared to other game in the series(rebirths 1-3, not spin-offs(i didn't play them yet)), this one is definitely the best. Game is actually completeable without spending a year to farm and imagine-you don't even need to buy a broken DLC for it. 
Lore is also pretty good. The only thing that's actually better than this lore-wise, is the conquest ending, but it's impossible to beat that level. 
Endings are obtainable without farm, it takes you like 10 minutes at worst to get shares to the level you need, and no time at all if you didn't spend credits(you can buy public relations). 
There are cons, of course: 
1. Game constantly switches the characters you have and you constantly need to readjust equipment(this also applies to skins)
2. Travelling somewhere has a chance to get you into a fight and it just pisses off to constantly fight enemies(especially considering they give no XP, credits, or any real challenge)
3. Controls for keyboard and mouse are even more fucked up than in previous games
4. Monsters are faster than you and when you're seen, you're most likely getting into a pointless fight
5. To break metal boxes you gotta have to complete neplunker which is the definition of cancer(parkour in this game is a bad idea)
6. The final boss is dissapointing
7. Translation is still on Ge-Ge level which makes me want to commit suicide(i suggest everybody picks japanese voice)
8. Irresonable split on 2 paths(hyper dimension and heart dimension), which has no effect on ending but forces you to watch the other on youtube to know what happened(or start a NG+)
9. Not a whole lot of post-game events(compared to Victory 1)

And pros:
1. You can go and change settings whenever you want(cutscene? sure)
2. If you accidentally pressed the end event button, game asks you if you actually want to end the event
3. Hidden treasure system is way superior to previous games
4. Scout system is way superior to previous games
5. God tier providence soundtrack
6. Music is lowered by a custom % in settings(you can change it) whenever character talks, may not seem like much but it's A LOT

Overall, game is without a doubt better than any of the 3 rebirths

review: No suelen ser juegos muy elaborados los de Neptunia, pero para mi gusto son bastante disfrutables. Aun no termino pero tiene una dificultad algo elevada y eso no esta mal para mi, son raros los juegos en los que debo planificar bien la compra y uso de objetos curativos, y Megadimension Neptunia es uno de esos juegos que te incita a comprar y usar dichos objetos porque los enemigos quitan vida decente, no te sentÃ­s inmortal como en los juegos tipicos de hoy en dia que casi ni usas nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012367453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1687595706}
review:
The story is about nothing... Game-play is stupidly hard. Playing without dlc is extremely uncomfortable.
Even Mugen Souls (which I don't like that much) is a hundred times better story and game-play wise.

Update after reaching true ending:
First 10-30 hours is hard without extensive grind or dls.
But the game overall is a collection of extremely poor design choices. Probably ok to kill time, but there is nothing great, interesting or to remember.

I worked 30 hours to prepare my team for post game, and than give it up after a couple of hours of actual post game (because there is none, only coliseum and tens hours of grinding the same one enemy to reach lvl 999).

VII was recommended to me as best of neptunia. I don't want to even imagine how the rest of the series looks like. Definitely first and last one for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092646321', 'num_games_owned': 365, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3676, 'last_played': 1685282588}
review: I don't think I will ever find a worse game that Neplunker. I could go on for hours about how every mechanic somehow builds on itself to make a more miserable experience, or how the last part is blocked off until you have gotten an item - something which there is no warning for - making you waste hours since you have to do it again. Yes, Neplunker may only be a relatively small part of the game but that doesn't make the experience any better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 4912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4912, 'last_played': 1561744624}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304849670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1683598958}
review: It's a great story, fun game to play, very entertaining and hilarious. Feels different from ReBirth 1-3, yet still feels very familiar and at home. Uzume Tennouboshi is a very, very likable character than Plutia in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182344945', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1681142435}
review: I had this sitting in my library for a long time, I got it from a bundle, not being familiar with the franchise I didn't know what to expect, but from the reviews it seemed to be one of the best of the series. I really wanted to like this game, I was looking for something fun, but this game... it's SO DULL. I even tried buying a couple of DLCs and went from needing to grind quite a lot (with the process not being fun or satisfying at all) to being totally overpowered... and it still wasn't fun! Everything is so bland and bloated... and there are so many -and so long- useless gibberish dialogues... idk, any other use of my time seemed more appealing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199123362853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8968, 'last_played': 1710709715}
review:
I have played this game through and throughout the past 5 years, I would consider this the definitive "neptunia" game. This games fun rpg mechanics and dungeons make the game exciting and the story is very captivating. The progression is fun and free, the game does punish you if you under level for certain fights, i would recommend the first playthrough you use zero dlcs including the free stuff.

This game has the humour and light heartedness of the series mixed with some serious moments in the three arcs of the game, after 100% this game i can fully say this is the best neptunia game in the series.

For those struggling to know which games are cannon:

Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 2 
Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 3
Megadimension Neptunia VII
Neptunia Sisters Vs Sisters(orthadox spin off) but related to cannon.

I hope you found this review helpful, Now go Nep or something

HÃ©las, je ne sais pas si ce sont mes goÃ»ts qui ont changÃ©, ou bien la faute du jeu, mais jâ€™ai fini par le lÃ¢cher au bout de seulement quelques heures.



Les raisons Ã  cela sont multiples :

author: {'steamid': '76561198279140910', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1676470764}
review:
My only issue with this entry was that it felt too long.

I like neptunia games because they are fairly short and silly, they feel like a comfort food between playing all the long and heavy games.
Unfortunetly to me it felt like a long and heavy game.

Other than that I rly liked the 1st apocalypse setting, the plot overall was fine, it had some rly funny scenes. 
Besides the lenght I have 0 complains, and would reccomend it to everyone that has enjoyed all the neptunia games so far.

review:
New challengers are taking control of Gamindustri, and Neptune's nowhere in sight. Now sheâ€™s gotta help a mysterious stranger fight a colossal new evil, reclaim her Goddess title, and find some time for pudding! Go next gen with Giant Battles, multi-worlds, and multiple storylines in this JRPG!

New Battle Features Characters can link up for stronger attacks, â€œParts Breakâ€ allows you to split enemies into pieces to lower their stats and disable special attacks, and â€œGiant Battlesâ€ impose limits that will challenge the strategist in you!
NEXT mode A second transformation is now available! You can break those big baddies into bits with NEXT mode, which features new special skills and a new costume for the CPUs!
Three Worlds, Three Stories Three different story modes! With new CPUs and characters at your side, you must fight through three dimensions to save Gamindustri!
New Dungeon Minigame! An homage to the classic â€œSpelunker,â€ you receive special items when you clear this dungeon under the time limit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006348717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4389, 'last_played': 1697938776}
review:
I saw this game one day with overwhelmingly positive reviews on both recent and past reviews, and looking at it, thought "how good could a game like this possible be?" I did some research, and apparently this is the 4th installment of the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. Not wanting to jump in and not know what's going on, I decide to start from 0 with Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth 1.

 Fast forward 4 months later, having played through all four of the mainline games including this one, I can confidently say that *this is worth your time.* Never before have I seen a series that's able to go from silly to serious to sad to silly again so fast, and actually manage to pull it off! 

Writing this review immediately after achieving the true ending, I find myself sad that it's over, but content with my journey. I love these characters and the way they interact with each other, they make this franchise unforgettable. Thankfully I can take solace in the spinoffs.

If you are to play this game, it stands well on its own, but playing the 3 before this GREATLY enhances the experience, even if the older titles can get a bit rough. Stick it out, and its well worth it.




Man, I wish there was a super-recommend button.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292463486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1674601611}
review: Horribly optimized. If you play this game, you have to be eithera buddha monk or someone with enough money to buy a computer the size of a space megastructure because of how slow and needlessy demanding this game is on your computer. I have not had this issue with any of the three rebirth games, and even worse, changing the settings doesn't do anything. If you change your resolution from 1920x1080 to something like 840x450, the game will still run like it's on 1920x1080 even if the application window is small. I literally had to get a mod to make the game act like it's at the resolution i put it in (MegaResolution neptunia), and even then the dungeon sections are still a lag fest. If you have a p24 or a nintento switch, get this game for either because this is not going to run properly unless you have a warehouse of GPUs and RAM connected to your computer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051207890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1673639040}
review:
I'm so mixed on this game that I couldn't decide whether to recommend or not. As far as gameplay goes it's a perfectly fine game, but I really didn't like the story. Not one bit.  I can't stand manipulation and emotional abuse, and that's the villain's MO. I didn't actually finish the game (hence the Not Recommended) because there was a part near where I just closed the game instead of continuing with the cutscene, and will probably never play the game again. Being triggered is a meme but I literally was.
If it doesn't affect you that much and you're interested in the game in general, it's got pretty good gameplay. I only don't recommend it for the story, and only because it features abuse that makes me deeply uncomfortable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043364387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1671287624}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII is the fourth mainline game in the series, and I had hopes that it will shake the Rebirth 1-2-3 formula a bit.

It actually did!
The game didn't change its roots, but it has some nice changes and more:
[list]
    [*]Reworked combat system (Now everything really feels in place imo)
    [*]Every character is enjoyable and has enough time to shine
    [*]Much better story pacing while being longer than the Rebirth games
    [*]Cool Next-Gen forms and Giant boss fights
    [*]Not much of a grind need for true ending, or at all
    [*]The OST is great, has some definite masterpiece tracks
    [*]Much better story pacing than usual
    [*]Cool Next-Gen forms and Giant boss fights
    [*]Not much of a grind need for true ending, or at all
    [*]Cool references
    [*]The heart and soul put into the game by the creators really shines through, especially with a fully voiced "Thank you for playing" montage, I was surprised.
[/list]

Some negatives though:
[list]
    [*]The overworld map redesign while nice, is annoying with the constant random encounters
    [*]Too many difficulty spikes
    [*]Not a perfect port, laggy combat and menu loading
    [*]No autosaving makes battle gauntlets more stressful than needed
[/list]

The game is still niche, but if you are a Neptunia fan, it's a must-play, I really enjoyed my time with this and and the mainline series so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035589123', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3805, 'last_played': 1708381371}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074613709', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 5922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5922, 'last_played': 1668708608}
review:
One of the best Neptunia games from the whole series ! (still haven't played the 4GO one and some spin-off at the time of review)

From story to gameplay, the experience was awesome for me. I started to play it around 2k17 and finally decided to do the 100% achievements and it was still entertaining (mostly because of my love of Nep and her world)

There is still some problems in term of freezes/crashes but it was only because of an intense use of the animation skip feature (especially on skills). Apart from this my almost 100h double playthrough was pretty clean for a NepNep game !

If you're a fan to the series just profit ! 
And if you're discovering Nep Nep, it could be a great experience but starting from Re:Birth 1 might help a little getting into her world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028953066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1666487650}
review:
Probably enjoyable if you're looking for an anime series with some minor interaction, as the voice acting is fairly good. Don't recommend if you're looking for an FF-style game experience, as there are vast amounts of (not very interesting) dialogue interspersed with some linear combat sections. 
Combat itself is fairly fun at first due to having to orient your characters around mobs, but quickly turns into a repetitive slog. Maybe later in the game there are some more interesting mechanics (I unlocked route building  before giving up), but if so, they don't arrive in time to keep the early game interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368198606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1702986419}
review:
This may be the best JRPG I've played...  

The good:

- The writing is wonderful.  Characters are cleverly made, memorable, have likable traits, and stand out.

- There's plenty of clever humor to go around in the game's main and side content(optional cutscenes, etc).

- The combat is well defined, engaging, and really makes you plan carefully.

- The story is one of the most wild and crazy stories I've seen in a video game or any anime.  It is truly unique and original in all the best possible ways.  Some events in the game mirror real world events that have happened in the present time, in other words, the game unintentionally predicted the future.

- Music is a 9 out of 10 with 99% of this game's original sound tracks being extremely atmospheric and captivating.  The first map theme I heard resonated with me showcasing how sad and messed up everything was while simultaneously being calming and bringing forth a sense of hope.  

- General sound design is great.  English character voices are actually good, enemies have unique audio clips with some of them sounding hilariously goofy.  



The Bad:

- The generic boss theme is overused and kind of degrading to listen to during boss fights.

- Some areas, music, enemy designs, and general assets are reused from previous games, and across the game in general.  It isn't something that you'll constantly be annoyed by, but you will see reused assets from time to time.

- Too many bath scenes.  There aren't very many of them, don't get me wrong.  But I do still think there are too many of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206522056', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4459, 'last_played': 1703194646}
review:
I suppose it's time to conclude this series of reviews I have made on the mainline Hyperdimension Neptunia games.

Megadimension Neptunia VII is the fourth instalment in the Neptunia series and, in my opinion, it takes everything the first three games did right and just expands on it! Each arc is full of variety and all the newcomer characters are incredibly well written, it is a BIT of a long entry compared to others in the series though. Despite that length I would definitely recommend ANYONE play this one, it shows the series at its peak in my opinion, my only gripe is the overworld random encounters thing can often slow down gameplay and make certain segments unenjoyable, other than that, super solid experience! Would play again in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867729012', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 2256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2256, 'last_played': 1664765619}
review: Being able to cut down the 250 hours it took me to 100% this on ps4 to under 40 hours felt fucking incredible. (I'd gotten the normal end 13 times in a row due to missing [spoiler]Histoire's quests during the Neptune story of the Hyperdimension arc[/spoiler] every time) the fact I didn't know you could open card packs in the inventory and so had been using them in fights. Taking 3 times as long to do so. + using a map for [spoiler]Senmuu's labyrinth[/spoiler] instead of going in blind made it SO much easier. and I had a better experience than I did 100% it this time due to knowing what messed me up last time. Still love this game, It was my first foray into the series and still my favourite.

review:
[i]Hola a todos vengo a contar mi experiencia del juego !

(*AVISO*) = Puede ser que haya algÃºn que otro spoiler, estÃ¡n avisados.

-La banda sonora esta bien, me gusta el tema de pelea de la zero dimension. 

-La historia no esta mal, el inicio me hace acordar al rebirth 3 solo que con un par de cosas diferentes xd.
El juego tiene 3 finales:
El Bad Ending : no vale la pena conseguirlo, ni siquiera tiene logro
El Good Ending : no esta tan mal pero termina de una forma muy repentina. (Recomiendo el True)
El True Ending : Este es el que vale la pena y en mi opiniÃ³n el final mas importante, el juego te permite que en tu primera partida puedas sacar el true ending a la primera, si se animan pueden conseguir este ending a la primera. Yo dirÃ­a que si sacas directamente este ending ya esta, porque el resto no aporta mucho. En este ultimo ending quisiera aclarar que cuando pidan que subas la barra de los shares solamente te lo piden para destrabar un dialogo, una vez que veas el dialogo ya esta, la barra ya no importarÃ­a de mucho.
Van a tener que verse una guÃ­a para asegurarse de cuales son los requisitos y demÃ¡s.

-Los personajes me parecen geniales como siempre, los nuevos personajes que aparecen acÃ¡ me gustaron todos principalmente uzume que es con la que mas me encariÃ±e, es re buena onda. La nep adulta tambiÃ©n me gusto mucho, yo me preguntaba desde el momento en que juguÃ© al rebirth 3 que habÃ­a pasado con la neptune de esa dimensiÃ³n porque si plutia era la Cpu Â¿Donde estaba neptune xd?. Yo recordaba que me habÃ­an dicho que la neptune de esa dimensiÃ³n podÃ­a estar muerta pero no jajaj esta por ahÃ­ viva haciendo de  las suyas sin poderes de CPU.

-En cuanto a la dificultad debo decir que a mi me pareciÃ³ difÃ­cil, en este juego hay 3 capÃ­tulos nada mas pero son muy largos porque transcurren en dimensiones diferentes. Hay varios momentos en este juego que lo pase mal principalmente en el capitulo de Gold Third y Heart. 
(-1-) Con respecto al capitulo gold third es que las CPU se dividen y tenes que elegir a la CPU con la que queres avanzar para que despuÃ©s de jugar todas las rutas de las demÃ¡s CPU se junten todas devuelta. Mi problema esta en que Todo el Inventario y el dinero que hayas tenido con neptune lo mantiene solamente ella, en el momento que empieces con las otras CPU todo lo que juntaste con neptune se va porque es un inventario exclusivo de neptune. Las otras CPU tienen un inventario exclusivo hasta que despuÃ©s se vuelvan a juntar.
1-El momento en el que usas a noire es un tanto complicado porque no tenes un personaje que cure, asÃ­ que dependes de las pociones pero no tenes suficiente dinero debido al inventario exclusivo de ella ,entonces se te complica un poco.
2-El momento en el que usas a Blanc es complicado de ganar cuando esta ella sola porque tiene muy poca resistencia mÃ¡gica y los enemigos suelen pegarle por ese lado. Yo les recomiendo que ni bien tengan a Rom y Ram vayan a levelear un poco a blanc porque mas adelante en la ruta de blanc se complica, me lo van a agradecer xD.
(-2-) Con respecto al capitulo de Heart debo decir que hay un momento en concreto que si no estas leveleado y no focuseas bien te podes estancar ahÃ­.
 
Yo este juego lo juguÃ© 3 veces y desde ya te digo que pasarse el juego por primera vez es lo complicado, de lo que experimente dirÃ­a que es imposible pasarse este juego sin levelear un poco, ya para la segunda vez juegues es mucho mas fÃ¡cil porque te dan la posibilidad de usar a todos los personajes sin tenerlos en la historia.

Por si quieren saber yo lo juguÃ© con joystick y me resulto muy cÃ³modo. No llegue a encontrar a alguien que haya traducido este juego para el momento en que hice esta reseÃ±a pero bueno, al final lo termine jugando en ingles.
Las voces de los personajes se los puse en japones, mas alla de que sean las voces originales yo considero que son mas fieles a los personajes.

El juego esta divertido, hay muchas waifus, fanservice y 2 nepu nepu. Yo se los recomiendo mucho.
Eso es todo por mi parte !
Saludos ! [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198146787336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1989, 'last_played': 1688031329}
review:
I wish the naming convention was better so I would know that chronologically this game was after the rebirth trilogy

+I have never commented about visuals really for neptunia games but dam this game looks so good. Huge huge upgrade from the rebirth trilogy and dam it look so clean. The characters, the enemies, the dungeon. Everything just looks so much better than it used to.

+On the note of visuals, I am super impressed by the movie sequences and the opening sequences of each part. I was shocked actually to see well made movie sequences.

+There is so much more enemy diversity and dungeons feel less like reskins. They don't feel like just reused assets whenever you go to a new one and I was genuinely impressed. There is still the reused assets problem with enemies but it is not as bad as it used to be in the rebirth trilogy.

+Sound design is still godlike. The soundtrack is kind of the same really between the main titles with some additional songs. That being said I want to say the dam voice acting is so good in this game (for Japanese). I normally just call it a day by saying Neptune's voice acting is amazing. I mean it is and it always is with the series but dam I wanna say the new characters were really well voiced. Umio voice is just so dam funny.

+The combat had a big overhaul from the rebirth trilogy. The break stuff is done and the way your combo is different based on weapons is really really nice honestly. The new combo trait system is so much better than the how the old games just had you break armor into spam rush to get in your EXE drives. I find the part break system in this game much better as you now have to care about positioning relative to certain enemies.

+On the note of combat, the new dark CPUs are such a cool addition. All fights with these are in this arena and they are not only really fun but also they are really dam hype. The many HP bars the dark CPUs have is just an addition honestly as it adds to the effect of how dam massive they are.

+Despite all the combat changes, it is still neptunia. Still grindy still has the big numbers still has that addicting gameplay loop. If you enjoyed the previous titles, you will still enjoy these for sure.

+The scouts as a system for collectibles and unlocking things while you play is a HUGE upgrade from stella's dungeon. No one liked stella's dungeon.

+Now for what we really care about in neptunia, the story and characters. When compared to the rebirth trilogy, this game's story and how they deal with the characters is leagues better like its not even a close comparison. As to not spoil the story, this game has 3 big segments and they have different yet related stories that are all really good. The way this game touches heavier topics than the rebirth trilogy yet still maintains its neptunia comedy and quirks is really good.

+We normally see the story from the eyes of neptune but dam this game lets us see the story from different perspectives. This game lets you play as the different CPUs as protags for their individual parts. This game starts of with the story revolving around the new character Uzume. This game has a portion for the sisters like in rebirth 2.

+The game was divided into 3 parts and they weren't even super short parts. This game has not only the most refined story in the series so far but also the longest and it didn't feel like it dragged at all for me. The way they use different characters to keep the story fresh made it feel much shorter than it actually is.

+The characters are still godlike. As per norm the CPUs are still really funny with their antics. Noire is still my favorite of course. Again since we play the different characters the many CPUs are much more fleshed out. The side characters in the stories of the different CPUs are more fleshed out. Since the game is longer, even the enemies are more fleshed out. 

+The new protagonist, Uzume is really well-written and blends with the cast so well. The new side characters, the golden third are all funny as well. I found that the interaction of each CPU with their respective golden third was done really well. Affimojas and Steamax are some of the funniest antagonists this series has seen. Their love for busty blondes and the way they bond over this is so entertaining.

+I want to say this game has the most meta dialogue when compared to the rebirth trilogy and it just didn't get tiring unlike how the 4th wall breaks in rebirth 3 got tiring. These were all done so well. 

+I mention the fanservice in the rebirth trilogy since there is fanservice with just having the CPUs alone but dam for those who enjoy fanservice this game has much more than before.

-This won't affect everyone but I think this game wasn't fully dubbed in English. Normally I praise both dubs for the neptunia games as they are both good but this game was lacking in English dubbing. I noticed a fair amount of grammar and spelling errors in the dialogue also.

-The developing system is a downgrade from the plan system.

-Dangerous monsters and some dungeons are locked behind RNG from scouts making grinding a bit harder.

-Random encounters.... Why did they add this to the overworld...

-xp not affecting characters not in the party is one thing but why would they make characters in the back also not get xp in this game....

-I had a fair amount of FPS drops in this game. Most notably whenever I entered a battle and this did get annoying. Thankfully the game never crashed once in my playthrough.

Overall this is the best mainline neptunia game (so far) and I hope if they do decide to continue the mainline that it holds this as a standard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076832795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4651, 'last_played': 1657023715}
review:
Neptunia games are games where you can turn  off your brain and just enjoy process. 
In this game you will get: Cute girls, good music, common for jrpgs gameplay, but fun in it's own way, simple story filled with jokes, memes and metajokes, a lot of customizing options if you are into that.
Beware of: Few bugs, some are gamebreaking, better read about them on internet, but you can complete main story and quests just fine, some fps drops, some dungeons that may seem the same.
If you are familiar with series go buy this game, you already know the drill.
P.S. If you are completionist, prepare to waste a lot of time on cards. Others who are not completionists, don't touch them, I warned you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025244738', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 3915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3915, 'last_played': 1654933704}
review:
Overall one of the best in the Nep series. Great story, amazing music, and lots to grind/play if you want all the achievements. Game's difficulty is a bit on the easier side compared to other Neptunia games.
Played this on release for PS4 as well, you'd be mistaking this game for the price it has to offer. 
DLC is going to hard carry first playthroughs so be advised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199295907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4613, 'last_played': 1641269912}
review:
My favorite one among the main line games. Granted it also has a lot of things I find annoying and bad but this one definitely shines the most compared to the first three re;birth games. I've got a lot to say so I guess I'll divide my review into parts. But if you don't care about the details I'll just say the game is a solid 9/10 from me if you're a fan of the Neptunia series you definitely have to play this one.

The good parts of the game:
- New monsters and maps. This game actually adds new enemies and maps. Unlike the previous three games which notoriously reused and recycled the same maps and enemies. Granted this game still recycled some enemies and maps, it's still nice to see new ones.
- Less chippers, Thank God cause those where super annoying in the previous games because a majority of them contribute nothing to the story. It's always a pain to spam through chippers just for item drops and plans. But here there aren't a lot of them and what's even better, you can choose to ignore the chippers unless you have DLC which is a plus for me.
- Cheats, Literally. The game gives you cheats once you finish the game once. Stuff like being able to run faster + Jump higher, have all the party members at the start of the game and disabling random encounters in the world map. It's a big help for achievement hunters during New Game+ runs.
- CPU screen time. Each CPU gets the chance to be the protagonist during one arc in the game, Nep no longer hogs all the glory in this game. There are some instances in the game where you'll actually have to play each CPU now and not let them sit at the back the entire game.
- More use to the Share system. This game actually gives you an incentive to increase shares other than unlocking endings. Top ranked CPUs get a small boost in stats and HDD affects your shares (further elaborated in the 2nd list below). Though they don't really play much of a big role still, it's nice that the share system actually has an impact in gameplay albeit small.
- Scouts. They have both negative and positive effects that affect how much exp and money you gain, how much shares are consumed, increase in drop and critical rates and other effects. Again like the shares mechanic, it gives you an incentive to actually utilize the system compared to Stella's Dungeon which can be completely ignored.
- The skip button. A god like time saver if you're doing New game+ runs. Instead of speeding up and skipping the dialog like in the previous games, the skip option actually outright skips the entire scenario saving you a lot of time. You no longer have to sit through a sped up version of the scene just to skip through dialog.
- DLC characters. I'm kind of reluctant to put them here for a lot of reasons but I like them so it's here. Aside from the fact that you have to pay for them [spoiler](Nepgya and Umio especially, felt like they should've been a post game reward rather than DLC.)[/spoiler], I like the DLC characters. They each have unique personalities and fun side stories that are nice fillers if you want a break from the game's story. I'm a big fan of the God Eater series so I loved God Eater in this game, the amount of references she gives that pays homage to the main franchise she represents just makes me happy as a God Eater fan. Other than that let's be real here, the DLC characters do not only bring side content to the game. They're actually viable party members if you're struggling. I know they're OP but if you don't really want to grind that much, get one of the DLC characters.

The bad and annoying parts of the game:
- The route system. Though it's cute to see the CPUs run in the world map, it's annoying when you get caught in a random encounter (especially when you get another encounter multiple times in a row). I hated running through the map before I got the no random encounters cheat post game. What's more you actually have to pay credits to connect routes which hurts your money situation a little bit. 
- Each weapon having different combo strings. Normal combos now have a set string of attacks based on the given weapon. You can no longer do one string of attack regardless of weapon like the previous games.
- Transforming into HDD form now takes a percent of the given CPU's Nation shares. Aside from consuming one bar of EXE gauge, transforming takes a percent of shares now. This isn't really much of a problem because there are scouts that allow you to negate the share consumption but it's still a problem early game when you don't have the scouts that reduce share usage.
- Scripted deaths. Although there's less of it in this game, it's still one of the annoying things about this series as a whole. And this game isn't an exception to this sadly, sometimes you can't tell if certain boss battles are supposed to be won or intentionally lost to progress.
- The movable combat area is now measured by a gauge. Unlike the previous games where the movable area is marked by a circle within the area, this game has a gauge that basically tells you how far you can move during combat. At first I expected to love this new mechanic but ended up being annoyed by it because I cannot tell if I am able to go around an enemy or not. This one's purely subjective tho, you might like it so take my opinion with a grain of salt.
- Money. You'll always be struggling for money in this game because you'll use it for route building, investing, and buying supplies and better gear. I dunno if it's just me but I definitely felt like I struggled more for money in this game compared to the previous three games.
- The Remake [b]cough[/b] or should I say the development system of this game is a downgrade from the previous titles. You barely use it in this game because everything you need is either bought or dropped from enemies or maps. Granted it lets you craft several important key items in the game but you'll barely even need it if you don't care about breaking some boxes in the map.
- Tedious quests. There's a certain side story in the game that loves to give you tedious material gathering quests. I honestly tried to do these because I wanted to see how the sidestory ends but decided it's not worth my time and gave up halfway. 
- RNG based collectible drops, [b]I'm looking at you CPU Chips and Chocolate eggs[/b]. This isn't really a big problem if you don't care about collectibles and achievements but if you're going for 100% achievements in this game I wish you good luck my friend. may the RNG Gods be on your side cause those CPU cards will definitely test your patience. Just keep on save scumming cause this game has no mercy.

I've got more thoughts but I've been writing this review longer than I want to so just play the game and find out for yourselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333825995', 'num_games_owned': 1204, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 3451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3451, 'last_played': 1654220543}
review:
Juegazo.
TOP weeb jrpg/novela visual anime games de la historia, al igual que los Hiperdimension.

Me ha gustado mucho como se ha planteado la historia en este titulo, y como cada HDD tuvo su propio protagonismo dentro de sus respectivos arcos. De hecho, se me ha pasado volando las casi 60hs que le he tirado al juego, la historia no se me hizo pesada en ningÃºn momento ni tampoco sentÃ­ que la hayan alargado innecesariamente, al contrario, me sorprendiÃ³ cuando me di cuenta que ya estaba araÃ±ando uno de los finales.

btw recomendadisimo sacar primero el final normal, y luego rushear el juego desde cero en "nueva partida+" para sacar el verdadero final (te lleva no mucho mas de 4hs, a menos que hayas hecho un guardado clave... no fue mi caso). El mismo se obtiene simplemente viendo todos los eventos y subeventos, y subiendo mÃ­nimo al 40% el indice de las diosas.

blanc besto waifu
& nepgear besto imouto

review:

Overall a good game and Nep fans will love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360756713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1653174936}
review:
This is the ultimate Neptunia game. It has everything in it: amazing writing, fun gameplay, and lovable characters. When I first played this on my PS4, I actually cried when I got the Ascension Ending.

This game is a MUST if you plan to get into Neptunia. I cannot recommend it enough. 

And if you're returning from other dimensions, this is a good entry to come back to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198978593030', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1652131812}
review:
It's better than re:birth, but the gameplay is still terrible. Back and forth, back and forth constantly with every dungeon because the concept of fast travel apparently doesn't exist here. Leveling is painfully slow and the "dungeons" are nothing but boring flat expanses to run through. Battles are for the most part pretty bland and don't require much strategy. Gets tedious and boring very quickly.  PS2 graphics. The writing is super fun and creative but it's not enough to save the awful gameplay. 

Also, if you do decide to play it you can use the megaresolution neptunia mod to make the resolution higher than 1080p.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124445301', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3641, 'last_played': 1655515242}
review:
Esta reseÃ±a contendra mini spoilers y opiniones controversiales del juego, se recomienda discresiÃ³n.

Neptunia VII (Victory 2) es el cuarto y ultimo juego de la seria principal, para esperar 7 aÃ±os con un juego nuevo, y la celebraciÃ³n del 5to aniversario, hay cambios que son algo extraÃ±os y mixtos, incluyendo la dificultad de juego que me parece casi desbalanceado y tedioso.

Lo Bueno:

- GrÃ¡ficos un poco renovados pero ya debieron cambiarse de motor para ese entonces
- MÃºsica buena no tan memorable como la trilogia en mi opinion pero si esta bien
- El sistema de combate por turno al atacar se siente satisfactorio y a la vez de terminar mÃ¡s rapido
- Como siempre la actuaciÃ³n de voz en ingles esta bien pero como que falto un poco de mas ganas, ejemplo Melissa la voz de Neptune, no siente que habla como una Adulta cuando se trata de la Neptune UD u que Black Heart suena como robot
- Le dieron algo de variedad y eliminaron cosas inecesarias que son para bien
- Los nuevos templos en su diseÃ±o estan interesantes y bien hechos, salvo 1 que parece laberinto del pac-man chafita
- El estadio ahora es para ganar mas rencompensas en vez del tipico subir shares y ganarte un poco de objetos
- Ahora los enemigos tendran armadura y tendras que destruirlos con SP u el EXE... y... eso es todo lo bueno que puedo decir

Lo Malo:

- Empezando por la historia, que casi trata de tener pero casi como que no tiene, senti que se termino en el primer capitulo del juego (zero chapter) ya que el segundo se siente mas como de relleno y ya el tercero medio van al grano
- El juego re-utiliza assets y templos como de costumbre, que por cierto hablando de templos...
- La mayoria son como un mentado laberinto que te puedes aburrir e incluso llegar a aburrirte, para unos pocos o niveles finales se entiende pero no casi todo el santo juego.
- En el mapa al comenzar y moverte tal lugar a otro, tendras una batalla random, que luego de un rato se vuelve tedioso, para no tener esa molestia, podras conseguirlo en el new game plus, osea no pudieron poner en un templo como un tesoro escondido o invertir.
- Uzume me parece buen personaje pero no la mejor que todos dicen, ya que su historia es como un medio refrito de Rei de Victory solo que con una Tomboy que le sale su lado Valley Girl
- Neptune Humana (Adulta) como que medio apesta, es la misma Neptune de Hyper solo que el doble de lo que ya es, ya que anda muy infantilizada y fastidia tarde o temprano, me alegro que le arreglaran esa personalidad en los OVAs.
- Hay cosillas que se sienten incompletas, dudo mucho que en esos aÃ±os estaban sobrexplotando la franquicia de puros spin-offs y a la artista Tsunako.
- La transformaciones ahora se deben usar si has ganado un punto EXE, ademas que no debieron arreglar cosas que ya estan rotas como ganar experiencia, haciendo el switch casi inutil.
- La comedia estuvo muy descuidado, si ya eres de los que jugaron o tienes un buen sentido del humor, hay unos que son malillos y repetitivos, y algunas que si dan verguenza ajena
- El final normal senti como mejor final que el que si lo es
- Exageraron algo del fanservice y eso opaca mas a la historia, porque DEMASIADOS ESCENAS DE BAÃ‘OS!
- Y para terminar, Kurome no me parece la mejor villana como todos dicen, no siento incluso como dote de jefe final, Afimojas senti mas dote de jefe final que la que si lo es

ConclusiÃ³n: MegaDimension Neptunia VII no es un mal juego, como que se debio pulir muchas cosas, y faltaba algo mas para que se sienta mas divertido, ademÃ¡s que el sistema de combate por turno ya era de la ensalada y no daba para mÃ¡s, y cosas que no debieron tocar en si haciendolo algo tediosito, es un buen juego pero mala historia, ademas que este fue el juego con la venta mediocre en su pais de origen, y no creo que sea recomendable para empezar entra a la franquicia, echale un ojo no te va a defraudar, y si eres de los que conocio mediante este juego, lamento mucho que te haya chocado esta reseÃ±a. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198377210723', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1329, 'last_played': 1631678956}
review: It's one of the better games from the franchise. Even though Neptunia has fallen off a digital cliff since 2016, this is still a goofy little series to try out. Personally, this series is best played with the intent to like the story and highjinx more than the gameplay cause it gets stale really quickly. It's basically "grind till you can punch the enemy harder than it can punch you" AKA "every RPG before the 2000s." I give this game an acually decent 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316635028', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 2207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2207, 'last_played': 1648216342}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970846787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1864, 'last_played': 1646967511}
review:
Recommended, but only for fans of the series and those who know the existing characters.

- This game has better graphics overall than the first three games in the series, however it didn't quite have the same charm for me.
- The storyline was ok, but nothing special.
- The team abilities are all varied and interesting, albeit a little hard to use in certain battles.
- If you do not have the DLC overpowered starter weapon then you will need to grind a lot for upgrades to weapons before you progress at a certain point about 3/4 of the way through the game. I never bothered to upgrade armor aside from purchasing what was available from the shop and never worried about dying in any battles, although I used an AoE healer regularly after about half way through the game.
- There was only one noticeable fan-servicey scene that I recall and esay to skip over if that isn't your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010247806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1647339785}
review: I don't understand how this game has overwhelmingly positive reviews? I've played the Hyperdimension  Neptunia game, and all of them are better than this one (Even 2). The games unoptimized, and stutters all of the time. Somehow there's less content than every other games. The combat, and enemies are practically a copy + paste of the previous games, and to top it all off they added random encounters which are really irritating when you're just trying to get from point A to B. I'm probably going to continue playing it just so I can get it off my backlog. I certainly don't recommend it though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047949328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 5468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2979, 'last_played': 1647379120}
review:
AVERTISSEMENT : Le texte qui va suivre n'est absolument pas reprÃ©sentatif de ma santÃ© mentale.

[h1] Une authentique pÃ©pite [/h1]. 
Je m'en souviendrai longtemps, et je vais continuer Ã  dilapider mon temps de vie vidÃ©oludique dessus. Pourquoi ? Pourquoi est-ce qu'on y revient alors que vu de l'extÃ©rieur, c'est un n'importe quoi absolu et outrageusement colorÃ© ? Essayons de rÃ©pondre Ã  cette question qui nous obsÃ¨de.

[b] Sur le plan technique [/b]
On ne va pas se mentir, Ã§a plane pas haut. Oublions le systÃ¨me de garde des prÃ©cÃ©dents volets, ici, les ennemis ont une quantitÃ© parfois absurde de points de vie, et les combats consistent la plupart du temps Ã  trouver la combinaison menant aux plus gros dÃ©gÃ¢ts, dÃ©laissant bien trop souvent des aspects plus tactiques au niveau des affrontements. C'est dommage, la richesse du systÃ¨me de combos aurait pu bÃ©nÃ©ficier d'un peu plus de profondeur stratÃ©gique.
Visuellement, rien ne change, on reste dans le mÃªme univers violemment colorÃ©, avec un rendu graphique rudimentaire mais efficace. Chez compile heart, on se foule pas trop question textures et on recycle au maximum. MÃªme le level design se contente de reprendre des maps de donjons issues directement des Re:Birth. Question gameplay hors combat, c'est pas dinguissime non plus. Quelques fulgurances avec les systÃ¨mes d'investissement au dÃ©but, la gestion des scouts qui s'avÃ¨re un peu trop dense quand on commence Ã  en avoir plus d'une vingtaine... Mais c'est dÃ©jÃ  plus accessible que le systÃ¨me de schÃ©mas pour les modifications de donjons auxquels les Re:Birth nous avaient habituÃ©s. 

Bref, vous l'aurez compris, le jeu ne brille pas par ses qualitÃ©s techniques.

[b] Direction artistique, rÃ©alisation, et tout ce qui s'ensuit [/b]
LÃ  les gens, laissez-moi vous dire que c'est du solide de chez solide. Je sais pas ce qu'ils prennent chez CH et IF, mais c'est diablement efficace. Quel bonheur de retrouver le style si Ã©vocateur des personnages emblÃ©matiques, et leurs doublures devenues lÃ©gendaires. Et quel plaisir de dÃ©couvrir des personnages basÃ©s sur solid snake, jill valentine, une gamine-gundam, et l'alter-ego fÃ©minin d'un Cloud poussÃ© jusque dans les limites de la dÃ©rision (la petite pichenette lancÃ©e Ã  square enix avec le TDI d'un personnage, il faut l'applaudir). On est dans l'absence de limites, dans le cringe, dans le fan service parfois le plus lourd et le plus sans-gÃªne. La quantitÃ© totalement invraisemblable de rÃ©fÃ©rences et d'easter eggs balancÃ©s Ã  la seconde fait remettre en question le principe mÃªme de limite.

Vous vouliez que je parle de l'histoire ?
Soyons clairs, vous venez vraiment vous farcir du Nep pour l'histoire ? Allez, soyez pas timides, on a tous nos raisons d'avoir atterri ici et d'Ãªtre devenus accros. Allez, je vous avoue tout : quand j'entends la doublure de Noire, la divine Asami Imai, j'en perds mon latin. Et je reste parce que c'est si bon, parfois, de se dire que le sÃ©rieux n'existe plus, et que le fait de dÃ©rouiller des dogoos, des 2DS en plÃ¢tre, des otakus boutonneux, des pervert-san et autres aubergines bipÃ¨des extrÃªmement agressives, Ã§a fait du bien.

VoilÃ  ce que fait ce jeu : il fait du bien. Evidemment, pour les plus crades de nos concitoyens, il y a quantitÃ© de matiÃ¨re mammaire virtuelle sur laquelle baver. Les lois de la gravitÃ© y sont salement mises Ã  mal, mais Ã©trangement, seulement sur une zone bien localisÃ©e de l'anatomie fÃ©minine. Mais au-delÃ  de Ã§a, le soin apportÃ© au design des personnages, et notamment aux formes NEXT de nos quatre dÃ©esses favorites force le respect. Ces cutscenes de passage en mode NEXT aussi, avec le lÃ©gendaire thÃ¨me "ABSOLUTE" passant en fond crÃ¨ve le plafond de l'epicness. Plus badass que jamais (et plus dÃ©nudÃ©e que jamais dans le cas de Vert), le jeu a de quoi vous faire lÃ¢cher un "Ã§a va ch*er" quand vous appuyez sur le bouton qui va bien, que la musique commence, et que vous larguez la compÃ©tence ultime d'un perso. C'est satisfaisant, c'est Ã©pique, et mÃªme sur un gameplay de combat aussi datÃ©, on se sent pousser des ailes.

Bon, d'accord, un mot sur l'histoire. 
Alors non, Ã§a casse pas des briques. Les dialogues souvent bien trop longs viennent casser un rythme dÃ©jÃ  hÃ©sitant, et qui peine Ã  maintenir un intÃ©rÃªt pour autre-chose que le fait de tabasser des rÃ©fÃ©rences vidÃ©oludiques. On notera cependant quelques fulgurances (Steamax, notamment) du cÃ´tÃ© de Noire et bien Ã©videmment Neptune, mais on dÃ©plorera l'absence un peu trop pesante des quatre CPU sur de trop longs segments du jeu. Alors j'ai bien conscience qu'un vaste public de frustrÃ©s et de gens louches aiment Ã  saliver sur les "petites soeurs", mais perso Ã§a m'a gonflÃ© (mÃªme si Uni a quand-mÃªme la turbo-class, son Ã©criture prenant ici une ampleur inattendue). 

[b] Mais alors, qu'est-ce qui plaÃ®t autant dans ce jeu ? [/b]
A premiÃ¨re vue, c'est clairement pas son sÃ©rieux ou ses aspects techniques. Non. Ce qui fait que les hyperdimensions et autres titres se sont dÃ©marquÃ©s, c'est parce qu'ils accrochent avec leur dÃ©lire de tourner toute l'industrie du jeu vidÃ©o Ã  l'absurde, chaque choix caricatural Ã©tant finement rÃ©flÃ©chi, et massivement poussÃ© Ã  l'extrÃªme. Et ils font rester en dÃ©veloppant une empathie pour des personnages de maniÃ¨re plus ciblÃ©e, en crÃ©ant un lien direct joueur-personnage qui fonctionne, et donne envie de voir le personnage balancer tout ce qu'il a dans des combats toujours plus corsÃ©s, ou face Ã  des boss toujours plus absurdes. 

On y reste parce qu'on y rigole de tout, parce que tout est stupide, pesant et subtile Ã  la fois. Parce qu'on oscille entre l'absence de sens, les running gags, et les piques typiques de la sÃ©rie. On y reste parce qu'on se dit "c'est dÃ©bile, mais c'est si bon".

Et c'est Ã§a qui fait que j'y reviendrai et que je vais continuer Ã  poncer cette pÃ©pite, parce que ouai, j'y suis accro Ã  ce jeu, il m'a eu. Enfin... Noire m'a eu, elle et sa doubleuse... 

Une erreur systÃ¨me a dÃ» se glisser furtivement dans ma vie pour que je tombe sur cette licence et que de furtifs "Nep" rÃ©sonnent parfois dans les mÃ©andres de mon esprit, me conditionnant pour y revenir. Et le plus formidable, c'est que j'y reviens en me disant que c'est un rpg, et que je suis certain d'en ressortir avec le sourire et une bonne humeur communicative qui m'accompagnera toute la journÃ©e. Vous en connaissez beaucoup, vous, des jeux qui vous offrent Ã§a ?

[b] Un petit mot sur le contenu endgame [/b]
Il est Ã©norme. Je l'ai Ã  peine effleurÃ© du doigt, et dÃ©jÃ , j'ai la sensation d'avoir touchÃ© Ã  une crÃ©ature gargantuesque tapie dans l'ombre, prÃªte Ã  avaler mon temps de vie comme un boulimique s'enfile des cookies par paquets de vingt. Et le pire, c'est que je vais le faire. Et ouai, on en est lÃ .

Mon addiction Ã  Megadimension est parfaitement assumÃ©e.

Je me demande si je devrais pas envisager une thÃ©rapie...

author: {'steamid': '76561198401865868', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1702773673}
review:
[u][h1] Dreams are born from chaos, from the beginning to the end of the world. [/h1][/u]

After almost 44 hours I can say I've definitely enjoyed this game and surprisingly been taken on quite an emotional journey through the story. I went into this game thinking it was mostly just anime girls doing cute things while messing around with big bad evil guys and, to an extent, it was that. But despite the ridiculousness of some situations this game managed to tell a lovely story while of course milking every trope, it's a Neptunia game, so of course they will. I never thought a game basically just joking about the Sega Dreamcast would make me genuinely feel for its characters but, hats off Compile Heart and Idea Factory, you madlads did it. Anyway, if you are reading my review and like Anime and JRPGs and also know way more video game and anime references than you should, this game is for you! It provides those and the aforementioned story, so, go ahead, embark on your journey with the protagonist of protagonists and maybe, if you do everything right you will have a happy ending. And you will hear it...

[i]"I'm finally home..."[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198143555704', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1705030680}
review:
Pretty fun as a Nep game and actually a pretty decent JRPG on its own, this is IMO the most polished mainline Nep game, and it's actually really fun to play. The first arc is probably the best thing ever, Uzume's one of the most charming characters of the franchise, and the plot is actually kind of interesting. The difficulty curve is pretty balanced too (barring a single difficulty spike in the mid-game, you don't have to grind too much for it thankfully), although it never gets like hardcore difficult or anything, which might be good or bad depending on your tastes. I would definitely recommend this as a beginner title over any of the Re;Birth titles. Do keep your expectations in check, though; while this game has a lot of different dungeons, some of them do still get reused occasionally, though it's nowhere near as bad as the Re;Birth games. Also beware for the occasional ecchi scene.

Another thing to add; Big Nep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033923352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1642058283}
review:
Absolutely terrible as a JRPG title. It plays like what could've of been good visual novel but did a 180 and decided to be a terrible JRPG instead

*The dialogue is expansive and interesting, so much that it feels like a visual novel being forced into a bland, boring, basic, JRPG. Instead of making me skip 50k words before reaching the first boss, it should've just been a visual novel.
*I like character designs and story from what I have played but that's all I liked.

*Combat is broken, the combo system seems hollow and does little to reward you. "Just spam mana pots and skills LUL" should not be the core and ONLY reasonable combat style.
*The animations (only in combat, the rest are basic visual novel sliding and transitions) are pretty boring and quite disjointed and disconnected so it ruins the flow of combat.
*You inundated by tutorials, even though quite necessary and helpful, ultimately reward with next to nothing.

I don't buy weeb games often but I would've expected at least SOME appeal. I thought weebs buy games like this for fan service or for anime themes but this game lacked so much I jst requested a refund instead.

review: This is the first game that I've played from this series. The story line is easy to follow and is balanced well with various comic reliefs. The turn based game mechanic is fun as characters have various interesting attacks. Great character designs and art style, the characters are well written. Overall, I enjoyed playing the game and would especially recommend this game to people who likes transforming cute anime girls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391394276', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 16577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14680, 'last_played': 1677131508}
review:
Probably the greatest game in the series in my opinion. 
New dungeons for once. The story is a bit mediocre, but quite better than the other mainline games.
Best OSTs and openings

The endgame is pretty shit though. Improper skill damage scaling once you've reached lvl 99, a pitiful 5% XP bonus instead of 75% like in the JP version, and a total of 107B XP required to reach maxed level (10M or 22M XP per metal doggo). Devs were really on something.

[strike][spoiler]also when can Purple Heart strangle me?[/spoiler][/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198328930242', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1637845119}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055181574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 2602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2602, 'last_played': 1489885285}
review:
Oh man Megadimension Neptunia VII where do I even start. Its fantastic, just straight up fantastic. Usually in the Neptunia series you always have to say something bad about the game or tell people that its more niche then anything. But this is the first time id recommend a game in the series to anyone and tell them there are barely any bad points. Its just a high quality RPG that is fun and has a lot going for it.

The game doesn't feel nearly as grindy as anything before. The story for once actually manages to strike a good balance between jokes and serious things happening. The big changes in overall combat and over world gameplay styles keep the gameplay fresh and keep the flashy nature of the Neptunia series. The new characters are fun and unique. And the way the game is shaped it almost never feels like you are staying in the same spot for too long, it refuses to stick with the same and keeps pushing for new and fun things to do constantly.

If there is anything bad I have to say about this game its that to enjoy it the most you have to go through the slog that is some of the earlier Rebirth games. Its fine to play stand alone but I highly recommend playing the earlier entries just to see how much this series evolved and just to get the inside jokes and the overall nature of the game better.

Its peak Neptunia and a great rpg as well. With its price nowadays its an easy recommend to anyone. Its a game that keeps the soul of Neptunia with all its quirkiness, charm and fun and truly pushes it to new levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152669078', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 4427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1653273087}
review:
The best fan-service JRPG and video game franchise is the Gamindustri franchise. Neptune is still the best waifu ever and i never changed my opinion since i saw the anime in 2017. Megadimension VII is probably the best title in the series so far, the story is interesting, brilliant and funny and the fighting system not really changed that much but still feels more polished, and you get a masterpiece like this for only 16.80? Definetely worth it. The fourth wall breaking jokes are amazing and i really hope that everyone try out this franchise atleast once in their life, especially this episode. 

Megadimension Neptunia is not just funny but also a great action-JRPG with thousands of 4th wall breaks and waifu material girls. If you are a weeb this is a must-buy if you are not then this game will be the reason you become one. 

Nep out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198083488873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 5584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5584, 'last_played': 1613227777}
review:
Le dimensioni di Gamindustri sono nuovamente sotto assedio da parte di nuove, oscure minacceâ€¦

La nostra storia continua nel remoto regno di Gamindustri, un mondo che coesiste con molteplici dimensioni, in cui le CPU, potenti entitÃ  guardiane, contrastano le varie minacce che di volta in volta si presentano per portare caos e distruzione nei vari mondi dimensionali, trionfando grazie alle loro abilitÃ  uniche. La Dimensione Zero, una di queste realtÃ , sta per andare incontro alla sua fine per mano di alcune malvagie entitÃ  che stanno distruggendo ogni cosa. La guardiana CPU di quel mondo non ha piÃ¹ la potenza necessaria per affrontare da sola la situazione e grida disperatamente aiuto a chiunque possa essere in ascolto in quei momenti drammatici. Nello stesso momento, nel mondo di Planeptune, la frizzante CPU guardiana Neptune trova un vecchio gioco da console con uno strano simbolo. Pensando di aver trovato un leggendario articolo vintage, decide di portarlo alla sua sorella Nepgear, nella speranza di farlo funzionare di nuovo, scatenando un vortice di energia che le risucchia in una dimensione sconosciuta.

Prepariamoci a un nuovo, incredibile viaggio nelle dimensioni in compagnia di Neptune, Nepgear, Uzume e molte altre CPU che incontreremo nel corso della vicenda, esplorando ambienti ricchi di dettagli, massacrando nuove orde di nemici strani e brutali che cercheranno di fermarci in frenetici scontri 3D a turni, pianificando strategie e mosse, concatenando combo, attacchi di gruppo e tecniche speciali, scatenando nuove trasformazioni per trionfare contro i numerosi e astuti Boss, accumulando esperienza per potenziare le nostre CPU, comprando e vendendo oggetti, armi, accessori, risorse e vestiti per gestire al meglio le varie situazioni in cui verremo a trovarci, padroneggiando un nuovo arsenale di abilitÃ , mosse e sistemi mentre ci perdiamo nelle varie vicende principali, accompagnate da un comparto audio spettacolare. Nel corso della nostra avventura, assisteremo allo svolgersi della storia attraverso splendidi filmati in stile visual novel, alternando momenti epici, situazioni tragiche e siparietti comici, girovagando nelle varie zone delle mappa di gioco a caccia di nemici, missioni e risorse utili per la nostra causa, accumulando punti per poter potenziare le caratteristiche di ogni CPU, con nuovi processori per sbloccare devastanti trasformazioni da usare per gestire gli svariati nemici che troveremo in ogni zona del gioco mentre assisteremo a tutti gli eventi di questo quarto capitolo della leggendaria saga delle incantevoli e potenti CPU che anche questa volta dovranno darsi da fare per salvare i mondi ancora una volta dalle tremende forze del male.

Voto Personale 88/100

review: The only decent mainline game in the series. author: {'steamid': '76561198206094867', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4966, 'last_played': 1625732256}
review:
To be honest this is a good game and its my first time I playing Neptune Series.
All the characters are likeable.
I got good ending at first try, dunno if I should go with my second playthrough to get the true ending.
Then again in my opinion I recommend this game, if you have spare money you can spend into the DLCs.
If you want your game not so broken, you can spend into nightwear pack, swimsuit pack, and the most important is Umio party character is the must. He is the only male playable character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431058501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10324, 'last_played': 1640493844}
review:
With a story that has just the right mix of wacky Gaming Meta hijinx and darkly serious plot, the usual loveable cast and many excellent new cast members, & a refined version of the classic gameplay that rewards intelligent use and ordering of moves, this is the absolute pinnacle of Neptunia, and Magnus Opus of Idea Factory + Compile Hearts. If you intend to get into Neptunia, absolutely, ABSOLUTELY, make sure you play this masterpiece of an RPG. You will *not* regret it.
(...Oh, and be sure to also support the release on Switch, for those of you that have one. May cause more of the series to show up eventually. #Totallynotshilling, lol.)
