author: {'steamid': '76561198036032673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7832, 'last_played': 1620145541}
review:
So this series isn't particularly good to begin with, and I say that as a huge fan of these games. They're an aquired taste, to say the least - About the only games worth playing, in my opinion, are the most up to date versions of the original three Hyperdimension Neptunia games, Rebirth 1, Rebirth 2 and Rebirth 3 (and even then, they aren't that good.)

Oh, but then there's this game.

This game is GOOD.

It very much rises above the mediocre-to-pretty-good-to-suddenly-really-bad swamp that this franchise is seemingly eternally stuck in. If you play one Hyperdimension Neptunia game, make sure it's this one. Some quick positives that help it stand out from the rest:

- The battle system is actually good

- Adult Neptune, the waifu of all waifus is in it

- No stupid Plans system

- New game + is actually good

- There's a very real air of production quality that just isn't present in the original games. Even to this day, the UI, the graphics, the sound design...It's all really good.

- Adult Neptune is in this game. Oh my GOD. Thank you GOD for Adult Neptune.

I've heard the VIIR remake is kinda bad, so play this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257887491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1604355648}
review:
Just like all the other games of this series it has funny dialogue and cute characters with some slightly perverted scenes which they have completely built a following around without actually creating anything else worth calling a good game.

areas reused many many times, palette swaps on everything no semblance of a real story but unfortunately they have a large following of fans that will buy just based on perverted scenes which just perpetuates this kind of bland sub-par crap thats ultimately just hurting the entire gaming industry by lowering the standards of what is passable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057944303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2883, 'last_played': 1591555773}
review:
If you're interested in the series I would recommend playing this one over the others. Plot didn't take itself too seriously, I enjoyed all of the characters and their personalities, and the voice acting is actually pretty good in my opinion. Obviously there's a lot of common anime tropes so if you just physically cringe seeing it on your screen don't get this game. 

The actual RPG part of the game wasn't very difficult but I did enjoy the creative 3D positioning and AoE on attacks. Dungeons are explorable in 3D and also platform-y. They weren't crazily well designed but I enjoyed going through them. The music actually bangs and the soundtrack has bangers in the dungeon themes and battle themes.

I recommend this game but I see it go on sale for 50% or more pretty often and I'd wait for a sale instead of picking it up at $20 since it felt kind of short to me for a JRPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014784364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2072, 'last_played': 1618147456}
review:
I tried to like the game. I really did. The grind lover in me kept going all the way to NG+ and hoping the game would get good. It never did. Maybe if the true ending wasn't so easily missable i would have continued playing because apparently the guild missions from rank A upwards (along with some other stuff) are locked behind that ending and i sure as hell am not going to complete the game a third time. What pisses me off is that i did exactly what the guide told me and still couldn't get the correct ending. 

Other bad things include:
- Bad voice actors and dialogue. Squealing, high pitched anime girls + cringy writing = Constant cutscene skipping.
- Performance issues. It looks like a PS3 game but runs like garbage. Sometimes there are even sound glitches. Good thing i never played with headphones on because that loud, sudden crack would have popped my eardrums.
- First chapter is a tutorial. After that you follow 4 different heroines. Too bad that chapter feels like a tutorial as well. When you finally manage to clear that out of the way, the game finally starts.
- Events that progress the story. Sometimes there are way too many separate conversations you have to go through before you're able to continue. And they can be the stupidest things as well. At some point in the second chapter i started skipping almost everything. I would slow down here and there to follow the story but would soon find out it's the same silly crap only teenagers can enjoy.

Then there's the okay things:
- Combat. Combo system is a nice idea but i feel like it wasn't executed well enough. Most of the time you're just spamming skills and recovering HP & SP somewhere in between. Then there's the different AOE's skills and weapons have. In a way the combat reminds me of Disgaea. Only in 3D environment. And that Disgaea is actually fun. Also Disgaea's special attacks are nice to look at. Most of VII's aren't. You just can't feel the impact they are supposed to give you.
- Soundtrack. Not good, not bad. It plays on the background and that's it.
- All the little things you can do. Investments, route building, scouts, development. Normally i'd love this kinda thing but here it's just bland. They are just there to play around with but nothing ever got me excited and nothing ever gave me rewards worthy of the time i put in.

The good:
- The "Skip" button. It skips and speeds up all the things you don't want to see. And there's a lot of those.

If this is the best Neptunia game out there, i don't want to know how bad the others are. Only buy this from the 7â‚¬ sale if you're a die hard JRPG and anime tiddie fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075089585', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7858, 'last_played': 1613506050}
review:
Easily the best main Neptunia game, in literally every way possible.
The story is very enjoyable and the ending can hit hard if you let yourself in on it. It also is a good 35-40h long if you neither rush nor excessively grind.
Characters: This is what the entire franchise lives off, the blood that flows through the game code. Love them or hate them, by a major chance this will decide wether or not you enjoy neptunia in its entirety. I loved them, every single one, their quirks cause hilarious dialogue.
The visuals are solid, dungeon design can be a bit bland, some assets or layouts get re-used, graphically its good on the eyes though, nothing photorealistic here but that was never the goal with it being an anime game. On the other hand you got the Visual novel aspect and its done neatly, clean textures, fully lip synched, breathing animations, various expressions and poses, a nice presentation.
Sound design is pretty nice, menu sounds can get mildly lame but music is overall very good, i loved most of the soundtracks. The voices are brilliant, i personally prefer the japanese dub because almost every line is voiced in it, the english dub is rather incomplete but wherever present its very good. IMO the japanese dub in particular was so enjoyable, jokes were delivered so well, it had me audibly laughing a number of times.
Gameplay is probably the most encompassing neptunia has ever been. Weapons with combo slots, combos with special effects and chain effects, free range positioning in combat, investment system, travel and ambushes, multiple endings, a story sequence with 4 separated paths and more and more...

Verdict:
Objectively its an above average game with plentiful mechanics and lots to offer to keep the player busy for a significant amount of time, the story offers a very enjoyable time but you need to suspend a lot of doubt and disbelief and really let yourself in on it, if you find typical 'anime' things cringy you're gonna have a bad time.
The characters are the key aspect of this game, and the entire franchise really, wether or not you like them is subjective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299859739', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2078, 'last_played': 1676729149}
review:
Well I bought this because I wanted to finish every single Neptunia Game, it is pretty grindy if you don't buy any of the weapon/armor DLC's. Infact it makes it kind of hard during the whole game. 
Personally the story did not really interest me at all - dialogues were way too long. 
The "3 Chapters" though are a neat thing. 

For me it's an okay-ish game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209294915', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 19005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1631077540}
review:
bought and finished this on the ps4 too,

probably the best neptunia game out right now, better than viir too even though viir is a remake or remaster of this game or whatever this game is still better, the story is good, you have literally 3 whole arcs that's like 3 whole games in one megadimension fits the name perfectly and you have nep nep and friends and so many playable characters in the game, and different endings too unlike viir which only has one ending this one actually has multiple plus the fights are rpg but you don't really have to grind either and the soundtrack is great i love sailing of a daydream

author: {'steamid': '76561197971193297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1469411731}

author: {'steamid': '76561198361008342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 9160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6550, 'last_played': 1687189480}
review:
A bit different from the Re;birth trilogy, but maintains the core element of the aforementioned installment.

The difference in this installment and the trilogy is mostly the stuff that made me prefer this over the other. Of course, there are also some stuff minor stuff that kinda made me have a mixed feeling about this game.

Since the pros are a lot more than the cons, so  I just gotta bring up the cons, or my personal gripe with the game;
You travel from one place to another in the world map instead of instances like in the trilogy,
Characters can ONLY level up if they participate in a battle (or have the skill "EXP share"). This one is the most glaring for me considering that there are a LOT of characters and I would feel cheap if I focus only a couple of them. Again, this is far different from the trilogy in which every character in the party (including reserve party members) gain EXP.
And lastly, for a game that can reach up to level 999, there isn't a lot of method to speed up the process, not even paid DLC. This brings the second issue back to light.

These are the only issues I have with the game.

Other than that, it's a fun adventure with the gang. With lots of stuff to look forward to, especially if you play the other installment before Megadimension.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031225726', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 3531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3351, 'last_played': 1623532676}
review:
Please grab some pudding, as reading may take a while.
The review contains no spoilers, generally.

[i]MDN V2[/i] is a role-playing game, a subcategory from [i]turn-based strategy games[/i][spoiler](this term is less irritating to me at least)[/spoiler] (with elements of a business simulation game, in late game). 

The atmosphere of the game - no matter how you look - fits well with the player during the current Pandemic (2020-2021). 
Overall, I am very pleased that the game has touched my emotions (including: confusion, joy, sadness, anger, euphoria, empathy). There is no despair, fortunately. 

[i]MegaDimension Neptunia VII[/i] belongs to the [i]Hyperdimension Neptunia[/i]-series  of role-playing games. 
 Not knowing the plot of older games does not ruin the fun, because the most important basics will appear. (It may even motivate you to play them.) 

Issues:
* At the begin it is easy: finish a dungeon- unlock the next. In next chapter, you should check (at least) the guild ; 
* I hope for you to be lucky like me and not lose during a Boss-fight-â€marathonâ€  (no saves in between, no item-shop as well. Worst case: any kind of real life interruption) ;
* Unbalanced weight about plot-battles: some 'middle'-plot-fights were much, much more surprising than the finals ;
* Not recommended for achievement-hunters, unless you have a lot time and using guides.

From a technical point of view, I have nothing to complain about.
It's a pity that the dialogues are not having a preview/thumbnail in the playlist .
The girls have great talents ( [i]If you know what I mean[/i]) â€“ waifu material and such.
Last but not at least: The soundtracks -  Fantastic+. Can listen 10h versions of some.

Would I recommend the game ? [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KevvoZY_y0U][b]Absolute[/b][/url]


Credits: 
*[i]Vallinek[/i] - for recommending me . 
*[i]Cbast[/i] - Gift - for my pictures that I drew for him for years and the (2) games I bought.

review:
Rub-a-dub-dub, three girls in a tub.

Except the tub is actually a barrel.

And they make Field of Dreams references.

So yeah, it's pretty great.  10/10, would Nep again. 

Which is good, because that seems to be exactly what CH and IF insist on giving us.

review:
This game is honestly fuckin great! The only Nep game I could 100% recommend somebody play. Wholeheartedly enjoyed it from start to finish. 
It's hard to play the previous titles after playing this one because it's such a step up in quality in every single aspect. It also brings forth a new best girl, Uzume. She's great, and if you say otherwise then fuck you.
It's a real shame there's been no main series games since, because they finally got their act together and made a good one!

review:
More playable than rebirth 1~3. I'd say the game system design has improved. 
But the pc optimization is not really good that I need to turn of DoF and lower 
the graphic quality to minimize the stuttering in some situation.
Overall, this is still a great game if you want to have more nep nep.

review:
I don't know how people played this, but PC optimization is very bad. 
Transition into battles can go down as low as 10 FPS. FPS can also drop to like 48 FPS when you attack an enemy. 
I don't even know how stuff like this got overwhelmingly positive reviews aside from just memes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137293831', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3817, 'last_played': 1622403017}
review:
Best Neptunia game so far.
Good OST, good story, good gameplay.
NEXT forms are cool. Hope they bring these NEXT forms to future installment.
I loved the transition from the 2nd to the 3rd arc and when we have to choose which route to play on (Can do the other route on another playthrough).

author: {'steamid': '76561198012911407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4199, 'last_played': 1600224811}
review: Having played the previous games in the series, I was pretty dismayed at the amount of recycled content in this one. If this had been the first and only game in the series, I might have enjoyed it a little more. Instead, I feel like this is the last game from their series that I'll be inclined to play.Don't get me wrong - I genuinely liked the previous titles, with the 3rd probably being my favorite in terms of gameplay (despite the signs of some recycling being already present). That said, I think the changes and additions in this game were in mostly the wrong places; it very much felt like a "quantity over quality" approach was taken to release this game. There are more glitches and nuisances than I recall previous games having, and eventually they just sap the fun out of the overall experience.I'd recommend skipping this one, especially if you've played the previous games in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116678938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1599375727}
review: I was attracted for all the reviews so I decided to give it a try. i am a kind of completionist, and I usually don't give up on games so easily. I try to enjoy them at its maximum. My conclusion is that the game is only suitable for the fans of the series. I did not see anything overly attracting for playing the game. Too many lengthy, silly, and irrelevant dialogues that make the game really slow. Battles were ok and I agree that it has an interesting battle dynamics. But yet again, the story pace was too slow which made me wonder, why should I invest my time playing this JRPG knowing that there are others much more better and worthy of my time?

author: {'steamid': '76561198075142895', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8212, 'last_played': 1665199726}
review:
Neptunia VII (Or I called it Victory 2) shakes things up from the original game. It was supposed to be split up to 3 games from what I heard in earlier development of the game. But the IF/CH heads wanted to make it into one giant game. So it's kinda like Kirby Superstar Deluxe in a way. Anyways.....

The Good:

Battle System: The battle system goes back to the Rebirth 1/2 system with a bit of a twist here.

3 Games into 1: There are 3 "games" or in this case arcs that you need to deal with. Zero Dimension Arc, Hyper Dimension Arc & Heart Dimension Arc.

Cute Models/Designs: Honestly, I love the graphics on this game. Same goes to VIIR.

DLC Characters: DLC Characters can come really in handy in this game. I recommended getting Umio & Nepgya. They will join you right away at the beginning of the game and can still tag along in the 2nd arc. Which you and whomever you pick will be alone for the beginning for a bit, getting a possible game over if you are not careful. Other DLCs are Nitroplus & God Eater. There is one more BUT... (See the bad)

The Bad:

Neplunker: I HATE THIS FEATURE SO MUCH! I don't mind playing as X character running around. But I don't like lives.....In A JRPG game.....with poor judgement features. Basically if you fall over half of your character's height you lose a life. Which is bad if your favorite character is Blanc, Rom or Ram because jumping basically meaning jumping TO YOUR FRIGGING DEATH.

About That DLC Character....: The other DLC character is Million Arthur. which because Square Enix is a greedy SOB and dosen't want to bargin a deal with IF/CH. The DLC Character is dead. If you are lucky enough to get her when is a avaiable good on you. But if not the only way you can get her is if you can go to another storefront to get her or find somebody who hasn't activived her. If you are lucky enough. (and yes. She not in the NA Switch version either.)

Bad Ending is worthless and a waste of time: Basically what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032045258', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1581513475}
review:
Another entry into the "HyperRecycled Assets" franchise.
You've played this game three times already.
Every dungeon. Every sprite. Every animation. Every joke. Every dungeon, again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979556009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1229, 'last_played': 1627190142}
review: Love pretty much everything about this game besides a few things. First off the controls on pc are complete garbage. Second the combat can get very repetative and traversing the map is quite annoying because weak enemies constantly ambush you or the opposite happens, where enemies stronger than you kill you instantly if you are low on health and you couldn't escape or heal. Going off that, I love when bosses provide interesting and powerful attacks and I don't mind 1 hit attacks or time based party knock out attacks, however, is this game bosses get to use those completely randomly making some fights either, too easy, perfect, a heal fest or impossible. Besides that I love the story and the character and while I don't hate the ideas of the combat system, I just dislike how they where implemented

author: {'steamid': '76561198077688587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1597797157}
review:
Tengo que decir un par de cosas sobre este juego:

En primer lugar es de ataques por turnos y este detalle no viene reflejado en la tienda de steam. Es un genero muy especifico que no gusta a todo el mundo, ya que el ritmo es lento.

Y en segundo lugar es rol japones. Eso significa infinidad de cajas de texto con frases tontas e insustanciales. Que por supuesto solo estan traducidas al ingles y japones. Los nipones son muy tacaÃ±os en este sentido y solo les interesan los mercados de miles de millones de posibles compradores. Para ellos EspaÃ±a, Francia o Alemania son minucias.

Si a esto aÃ±adimos que la interfaz del juego tapa la mitad de la pantalla y los tipicos fogonazos luminicos (esos tan famosos que producen epilepsia y que le encantan a bart simpson) hacen del producto final algo no muy recomendable.

Como resulta que no soy fan del anime, no me siento hipnotizado por las muÃ±equitas siliconadas y sus tetas saltarinas. Que tampoco se trata de un juego porno, solo goza de cierto erotismo.

En resumen el juego me parece Ã±oÃ±o, lento y aburrido.

Tambien senti curiosidad por otro de la saga que es de cortar y tajar, pero los enemigos eran tan ridiculos y pateticos (huevos saltarines tipo angry birds, pero todavia mas simples, bolas con ojos) que rapidamente me desanime y perdi el interes.

Asi pues las calificaciones de juego fantastico, maravilloso, vienen de parte de los fanaticos del anime. Tendencia que es perfectamente respetable. Yo solo pretendo dar una opinion mas neutral.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 2413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1598699485}
review:
I've never played a Neptunia game before but since the franchise is so popular and I love JRPG's I figured I'd give it a try. Neptunia VII (pronounced "vee-two", not "seven"!) seemed like the most polished and popular one out of the bunch so that's what I went with.

I've gotta say I was pleasantly surprised. The writing is really funny and despite the over-the-top moe aesthetic it still doesn't come off as cringe. It can be a bit meta at times and does break the 4th wall occasionally but it's all in good fun. It genuinely made me laugh out loud many times. And the English dub is so good I never even bothered switching to Japanese audio (which is still an option).

Anyhow, Neptunia VII follows your average JRPG formula, it's a turn-based JRPG with numerous story scenes presented in the visual novel format. The game features a large cast of female characters with the main heroines being loosely based on various video game consoles with the protagonist Neptune being a reference to the unreleased Sega Neptune console. The girls can transform into "goddesses" a la Sailor Moon, Power Rangers etc, and this gimmick is important both story and gameplay wise. They all live in the world called Gamindustri and as you can expect the whole thing is chock full of video game references and meta jokes. VII is technically the 4th mainline game in the series (taking place after the Re;Birth trilogy) but the stories are only loosely connected and you can play the games in any order. The game is played in two modes, dungeon crawling and story scenes. The visual novel segments are quite lengthy and feature fully animated HD sprites with full lip sync and even breathing etc animations. But sadly only the main story scenes are fully voiced.

You'd think, so is this just a visual novel with low effort JRPG parts bolted on? Actually, no. The combat has surprising depth. The game has positioning, there are not only different party formations but you can also move freely (within a radius, no action points) during each individual character's turn. There's a quite intricate combo chaining system, as well as your usual skills (epic anime attacks that cost SP) plus buffs/heals and the above mentioned super hero transformations. I have to say, the difficulty is quite high so you really need to learn the system well. Or just [spoiler]buy the OP DLC gear[/spoiler]. It's not uncommon to get 3 shot by random mobs or inflicted with a status you didn't think to buy a cure for. Overall, while it's not Disgaea it's still quite a bit more sophisticated than your usual JRPG.

The only real blemish is the lackluster dungeon design. The level assets range from very poor to decent looking which is a bit jarring. The character models are gorgeous though. Their victory poses are adorable!

[h1]Tech Notes:[/h1]
The game is locked at 1080p no matter the actual resolution, use [url=https://github.com/AterialDawn/MegaresolutionNeptunia]this mod[/url] to either decrease or increase the game's internal resolution. Even if you're playing at 1080p you can set the mod to 4K which will reduce the aliasing and make the game look sharper. I also recommend turning off Depth of Field as all it does is make the game blurry. Installing the game to an SSD will also help to minimize loading times and stutter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095082555', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 2889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2871, 'last_played': 1598053566}
review:
The game isn't perfect, but I still love it. Also, this version is much better than the remaster (VIIR). 

[h1]THE GOOD[/h1]
It has some of the best writing of the entire series, imo. The finale is one of the best in any game in the series, it made me very emotional several times.

Uzume and Umio are great new characters, and the Zero Dimmension is my favorite of the universes in the series.

Great new songs.

Very good combat system. Getting rid of the guard system is a great move, enemy guard was always just sort of annoying in the past and the new system of only having a health bar is much more fun.

Special attack animations are fantastic.

Good endgame activities.

Overall the game makes great strides towards feeling more modern when compared to the previous titles.

[h1]THE BAD[/h1]
The game feels lazy at times, with reused dungeons and animations from the first game STILL making an appearance in this one.

One big example of pointless lazy filler is at the start of the 3rd act when the game makes you redo all of the Gold Third fights for absolutely no reason.

The new random encounters on the world map are horrible and all these fights do is make it unnecessarily difficult to get from dungeon to dungeon. I really miss the old overworld map with the characters that you could talk to.

My least favorite part of the game is how frequently your characters are taken away from you. Your party members are constantly being added and removed, it makes it feel like you never make any progress because all the work you put into a party member is probably just going to be thrown in the trash. You have all 4 CPUs in your party at the same time for like 5 hours maximum throughout the entire 45+ hour campaign.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Very good, but hard to recommend to the average person, as is the case with most Nep games. Only recommended for hardcore Nep fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134300479', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3014, 'last_played': 1611266607}
review:
Compared to the three Re;Birth games that chronologically come before Megadimension Neptunia VII, this game is definitely a step up. The story remains strong like in the previous games, but the game is less grindy, it doesn't recycle as many assets as the three aforementioned prequels and it contains slightly upgraded graphics and great new music. Even so, it seems to struggle with keeping a stable framerate at certain points. 

There's only one other complaint I have about this product, but it only really matters if you've played all the previous games like I have. To someone who's starting off with this game, this will be complete nitpicking and with good reason as it doesn't affect the game that much. Still, spoiler alert (for both this game and previous ones):
[spoiler] I already made it clear how this game is a sequel and this is important because it frequently references past events. In Re;Birth 3 the game had first introduced interdimensional travel, from hyperdimension to ultradimension. Despite this, the writers seem to have silently removed this ultradimension from the frame. The only thing we have in this game from Re;Birth 3 is Croire, but everything else seems to be forgotten. This is quite a shame since at the end of Re;Birth 3 they literally established a permanent gateway between ultradimension and hyperdimension. There was potential to be had here with characters from ultradimension since this game (Megadimension VII) touches a lot on traveling between dimensions. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198013699762', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 3589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3482, 'last_played': 1594935283}
review:
despues de completarlo casi al 100% puedo decir que es lejos el mejor neptunia de la saga principal.
-cuidaron mejor la historia
-tiene un OST tremendo
-me reÃ­ mas de lo que me hizo reir el rebirth 3

lo que le vi de malo es que a diferencia de los anteriores este te limita bastante si quieres ver todo en el juego , basicamente que es complicado llegar al 100%.
Llegado un punto dije "no voy a estar dos horas relogeando para sacar las cartas estas"
Llegado un punto dije "vale la pena armarse estas armas si ya termine todo lo que habia para hacer en el juego?"

Digo que es recomendable terminar el juego en todas sus rutas + cualquier contenido con alguna mini historia para luego dejarlo , no intentes ir por el 100% por que es bastane tedioso , nada que ver con los anteriores que realmente te motivaba a completarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130497925', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 7610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7610, 'last_played': 1566501469}
review: A lot of people look at Neptunia and only see ''haha funny cute anime girl meme game'', but Megadimension Neptunia VII is much more than that, this game is unironically a masterpiece in my opinion, and its easily the best Neptunia game in the entire series. First of all, most people say that you should not play Neptunia for the gameplay, and that its only good for the characters and story, but while this game's gameplay is still far from perfect, its easily the most fun in the series. The story is also genuinely great, and the tone strikes a perfect balance between the silly, cute and comedic moments the series is known for, and more serious moments. The graphics are also much better than the earlier games, that is to be expected when jumping from the Playstation Vita to the Playstation 4, but still, the game looks great. The new characters are also really great, and the soundtrack is easily my favorite in the series. In my opinion, this game is by far the best game in the entire Neptunia series in practically every aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304883040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3217, 'last_played': 1593450338}
review: Okay so after 3 versions of Rebirth, IF finally had the right improvement for the game. The grind (exp and material) are pretty good, interesting and connected stories, the combat also much better than previous versions. So glad they removed the "break" system, feel so bs at times. This is be the best Neptunia game so far for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350610750', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2298, 'last_played': 1670828040}
review:
After playing the whole trilogy of all of the 4 main story games i can finally write a review right here and now (i might copypaste this review to every other game i have)


I can say this series were one of my first anime games i have played in my entire life
since i had to play the first game with a terrible pc but still loved it, had to stop playing the whole franchise for 2 boring years so i can play rebirth 2 and the other games that followed after it.

I have bought 2 - 3 spinoffs games that i will play pretty soon

Im bad at review so this is the best i can do

I recommend this game franchise 100%!

review:
The game is still not fixed.
Basically, the developer released a patch that fixed EXE damage calculation, but only in Japan so the game is still broken in the West. Furthermore, the game has too long visual novel sections and horrible platforming levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139778215', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38940, 'last_played': 1672639038}
review: This definitely the one of, if not the best, Neptunia games to date. The fact that I keep coming back to this game and still enjoying it for the past 2 years really says something. The story is great, with a perfect blend of silliness and seriousness. I'd have to give this game a 9.5/10. RIP OG Vert's English voice actress.

review:
Vale, este juego me ha llevado mÃ¡s para completar el 100% de lo que esperaba.
Solo voy a decir que este es el mejor juego de neptunia (de la serie principal) que hay hasta ahora, increÃ­ble mÃºsica, historia mejor balanceada, mejora en los grÃ¡ficos, pocos modelos reutilizdas (de anteriores juegos)...
Lo Ãºnico que me molestÃ³ es que normalmente tenga lag en los menus. Claramente este juego no esta hecho para tener a un "neplunker", fue desafiante, pero a la vez injusto, no es injusto porque sea difÃ­cil, sino porque no sabes porquÃ© has muerto.

review:
Muhahaha! In diesem Spiel habe ich neben meiner Herzensdame meine zweite groÃŸe Liebe gefunden, die (aufgrund ihrer Nichtexistenz) auch geduldet wird - Uzume! Uzume is love, Uzume is life! <3 Sie gehÃ¶rt mir, meins! :3

Aber um das Spiel an sich zu beschreiben:
ğŸŸ¢ Fantastische Story, man hat sich sehr viel MÃ¼he gegeben

ğŸŸ¢ Sehr schÃ¶ner Kampfstil. Bin ich ja schon von den vorherigen Spielen gewohnt. Rundenbasiert ist generell genau meins, damit bin ich schon bei Final Fantasy aufgewachsen.

ğŸŸ¢ OHNE DLCs ist das Spiel sogar tatsÃ¤chlich sehr schwer. Ich empfehle euch, so wie ich das auch gemacht habe beim ersten Mal die DLCs weg zu lassen.

ğŸŸ¡ VielfÃ¤ltige Charakter-GestaltungsmÃ¶glichkeiten in Sachen Outfits und Accessoires. Manches ist davon zugegeben mehr unnÃ¶tig, als das es einen Nutzen hat, aber das ist ein verzeihbarer Fehler.

ğŸŸ¢ Jede Aktion im Spiel wird irgendwo belohnt und einige Key Items sind einfach nur fantastisch wie der Jumping Star oder der Dash oder eben auch das Verzeihen des Versagens im Neplunker. GroÃŸartig.

ğŸŸ¢ Die Idee der Nextform hat allen Neptunia Fans die Krone aufgesetzt. Geil!

ğŸŸ¢ Die Sha Charaktere sind von der Konzeption her total gelungen. Ebenfalls geil!

â¤ï¸ Wie schon gesagt: Uzume is love, Uzume is life!

ğŸŸ¡ Den Zero Dimension Arc fand ich durchschnittlich bis gut. Die etwas dunkle AtmosphÃ¤re war gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig, aber passend.

ğŸŸ¡ Der Neptunia G Arc war beim ersten Playthrough echt anstrengend. Vorallem, um die True End Requirements zu erfÃ¼llen. Auch haben mich die KÃ¤mpfe gegen S-Sha und C-Sha echt einiges an Nerven gekostet.

ğŸŸ¢ Der Heartdimension Arc war dann aber das Meisterwerk. Man erfÃ¤hrt erst gegen Schluss, wer der boshafte Mastermind hinter allem ist. Sehr geil. 

ğŸŸ¢ Das Kolosseum bietet tolle Herausforderungen fÃ¼r jene, denen der letzte Endboss zu schwach war.

ğŸŸ¢ Es wird ein [b]kostenloses[/b] DLC mitgeliefert, welches die maximale Levelbegrenzung von Level 99 aufhebt und auf 999 erhÃ¶ht. Dazu viel SpaÃŸ im Senmuu-Labyrinth!

[b]Fazit[/b] 
Vollumfassend fantastisches Spiel und eine absolute Empfehlung wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991203754', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1588461034}
review: From the small amount of this game that I played I can tell why the Neptunia franchise is popular. The writing was amusing and the parts of the story that are voice acted were well done. The combat system wasn't very fun however and the menus felt overly complex. So I would say if you are looking for an engaging gaming experience, this game isn't for you. If you are looking for a visual novel with game elements, then I would check this out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055419241', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2144, 'last_played': 1589148481}
review: Last main game in series... It was really good indeed! There is new graphics, some battle system and world map adjustments... but aside from that everything is the same as in the previous games. I enjoyed the story, characters and battle. I did not really like new "path" system where you build and travel on roads and you (yeah that sucks the most) encounter monsters on these roads... I mean it really gets annoying over time... It there were like events or items too... but just monsters... nah thanks! I got normal ending and I am not planning to play again since there was never a reason for me to do so in neptunia games... But still really good experience and another great nep nep game! 7,5/10

review: This was my very first game in the Neptunia series and I can say it was well worth the $20 I paid for it. I am usually a JP Sub person but for some reason the English VOs are good. Kinda sad that they don't voice all the lines in English but I get it's expensive. The graphics are good and the combat system is something new that I like. It has a good story as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082046834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 37228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37221, 'last_played': 1600839229}
review: It fills a hole in my heart. My only issue is that it becomes waaaay too easy and repetitive as the game progresses. Thankfully there's a skip feature for many battle animations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080319088', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1669, 'last_played': 1587494912}
review:
Bad story, non-existant level design, repetitive mission (go to dungeon, go through dungeon, defeat boss), zero variation, way too much story, mostly uninteresting filler trash, almost no gameplay.

I loved ReBirth 1 and 3, but this game is so bad,  I dont even want to write a proper review. I'm very disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110843256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1587068546}
review: I'd recommend this game to anyone who likes strategy games and RPGs. The characters are charming and the story is quite good. Neptunia's combat system is essentially a grid based tactical RPG combined with a standard turn based one, each character having different attacks which have unique traits. Different equipment can alter stats and give unique combo trees.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052479526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2154, 'last_played': 1586059261}
review:
Easily one of the best mainline Nep games I've played yet, and Rebirth 3 was #1 for me right before this. Now, that being said, I don't think I'm going to be able to go back to the original 3 Rebirths after playing this. 

Other than that, Plutia/Vert/C-Sha/Blanc/Nitroplus/Uni are best neps; shame my girl Iris Heart couldn't make it in as DLC!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161658353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1549573448}
review: The last main series game for now. The story for this game is massive and ambitious. Each Goddess has the chance to take centre stage and we are introduced to the fabulous Uzume. The Gold Third characters are all really good and as always there is plenty of humour here and I really hope that they soon make a brand new main series game very soon because this series is the best one I have played in a long time

review: The absolute best main Nep game by a country mile, does a lot to switch up the mechanics of the Rebirth games and the combat asks a lot more out of your combo making and character building than prior games. Story's great, every character gets a chance to shine and Uzume's a cutie. Only real problems are the utter lack of Plutia + Peashy, some annoying switching around of equipment when characters rejoin the party and not having any good ways to gain EXP for super high level DLC colosseum fights.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993847742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2302, 'last_played': 1513206392}
review:
I find this preferable over VII-R mainly due to the character DLC as well as the small things like the monster encyclopedia showing the numerical values of health as opposed to letter rank and it's easier to configure. It's been a while since I last played, but VII-R lacks 2k resolution support, instead going from 1080p right to 4k. Maybe VII has this, maybe not, but that's a gripe I have with VII-R, if not both.

However, VII-R does have some additions like the VR player room, caterpillar system, redesigned battle system in the area of combos mainly, as well as 64-bit and 4k support. I can't say I'd recommend one over the other unless you're a VR geek, or if you, like me, are willing to do without the additions in favor of the extra character DLC and such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137479945', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3156, 'last_played': 1650618279}
review: I really highly recommend this game for Neptunia fans. If ur looking for a good mainline franchice title then this the game for u. I've seen some comparison between this game and the remake VIIR and I think this one is much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059548754', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 6347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6347, 'last_played': 1580860940}
review:
So yeah i think this game is not one of those deep story written RPGs, but is it a good game? id say yes. Megadimension Neptunia story is kinda light but it's enjoyable nonetheless. If you've played previous entries you know you'll see more of NepNep shenanigans, and them 4th wall breaking actions. so heres the breakdown:

Them pros that i felt from my playthroughs:
(+) Fresh new story unlike the usual neptunia troupe (not hating it tho).
(+) They add the scouting system from fairy fencer F, which makes grinding a whole lot easier compared to previous entries.
(+) A simple city management feature.
(+) Improved character models compared to previous entry.

Them few cons that i felt from playing this game:
(-) Damage can be quite unbalance early game.
(-) Most mobs model are just recolor, although there are some new ones ofcourse, but not enough.

on a side note. who thought that adding a platformer in this game was a great idea anyway! sure it's a fresh feature in the neptunia series, but damn....the surface area where you can actually land its tiny AF. Do your self a favor and do the platformer dungeon on the 2nd playthrough, it'll be a whole lot easier. DONT DO IT ON YOUR FIRST RUN!.

...what's that smell? The sweet gacha. oh. it sings to me. THEY ADD GACHA IN THIS GAME!!! its not mandatory for the story or gameplay however IT IS necessary if you're going for 100%. So best of luck! 

All in all Megadimension Neptunia VII is the best series on the entry so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074140026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6284, 'last_played': 1578364092}
review:
Do you want to buy the game?
-> Yes
     No

Nothing much to say, I played re;birth 1,2,3 and this one and I had fun with all of them.
The story was good, characters can be serious or funny tho you'll assist some serious cutscene turning into a comedy thanks to some silly entrance of Neptune and friends. Gameplay is ok but I wished if they would have changed characters skills. Is since re;birth 1 that I always see same characters skill/special or HDD moves! Same with dungeons. I also was expecting to have certain characters back in this game, like Puchiko (Broccoli). For me a Neptunia game without Puchiko is sad! Just beware if you plan to buy it! I think this one contain more ecchi images than other re;birth serie!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996108775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1578167871}
review: Well, found out that this isn't my kind of game.  All you do is stand around with cardboard cut-out characters and scenes?   When I think of RPG's, I picture something vaguely like the earlier Final Fantasy.  I'm not real fond of so much conversation where you sit there and don't interact with the game.  So if you're a fan of this kind of game, then I imagine it's good.

review:
50/100

Game is great while you discover characters , story and mecanics but  it gets quickly boring.

_Too much grinding
_Abusive re use of models and maps ( they just switch colours)
_Characters development is just a mess that just ends anyway by killing an half ton of monsters.
_Boring side talkings.

It 's a bit sad since there s a lot of good ideas of challenges that actually recquires skills and not to spend hours to kill same monsters again and again....

author: {'steamid': '76561198065018206', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2172, 'last_played': 1575814146}
review:
a game made with a soul but without good execution, too much grind for no reason that can be skipped by purchasing overpowered DLCs, Spelunker dungeon is a complete BS due to bad controls, when you unlock new skills previous ones become completely irrelevant, some animations are extremely slow and clunky, overall combat system is pretty shallow too, few good music composition, level design is pretty mediocre at best, overall lack of content, 80% of the game are dialogs, also no postgame content at all

YET i enjoyed it because there are not much this kind of games on the market (radial movement and targeting)

also reading other reviews it looks like all this game's comunity care about is "(any character) hAs A nicE BuTt" "SeEiNg tHeM in BaTh ToWeLS WaS woRTH iT" and half of them didn't even played the game for more then 2 hours, according to steam achivements only 18% of all players actually bothered to finish the game at least for the normal ending and only 27% got to the half of the game

If you want a good turn based JRPG with radial skill targeting and movement go play Makai Kingdom(2005) it has much better level and music design, loads of unique characters to play, loads of weapons and epic skills, interesting characters and tons of other interesting in-game mechanics, also there is tons post game content and etc

author: {'steamid': '76561198077724160', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 3713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3027, 'last_played': 1631150525}
review:
If you want another tale from the Neptunia series, then this game is for you. HOWEVER, if you are looking for a game that doesn't require a super computer to run, has reasonable hit boxes, doesn't have the most infuriating level design ever, and has logical menu systems, look elsewhere.
Story: 9/10
Battle Mechanics: 7/10
Other Mechanics: 6/10
Optimization: 4/10
Level Design: 2/10
I'm a huge fan of everything Neptunia, and this game fits in perfectly considering the story, characters, and all the common themes of the series.
My BIGGEST complaint is the level design. The outdoor levels seemed fine, but the indoor levels were ridiculous. The amount of copy/paste was annoying. I spent 20 minutes lost in one of the old subway stations. I had to screenshot the map of the battleship and mark the doorways blocked with boxes before I realized that I needed a item to break them. Finally, the game became an absolute chore at the end with the blue mazes. Why were those even considered? At least the gold summits had a bit of depth and decoration compared to the mazes.
I'm not sure what engine this game uses, but this game runs worse than every other game in the series. My Core i7 GTX1050 computer struggles to keep [strike]40[/strike] 60 FPS and absolutely tanked if there is any amount of blur. As comparison, I can run Overwatch on high/ultra settings while maintaining 60 FPS even in intense fire fights.

Edit: I figured out my FPS problem. It still struggles, but I can keep around 60 which is my screen's refresh rate anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995197491', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1574130801}
review:
So many 'wrong' decisions. Most useful flags behind new game +. Most equipment/cool stuff behind very end game [evonium] or lucky scouts. Easiest way to get Evonium behind Neplunker. Scouting very unclear (resulting in not knowing you can select all scouts by holding right). I do actually like scouting instead of Stella's Dungeon.

Second arc is such a slog. It's the same game flow four times, with limited resources provided to the player. Split character scenarios require set pieces, not the same set pieces for each scenario.

Games bugged in terms of leveling and skill damage. Apparently the scaling past level 100's broke to the point of making skills useless against the more difficult enemies. Granted those are all the challenges and not related to the game at all (and since the game's got no difficulty options it's moot).

Random Encounters on the world map, no way to turn off until new game+. You can tell they said "Development in re;Birth3 was too heavily used and required. We need to use it less in the next game" But then they tied combos to weapons. So uhhhhhhhhh. Just a gigantic design mess. It shows as well in how badly made VIIR is made. Game just makes me want to play Neptunia Re;Birth 3 V generation again. It's a more complete game which is hilarious in its own right.

OH BY THE WAY. This is a crappy port with load lag on everything because it was designed for the PS4's unified memory scheme and Zero effort was put to make it work with PC's. This is the WORST dump port Idea Factory's made. Which makes sense because i'm tempted to say this is their worse Neptunia. I have never felt such a slog before in playing any of their games.

I haven't even said everything that killed me on the inside but this is what i can think of at the moment. I do like the story though (except for the second arc). It's just.... such a SLOG. Never do random encounters on the world map again Idea, they're not challenging and with heals at every town they're literally just a time drain. YOU KNEW THEY WERE JUST A TIME DRAIN AND YOU STILL DID IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066124777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1699837776}
review:
La saga de Neptunia, cuenta con una no despreciable cantidad de 21 tÃ­tulos en diferentes plataformas, y se ha consolidado desde el 2011 como una apuesta que, ademÃ¡s de llenarse de fan service, ha demostrado poder ser un muy buen juego JRPG, con exploraciÃ³n y una buena cuota de acciÃ³n, seguida por una gran cantidad de fanÃ¡ticos en todo el globo terraqueo.

La historia nos pone en el rol de diferentes personajes, catalogados como â€œCPUâ€™sâ€ que hacen directa referencia a consolas, desarrolladores famosos e incluso el mismo â€œmundoâ€ (llamado Gamindustri), de ahÃ­ los curiosos nombres de sus estilizadas protagonistas que van desde Neptune (Sega Neptune), IF (Idea Factory) o algunos personajes secundarios como Miamoto (que de seguro ya saben a quiÃ©n se parece).

Es un mundo virtual bÃ¡sicamente en donde nuestras heroÃ­nas deben luchar ferozmente contra diferentes entes, tambiÃ©n salidos del mundo â€œgamerâ€, para evitar la destrucciÃ³n de este curioso mundo pero tambiÃ©n de sus â€œdimensionesâ€ alternas.

Si bien suena complejo, no lo es tanto y una vez que te sumerges en el juego, se te hace todo bien natural.

Los personajes son muy carismÃ¡ticos, algo de esperar considerando la base de fans a la que apunta, con muchas situaciones jocosas y divertidas dignas de cualquier animÃ© del estilo, sin dejar de lado los aspectos mÃ¡s â€œseriosâ€ de la historia pues tambiÃ©n tiene situaciones con efectos devastadores para las heroÃ­nas.

Lo anterior estÃ¡ muy bien, no todo puede ser risitas kawaii y felicidad. No obstante, la mezcla entre este tipo de situaciones estÃ¡ balanceada por lo que no sentirÃ¡s que juegas algo que derechamente te llevarÃ¡ a situaciones graciosas o benÃ©ficas para tÃ­ y tu equipo, sino que tambiÃ©n tendrÃ¡s que lidiar con el amargo sabor de la derrota, la desolaciÃ³n y el abandono.

Y ojo, son tres historias diferentes cada una con sus protagonistas y secuencias Ãºnicas, algo no muy comÃºn en este tipo de juegos pero que sin duda le aÃ±ade un gran replay value.

Anteriormente mencionÃ© que las protagonistas se identificaban como â€œCPUsâ€, pues bien la razÃ³n de lo anterior es que, literalmente, eso son; CPUâ€™s materializadas en personajes, cada cual con una funciÃ³n diferente pero con un objetivo en comÃºn que es defender Â«GamindustriÂ».

Gracias a la premisa del juego que te pone directamente en un mundo virtual, tendrÃ¡s la habilidad de utilizar una gran variedad de ataques y poderes directamente relacionados a todo lo â€œcibernÃ©ticoâ€.

Desde las armas hasta sus espectaculares transformaciones (muy parecidas a cualquier animÃ© Magical Girl) para obtener como resultado a una monita china cubierta de una llamativa armadura y que, ademÃ¡s, aumentarÃ¡ sus stats notoriamente.

En general el gameplay es muy similar a lo que es Final Fantasy XII, es decir, con un sistema de â€œturnosâ€ pero que te permite moverte con libertad por el Ã¡rea de pelea. Obviamente estarÃ¡s limitado por el rango de tus ataques y no podrÃ¡s atacar desde cualquier lugar tampoco.

Sin embargo, el juego posee una cantidad no menor de mecÃ¡nicas que te permiten agregar muchÃ­simas estrategias a tus batallas. Entre estas puedes, por ejemplo, asignar a tus personajes en la lÃ­nea â€œfrontalâ€ y â€œdefensivaâ€, lo cual se traduce en ponerlas delante o detrÃ¡s al inicio de cada pelea.

AdemÃ¡s puedes â€œjuntarâ€ a dos personajes para que uno tome el rol de atacante mientras que el otro no podrÃ¡ ejecutar movimientos pero estarÃ¡ ahÃ­ para aumentarle los stats entre otras opciones.

TambiÃ©n podrÃ¡s ejecutar poderosos y visualmente llamativos ataques en cadena o en conjunto, con efectos devastadores para tus enemigos. Como ven, se nota que hicieron con muchÃ­simo cariÃ±o las mecÃ¡nicas estratÃ©gicas del combate.

Otro aspecto que es destacable, es que a pesar de ser un JRPG, los cuales son ultra conocidos por el nivel de â€œgrindeoâ€ excesivo que debes hacer para avanzar, acÃ¡ realmente es super leve y, por lo menos en mi experiencia, no me fue necesario estar horas y horas eliminando monstruitos para avanzar.

Es algo que se agradece porque lÃ³gicamente no a todos les gusta y muchos no tienen el tiempo necesario para hacerlo.

Para efectos de moverte de un lugar a otro, contarÃ¡s con un mapa principal en donde te irÃ¡n guiando segÃºn avance la historia, muy similar a RPGs como Chrono Trigger o Super Mario RPG, aunque con un nivel de exploraciÃ³n menor y mucho mÃ¡s orientado a hacer de esta tarea, algo mÃ¡s sencillo.

Eso sÃ­, tiene una opciÃ³n genial que te permite â€œcrearâ€ caminos hacia lugares alejados, sin importar si ya los recorriste antes o no, lo cual te permite aventurarte a niveles desconocidos aunque bajo tu propio riesgo.

En general el gameplay es buenÃ­simo, se siente rÃ¡pido y estratÃ©gico (sobre todo en las peleas mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles) aunque puede llegar a ser un poco monÃ³tono y quizÃ¡s â€œpredecibleâ€ en las primeras horas de juego, pero tiene mÃ¡s que suficientes opciones para mantenerte pegado al control sin que se vea afectado el nivel de diversiÃ³n.

No hay que hacerse los weones. Muchos caen por la â€œcuriosidadâ€ y las imÃ¡genes NSFW que el mismo juego explÃ­citamente promociona en sus diversas plataformas. La verdad es que bajo mi punto de vista, el juego tiene una cantidad bastante moderada de fan service, sin llegar a caer en lo excesivo o lo burdo.

TendrÃ¡s unas escenas aquÃ­ y por allÃ¡ de monas chinas semi desnudas, pero tampoco es que el juego dependa completamente de eso lo cual es bastante positivo, guardando las proporciones.

Si bien para los que gustan de este tipo de eeeeeeehâ€¦estimulaciones visuales, no se sentirÃ¡n decepcionados y les aseguro que tampoco estÃ¡n puestas porque sÃ­, sino que tienen un propÃ³sito narrativo (aunque suene mula la weÃ¡, pero es verdad).

Bajo lo anterior, una de las caracterÃ­sticas de cada versiÃ³n de la saga Neptunia, es su abundante cantidad de DLCâ€™s estÃ©ticos para complacer a la fanaticada, con muchÃ­simos trajes y cosas para que tus waifus luzcan de la manera que mÃ¡s te acomode.

Si gustas del fan service encontrarÃ¡s mucho, pero tampoco esperes que cada dos diÃ¡logos aparezca algo para que te sangre la nariz pues no es asÃ­ (por lo menos no en esta versiÃ³n).

La mÃºsica es bacÃ¡n. PodrÃ­a simplemente dejar esas palabras y serÃ­a el perfecto resumen de la parte sonora del juego. Hay muchÃ­simos temas que se sienten muy â€œpowerâ€, sobre todo al momento de luchar pero tambiÃ©n hay varios que son bien pegajosos y que aparecen mientras estÃ¡s explorando algÃºn nivel.

Muchas veces me quede apropÃ³sito dando vueltas para escucharlos mÃ¡s detenidamente o para esperar la parte â€œpowerâ€ del instrumental.

Lo grandioso para los aficionados al anime, es que tiene un tema tipo â€œopeningâ€ que estÃ¡ muy bien hecho y seguramente lo vas a vacilar frente al espejo con alguna peluca que le sacaste a tu papÃ¡.

Visualmente el juego se ve bien, desde los efectos especiales de los ataques pasando por el diseÃ±o de los personajes o sus transformaciones.

QuizÃ¡s en este apartado lo que mÃ¡s pobre puede sentirse, es el trabajo de diseÃ±o de varios escenarios, que se sienten muy â€œvacÃ­osâ€ o con poquÃ­simas cosas para interactuar (aparte de los enemigos y los cofres con items).

Megadimension Neptunia VII es el primer juego de esta peculiar saga que he jugado y, a pesar de que tenÃ­a mis dudas y prejuicios, me sorprendiÃ³ gratamente. Lejos de ser solamente un juego (o saga, mÃ¡s bien) que apuesta por complacer a su fanaticada con un fan service de grueso calibre, tambiÃ©n se preocuparon de realizar un RPG que mantiene todas las bases clÃ¡sicas del mismo, pero le aÃ±ade muchÃ­simas caracterÃ­sticas para hacerlo no solamente diferente, sino que tambiÃ©n mucho mÃ¡s disfrutable e inmersivo. Realmente fue un gran acierto por parte de Idea Factory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047973634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1571565663}
review:
This one pretty much forces you to grind a little bit as you progress. VII also have many fights in early game where you have to use only one-two character in a party, so it can get crazy pretty quick. The plus side is, there is not much difficulty spike mid game compared to previous games where it suddenly force you into crunch mode to grind levels against roadblock bosses (like Killachine). 

The game does need a steep upgrade of hardware, it does have some bloom effects that may require better GPU than previous games. 

Also this game has the BEST villains compared to previous game, I even end up rooting for one of them. You know it when you play it, so please buy VII if you enjoy nepnep games.

The bad? There is no "One Two Three" soundtrack in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047342667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3500, 'last_played': 1617421823}
review:
So this is my first real Neptunia game I beat, and I loved every minute of it. I love big developed characters (like Vert) and this game has plenty of eye candy like that. The combat is pretty fun, but feels kind of easy? The story is fun, charming, cute and actually well developed too, I think the pacing was well made. There could have been more extra stuff to do, like mini games, but I have a feeling this company is a little smaller than per say square enix, so what they have, they tried their best to make well with the time and people they have.

After being done, I felt myself wishing this series would go all out and make a seriously amazing game that pushes the graphical boundaries. Make a game where it is always the 3d models talking to each other, and have 2d models like they do in 'Tales of' games.

8/10 (The real question is, can they really do better than this game or 4 goddesses online or is this what we can expect of every game to come in the future?) (pick up 4 goddesses online if you haven't and liked this game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198213121957', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4897, 'last_played': 1568210810}
review:
Neptunia VII is the latest canon Neptunia game and a real step up from the previous games. While all ReBirth games look somewhat similar and share game mechanics, VII is like New Neptunia V2. Is that a good thing or not, I'm not entirely sure. Neptunia VII has it's ups and downs, and I'm gonna go over the biggest things that affected my experience.

[b] + I love guitar shredding [/b]
Soundtrack in Neptunia games was always on point and this entry certainly kept it up. The battle music just rocks and, as a guitar player, I can appreciate a cool shreddy solo. The location music fits really well, too.
[b] + Dream Theater makes me cute overload [/b]
Neptunia VII has a lot of new characters. They're all unique and interesting, and I liked the interactions between them.
[b] + Nep has never looked better [/b]
The game features new sprites and overall graphics. The sprites are kawaiier and the dungeons look cool with that bloom filter. HDN now stands for High Definition Neptunia. Your fps might drop cause it renders in 1080p but it was fine for me.
[b] + Don't let your dreams be dreams!!!! [/b]
The story is really epic. It features dimension traveling, reoccurring antagonists and the power of dreams and friendship. Especially that last one - the power of dreams is actually OP in this game.

[b] - Bring back Stella's Dungeon [/b]
VII features a new big gimmick, which was already in the previous games but was only a side thing you could do, the Scout System. Essentially, you send out scouts to different dungeons to find new dungeons, resources and more scouts. And you have to wait real time minutes until they return. I'm all about quests in Neptunia and that's why I hated this new system - quests require discovering all this stuff with scouts and it's really annoying to wait that much. The Scout system also replaces the hidden treasures mechanic in ReBirth - you get them through Scouting now. It was a mistake, in my opinion.
[b] - I know RPGs have random encounters on the world map but not like this [/b]
The world map has been reworked and it now looks like a tabletop game. There's no means of fast travel and the map is really big, so if you wanna get from one side of map to the other, it'll be long. Not because you're slow but cause there's a lot of random encounters. Since I had to travel a lot while doing side stuff it was really annoying.

Disregarding the whole Scout system, the game is great and I really enjoyed it. 10/10, Big Nep fanservice > everything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026883131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9514, 'last_played': 1564533157}
review:
A PG-13 rated, waifu filled cute-fest. Grindy only if you are looking to get all the steam achievements (I did). Good game for mindlessly wasting an afternoon. Bad game if you are looking for plot, character development, or meaningful game play.

This is the only Neptunia game I have played and it looks to be one of the better ones based on reviews I have read. 

After hearing the word "Nep" about 787 times, I think I finally got the joke: Its a Neo-Marxist commentary on the possibility of using men as a form of currency in the post-Amazonian society that Gamindustri clearly represents. Very tongue in cheek stuff that although I wouldn't personally support, I am glad there is a dialog about.

Nep, Nep

author: {'steamid': '76561197978459575', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 4548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2743, 'last_played': 1673828126}
review:
I played VII after finishing VIIR, and I think VII is superior.

First of all, you can force VII to play in true 4K. Running in borderless matches the resolution to your desktop resolution, and the megaresolution mod allows you to force an arbitrary render resolution. As a result the game looks far better than the other Nep games, which are all forced at 1080p, and this includes VIIR. 

They attempted to improve the battle system with VIIR, and while it might technically be better, it still isn't good and the expense is that battles can't be cleared nearly as quickly. On of the defining attributes of these games, the thing that made the series popular following the awfully slow original Neptunia game, is that fights can be cleared relatively quickly. After all, you're just playing these games for the scenes, right? 

Let me be honest in that regard, too. Either version of VII is hobbled simply by having a worse script than Rebirth 3/V1. These games rely on the cast for setting up comedy and this game does everything it can to avoid comedy. Rebirth 3's cast involved the main CPUs, Plutia, Nepgear and mini-Histy; those characters have synergy and great comedy potential. Rebirth 2 was poor because the main cast had very little comedy potential or synergy. VII mixes things up but never satisfies.

edit: the one massive downside VII had is the random encounters on the world map. This is so bad that I don't understand how they kept it in the original release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979935608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1658760975}
review:
First Neptunia game, and I gotta say, I'm in love with this franchise now.

Light hearted, deep combat, funny, good story, very unique lore, great animation(s), overall good voice acting.

Probably gonna buy all of them ASAP. I regret putting it off for so long.

Most people seem to suggest getting this version of V II over the other, though I'll probably get the other version a bit later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088517355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11652, 'last_played': 1672463554}
review:
First Neptunia game I've played and after playing the Rebirth games, I have to say that this is easily the best game in the series.

If you want to get into this series, this is a good starting point as it fill you in in the stuff that happened in the Rebirth games without spoiling it too much. Though would still recommend the rebirth games 2 and 3 for the story and 1 for the characters (it's story isn't canon). 

The games canonically goes in this order: Rebirth 2> Rebirth 3> Megadimension.             
 
As someone that played the Blazblue games, I am used to the visual novel style of storytelling but unlike that game, this game is driven by the characters themselves. The mood often shifts between serious, emotional and silly depending on the situation and the pacing is dictated by the protagonist (ex. story starts to drag a bit, Neptune tells a joke to keep you interested). The story doesn't take itself seriously so expect casual fourth wall breaks, hilarious and heartbreaking moments, as well as game industry jokes and references. The introduction of Uzume as the protagonist of the game is handle really well. It is split into 3 arcs with each having their own menu and opening (it was originally suppose to be 3 different games but decided to combine them into one) and have multiple endings.      

The gameplay is unique compared to other JRPGs but is usually secondary to the story. You can freely move around in dungeons with your selected leader with the options of fighting enemies, finding treasure and if part of the story, an event point. There is also a save station as you can't save at any point in the dungeon. The combo system was a blast to fiddle with as you are given many combos to choose from (depending on character level and weapon equipped) and some having battle conditions that when met would result in an auto critical. You have the usual skills, items and the super EXE move. The animations are a lot smoother than the Rebirth games (though there are some that are done better in the rebirth games) with new ones added/replaced such as a transformation sequence, a redesigned non-HDD superior angel formation attack, etc.           

Characters are fully customizable with some able to "transform" to HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form with increased stats and introduced another form in which you have to see for yourself. You can choose a max of 4 characters to fill the front and back lines of a team and can be switched in battle. Their battle Formation can also be adjusted to your liking. There is also a lily rank and challenge system, giving a reason to switch leaders as well as to encourage it use of its mechanics and buff up characters.There is some strategy involved as one wrong move could put you in a tough situation or a team wipeout.

One thing to know that is in most Idea Factory/Compile Heart games is "back attacks" where striking an enemy from behind would do more damage then facing it head-on.   

The soundtrack is definitely a step up from the rebirth games with great tunes like "Encounter of Destiny", "Voltage" and the transformation theme "Will be Venus"         

The only issue I have with this game is that the level progression between story missions is too fast as I end up over-leveling quite often. Edit: After playing the PS4 Version w/o non stat boosting DLC, The game does provide a decent challenge on the first playthough especially if you aren't prepared to take on a dungeon.            

Would recommend playing this over VIIR as that game didn't really add much to the story and visuals, has one ending and excluded the DLC characters of this game. 

To this day I'm still in my second play-through going for the true end and doing Colosseum battle with my first playthough with the CPUs, candidates, and a hand crafted A-Team (Uzume, S-Sha, C-Sha, and Nitroplus)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124455026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4590, 'last_played': 1652289514}
review:
This is my favorite game ever, but I'll keep it objective.

Pros:
-------
-New music is great
-Battle system is the best in the series
-Next forms
-Adult Nep
-New characters are great
-Adult Nep
-Map system is better
-Story is the best since the original HDN on PS3
-
Cons
-------
-Platforming still sucks (Look at Neplunker)
-Reused content
-Removed useful plans like Destroy Symbols (correct me if I'm wrong if something similar to Destroy Symbols is in the game.)
-Content locked behind RNG (Scouts.)
-A bit grindy at times[spoiler]The bossfight against the 4 CPUs[/spoiler]

Even though I have serious gripes with this game, I feel the positives mostly outweigh the negatives. Perfect for fans of the series, but if you want to start in the series, start with Re;birth1 or 3

Overall:

9.5/10

review:
I've only played the 3 rebirth games and this is the best nep game so far.
- better game play (exe drive formation attacks, exe drive no longer costs sp).
- better and more interesting stories than the rebirth games.
- nep!
Only negative so far is that it is annoying to walk to different dungeons on the overworld map because of the random enemy encounters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006359765', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 5847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5550, 'last_played': 1562562196}
review:
TL;DR rundown: 
10/10, would Nep again. Absolutely recommended. Considered one of the best Nep games to date for good reason.

Pros:
- Graphics, sound and music improved from Re;birth. Lot's of improvements all around
- Combat feels much better coming from Re;birth
- Story is fantastic, Uzume is pretty cool
- You can play as Nepgya!
- More waifus for your laifu

Cons:
- Frames take a hit as monsters load in on some maps
- Can't disable the sounds of scouts returning good lord IF please why would you do this
- Noire doesn't "Yay!" when she jumps anymore

author: {'steamid': '76561198111355675', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4035, 'last_played': 1558911687}
review:
Overall, I highly recommend Victory 2, especially if you have gone through the Re;Birth triology. It offers fresh, new gameplay and content that is definitely worth your time.

Victory 2 is the best installment in the series by far. With a much more impressive soundtrack, more freedom with combo creativity, and additional quality of life changes, such as being able to instantly respawn mobs, Victory 2 has made a better impression than any of the previous Re;Birth games. 

Characters beyond Neptune are given more screentime, with each CPU actually receiving their own arc in one of the chapters. (Nepgear is treated better in this game too!) Although the Neptunia series is not well known nor really played for its storylines, Victory 2 does a good job of creating a heartwarming plot with actual advancements (Next Forms). with seriousness comparable to that of Re;Birth 2. 

Finally, the difficulty of completing all the achievements in this game is significantly harder due to the RNG aspect of CPU Chips and the lack of a map for Senmuu Labryinth, but it is very much still doable.

The game is not without its faults though:
[list]
    [*]Scouts do not continue when the game is off
    [*]Neplunker deaths seem to be dependent on character velocity. Jumping from a tiny cliff onto the ground can instantly kill you, which is more apparent in Neplunker Zero after grabbing the first extra life
    [*]When doing consectutive symbol attacks, missing your out of battle initial swing will reset the counter. Getting a certain flag item can solve this problem though
[/list]

Of course, these points only matter if you are aiming to complete all achievements.
