author: {'steamid': '76561198255905725', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3906, 'last_played': 1533158532}
review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Story: Good and very funny
+ Story: Lots of references
+ Replayability: Carry over lots of stuff. Different endings.
+ Music: Amazing battle music.
+ Graphics: Good looking animations
+ Franchise: Coming from Re;Birth3 this game improved a lot in various areas, such as graphics, UI, scout system etc. 
+ Game Mechanic: Fun battle system, but gets dull
+ Game Mechanic: It is now possible to skip the dialogue entirely (I used it on my 2nd playthrough to get the achievements)

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Game Mechanic: Skills are pretty much useless from midgame until endgame
- Music: Some music pieces are really weird for my taste.
- Game Mechanic: Janky jump and run part (only two levels, which are mandatory, if you are going to get all achievements)
- Game Mechanic: Unnecessary random battles
- Graphics: Reused a lot of stuff (dungeons, stuff from earlier games etc.).

author: {'steamid': '76561198113969473', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2498, 'last_played': 1533162146}
review:
Ok the first thing I NEED to say is that the soundtrack is AMAZING! The best in the series so far, no doubt.

There are a few things about this game I didn't like, but all in all it's probably the best HDN game in my opinion.
- Most diverse dungeons
- most interesting story
- most diverse combat system
- different dimensions add a lot to the game
- very interesting characters,
EVERYTHING was more interesting than in the previous games, and I enjoyed them too so that tells a lot

Then to the 2 downsides
- The new map system and route building. It feels like they put it there just cause they wanted to add something new. But it was so unnecessary! Now the system is just annoying. Especially because of the random enemy encounters. You gotta go from one dimension to another all the time, and sometimes you get random encounters in EVERY step. that's just annoying, cause they're mostly low-level so you don't even gain any EXP
- No Plutia :( Hyperdimension neptunia re;birth 3 was my favourite before this, cause Plutia is an amazing character. I hope they bring her back.

So yeah definitely the most enjoyable game in the series. They also explain everything in a way so that a player understands the story even if they haven't played nepu games before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133871981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4454, 'last_played': 1556999579}
review:
As of writing this I have not beat the game yet. But that will not stop me!
As a newcomer to this series, albeit seems late to me but whatever, I can recommend
this game from what I have played so far. 

If you are new to the series I recomend playing the games in order. It'll help understand 
what happens in Megadimension. Seems late to write a review but eh.

This games story is decently long. It's a trilogy basically. But it's a pretty good story.
It's an improvement from the other games. Though they need to do something new
for the series. Out of the 4 main games this one is towards the top.

The combat is slightly different but basically the same thing as the other games.
It's simple to understand and easy to master.

The soundtrack is amazing in Megadimension. It improved from the other games.
The other games have good soundtracks to. But this one takes the cake.

The levels are simple enough. They added a decent amount of new ones on top of 
also using the older ones too. Which makes sense since the land in the game doesn't
really change.

Levels, your characters level not the level design itself, don't seem to be that much of a problem during the first 2 parts but should still be focused on. Towards the end of the second part and the beginning of the third part the 
monsters get tougher it seems. So getting those levels up would be good towards that point.

The graphics improve in this game while also retaining the same concept they were going for.
I've noticed a change but I'm not good with the small details that get improved.

All in all this game is an improvement from the others. I can recommend this game with confidence
that I won't be disappointed with the ending when I get there. Well, both the endings. Sorry this is long.
First review I've ever done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381876384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1505777702}
review: Megadimension Neptunia VII is a very very, fun game to play. Neptune and Nepgear got sent to another dimension by a werid item. They met another person named uzame, another goddess called Orange Heart. Uzame helps Neptune and Nepgear find their way back to their basailicom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066266554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1532035472}
review:
As sad as it is for me to downvote something in this franchise, I feel I must.  While it is the "fourth" game in the chronological sequence, the gameplay is massively different.  It feels as if they sacrificed what has been the natural order of the series for a lil gloss.  I guess it'd be easier to post pro's and cons.

[u]Pros[/u]

Remains true to it's pop culture 4th wall referencing
Graphics don't look to shabby
Lots of DLC stuff to add some spice to the game
Tons of fan service (if your into that sort of thing)

[u]Cons[/u]

Auto equip (oh how i hate thee).  Everytime a new character joins, or rejoins, it's gonna happen

Volume Normalization!!!! The "victory music" after winning a battle, is at least 3 times louder then any other setting in the entire game.  I've spent a lot of time tweeking different setting, and NOTHING changes this.  Additionally, when you hit monsters it sounds like they're screaming in Uzume's bull horn.  This you can turn down, but unfortunately means you pretty much won't be able to hear any lines during cutscene's.../golfclap.  If you play using a headset/phones either be prepared to mute it, or say goodbye to your hearing.

EX system nightmare.  In this version you pump and dump EX meter like the wolf of wallstreet did with stocks.  Note that it resets EVERY battle so yeah.  Also means you got to build up just to transform...but that leads me to the next portion.

CPU transformation costs shares.  IDK who's idea it was at IFI to do this...but they should be fired....out of a cannon....into the sun.  Seriously the transformative state was a key element in other games, and now your penalized for it...brilliant.

EXP.  EXP....EXP.  Got the DLC's?  up to 999 huh, good luck.  For one, only your active party gains experience (not any of the characters set in your lily formation OR any inactives).  So yeah your grinding max four characters at a time...to 999.  There are 2 character's that have the ability called "Learning" that can, and with chips you can make discs that have it, but seriously it shouldn't even be a thing.

Honestely, after 10 hours, I really don't even feel like continuing with the game.  I'm no where's near done, but it feels like such a complete let down.  This game had so much potential, but completely missed the mark.  I honestly hope that IFI unscrews the pooch, and if another one in the series comes out, that it's more like the others in the series and not this flopper.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035124714', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'playtime_at_review': 8643, 'last_played': 1711570799}
review: Best game in the Neptunia series so far. Megadimension improved on everything from the Re;birth titles; the music is phenomenal, battle system got more depth and had a completely new type of battle added. There's also more characters, attacks and forms than ever and the graphics are beautiful. The game also has also a perfect story, providing a good mix of serious and funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307870143', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 5636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5117, 'last_played': 1613284271}
review:
So
This series will always be my favourite game
after like 600 hour of rainbow 6 siege and 400 hour of csgo

you're such a dick

author: {'steamid': '76561198057219226', 'num_games_owned': 1390, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 7820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1543776696}
review:
As warning: The game seems to use same awful engine that Fairy Fencer Advent Dark Force used. This means that the wrong eyglasses simulator is back. Quite shamelessly the pictures seen above on product page aren't even from in-game and any gameplay video isn't featured! You know it's bad if pictures must have a disclaimer...

If you want to have a good aproximation of game's true appearance, borrow eyglasses from your friend or just look through bottom of a pair of drinking glasses. 

If you can cope with that, you can ignore the previous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962808938', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2255, 'last_played': 1540943456}
review:
[h1] Quick summary as pros vs cons : [/h1]
(+++) Very fun story and characters, especially if you're into anime
(++) 2D art looks great, again especially if you're into anime
(++) Great voice acting in both languages
(+) Combo system is the one good part of the combat

(---) Gameplay lacks meaningful strategy : the bigger numbers win.
(--) Very grindy as a result : if you can't win, you just must gain levels
(--) Very few enemy types with no meaningful behavior differences
(-) 3D is subpar in comparison to the 2D

[h1]Long text version : [/h1]

It's one of those games on which I have conflicting opinions... I really love some parts, but I also truly hate a few specific points.

As an anime enthusiast (technical term for "stinking weeaboo") I am having a lot of fun with the story, which is full of meta and 4th wall breaking jokes about anime. 
The voice acting is excellent and the 2D art looks great. Basically all I love about the medium of anime, with an extra layer of gaming jokes. 
Truly fun stuff here. In fact I haven't laughed that much in a while.

But this game also has a serious flaw for me, and it is that the gameplay kinda sucks, and that's mostly because of balance issues and a lack of strategic options that feel meaningful.

The game throws at you random bosses that will just spam their special moves and leave you no option to adapt to them. Skills that slow the opponent or increase your defense have almost no effect. There is also very few options for buying equipment and its effect on your effectiveness is also limited. 
Characters only have a few special moves, and the only ones that are useful are basic healing and moves that deal more damage. Status effects are almost meaningless and there is no option to adapt your gameplay to the boss.

I almost gave up at that boss named S-sha, who kept spamming her special move and destroying me over and over again. 
Using a defense buff changed nothing. Debuffing her also had very litte effect, making me realize that my character skills were pointless. Only raw damage, bigger inventory, and higher EXP level really matter to beat the hard guys. 

All of those are the result of grinding.
Strategy is basically useless. And that ISN'T good game design. 

I might have missed something, but in my experience teh only way to beat a boss is to grind like an idiot for hours, or to buy overpowered DLC items. But there are just no tactics : only grind and brute force will move you forward, which isn't very interesting at all.
It's a shame, because some ideas like the combo system had potential to spice things up, but they don't really truly matter in the end.

On the flaws side, I will also point out the lack of enemy variety, and the fact that the 3D doesn't really live up to the 2D : the 2D is above average, when the 3D is below it. Not a big problem, but still a valid point to criticize.

The funny plot, great 2D art, and superb voice acting are definitely enough to keep me interested, though, and I truly intend to play until the ending. 
Just because of that I'll favor a blue thumb over a red one. But I hope this review will help you see the mixed bag that is this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135961937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2371, 'last_played': 1530386553}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII, sin duda uno de los mejores titulos de la saga y un juego muy disfrutable a nivel general. La historia es divertida, los personajes agradables, la jugabilidad comoda y el apartado grafico es muy bueno. Pero seria mejor entrar un poco mas en detalle.

[h1] LA HISTORIA [/h1]

Seamos sinceros, los juegos de Neptunia no te van a contar una historia que te vuele la cabeza pero tampoco te va a aburrir. En esta nueva entrega, se presenta el juego con 3 Arcos. Zero Dimension Z , Hyper Dimension G y Heart Dimension H. De los tres juegos anteriores, sin duda este juego tiene la historia mas interesante pero el jefe final,  [spoiler] Dark Uzume [/spoiler], deja mucho que desear. Las Gold Third rompen un poco con el esquema de villanos en los Neptunia y la gente de Affimax son villanos muy caristamisicos. Sin duda, la mejor historia de los Hyperdimension Neptunia. 

 [h1] LOS PERSONAJES [/h1]

Las CPUs y Candidatas: Todas tienen un pequeÃ±o crecimientos como personaje y se las conoce mas a fondo. No hay mucho que destacar.

Uzume: Sin duda, el mejor personaje de esta entrega. Con un transfondo interesante y un fuerte sentido de la justicia. Me gusto mucho como se esfuerza para parecer genial pero deja escapar su lado tierno de vez en cuando, porque, en el interior, sigue siendo una niÃ±a. 

Ultra Neptune: Uno de los personajes mas flojos de la historia. Literalmente, Neptune Mk2.

Gold Third: Presentaron un estilo de "villano" muy refrescante para la franquicia. No fue el tipico "Voy a destruir Gaminustri, porque soy un villano generico Muajajaja". Sin mencionar que cada una tenia una personalidad muy agradable, miedos, ambiciones y transfondos. Algunos muy peculiares (S-Sha) y otros algo vagos (B-Sha).

[spoiler] Dark Uzume: Sin duda, de los peores villanos de la serie. Es una Rei 2.0. Podria haber sido cambiador por la misma Arfoire y el resultado seria el mismo. [/spoiler]

[h1] EL GAMEPLAY [/h1]

En este apartado hay cosas buenas, como malas.

[b] Lo Bueno [/b]

La perdida de Shares con el daÃ±o, las derrotas y las transformaciones. (Te hace no spamear el HDD y tener mas cuidado)
Las formation skills (Te hace pensar mas en la formacion de los personajes)
Los combos (Da mas variedad segun que necesitas y no solo spamear el ataque con mas potencia)
Las peleas gigantes (Divertidas mecanicamente pero faciles)
El break de objetos (Un detalle agradable)
El break de armadura (Da mas estrategia en los combates)
El nuevo sistema de Coupling (Lo mismo de arriba)
La poca necesidad del grindeo (Con la correcta estrategia no te va a hacer falta)
La eliminacion de los planos de dungeon. (Hace el platinamiento mucho menos tedioso)

[b] Lo Malo [/b]

Los scouts (El ruido que hacen cuando se completa es muy molesto y tedioso ir a una ciudad para reclamarlo)
El regreso de la barra EXE (Baja mucho la dificultad del juego)
Los personajes que no entran en pelea no ganan EXP (Se puede solucionar con los Disc.)
El mapamundi nuevo (El transporte es muy tedioso)

[h1] OPINION [/h1]

El juego me encanto, me enamore de Uzume (Aunque no supera a Uni #UniBestoWaifu), me encanto Steamax y su historia con el general y me perturbe al ver a Blanc Version ThunderTits. Mi juego favorito de la serie sigue siendo el Re;Birth 3 y me decepcione un monton al ver que Plutia y compaÃ±ia no hicieron una aparicion, a pesar de que se dan pistas de que Ultra Neptune viene de la Ultra Dimension (Por eso el "Ultra"). Me siento completamente satisfecho con esta compra y sorprendido de que mi tostadora lo haya corrido sin problemas. Si te leiste este testamento y todavia no te decidis a comprarlo significa que falle en mi mision :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198200519807', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 54347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4023, 'last_played': 1553519943}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII, the fourth main series from Hyperdimension Neptunia. Many improvement were made in this series, like a story, character, world map, menu, and other components.

+High tense story, but of course nep's joke still included in this game.
+This one is the most challenging from all nep series, especially after finish the Zero Dimension.
+New area and level design. Some monsters still using the previous version. But the big boss is very big this time.
+Neptune become adult !!! And some new waifu appear in this game (Uzume and the others).
+Our goddess got the second transformation, really cool.
+Awesome graphic, animation, and soundtrack.
+7 Steam Trading Cards are available with high price.

Amazing, awesome, incridible, wonderful, magnificent, breathtaking, impressive, excellent.
Really recommended for nep lovers: nepsy/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198825889735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4721, 'last_played': 1552942415}
review:
This is a very interesting JRPG with a complete story. Nice music, cute animations and characters, and a proportional leveling system, where persistant grinding is not needed to go through the story. The in-game jokes are pretty meta (however, there are a lot of references only gamers and those who understand game developing history in Japan would know) and the English translation is not broken. Voice acting in English sounds weird, but this can be fixed by using the Japanese voices toggled from the settings.
I spent 70+ hours on this now, and it never gets boring. There is a progession in difficulty (leveling) only for non-main story dungeons, so gameplay is not stressful. I like the fact that you can choose between 11 characters (16 with DLC) and play around with different abilities, and a very simple crafting system. Battle scenes overall are not spectacular and attack animations seem to lack the action it deserves, but are still fun to watch. Hail the skip button for skipping lengthy battle animations too!
My only complaint is that FPS drops and the game becomes laggy at 2 specific dungeons (Sakura Row and another similar dungeon), which outs me off from exploring through them. Some battle transitions are slow too, but it is not a big issue.
If you like JRPGs and cutesy fun, with little stress, this is recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991157647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2343, 'last_played': 1532978980}
review:
Holy fricken crap. This game took me by surprise. It's actually a serious RPG with greatly improved gameplay elements and story telling over the previous games. Now the previous games focused 100% on comedy for the most part but this game has added emotions and feels beyond anything the other games ever did... minus the bad ending in rebirth 2 maybe lol.

I already loved the characters but this game has made me REALLY love them a lot because the writing is just so good and the gameplay is just so awesome, even jumping is required now.

I seriously cannot recommend this game enough. Even if you never played the previous games you can still get into this with minimum knowledge of what happened in the other games though you might miss some of the inside jokes and a few references.

Graphics are significantly improved

There's more dub voice acting lines compared to the previous game

Many new levels designed to feel like full dungeons rather than a straight 1 minute shot to the event marker.

Improvements in animation quality.

The ability to make you love these characters even more than you already did. There's so much more emotion in this game and they all feel so real opposed to comedians in the previous games (Which was no problem I'm just saying).

I really don't have anything negative to add to this game but I feel I should say something so I don't come off as a rabid fangirl:

There are some parts in the game where you literally need to grind 3-5 levels in order to beat the boss cuz the boss will one shot you and you really can't do anything about it so you go gain 2 levels, suddenly the boss is a joke? Really weird but that's how it is lol. It wasn't a big deal until when the story branched off into 4 routes... I had to perform this level grinding for all 4 routes and it got to be super tiring.

No Peashy and Plutia except as scouts in the DLC =(

I'm having trouble finding negatives... I can't even begin to express how much I have falling in love with this game. Sacrificing sleep, going in to work tired. This is by far the best game in the Neptunia series and one of the greatest visual novel / RPGs I've ever played. I hope they make more like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072509568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1529309161}
review:
Honestly this game and its series rejuvenates my faith in the games industry. While western games are trying to be oh so mature and shit, this game parodies it all including itself. It is a wonderful and hilarious breath of fresh air with fanservice and neps galore! 

Nep/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198263763942', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1539567847}
review:
What I could say? It's amazing how immersive the experience are in that game.
The history is rich in the "funny" subject, full of positive vibes, that makes you chill while playing, full of emotion parts, that make you almost cry of joy and that new Battle Mechanic and enhanced graphics, makes the whole experience unforgotable
As a fan of the franchise, I highly recomend that game, if you have a fee experience on the franchise history, but, if you are new and never know of that game before, i'd say, try Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth 1 first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043618434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 11180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10268, 'last_played': 1590864771}
review:
I give this game a 7/10.

*sigh*

I [i]want[/i] to give this game a better score.  I [i]want[/i] to give this beautiful, [i]wonderful[/i] game a 10/10.

But I can't.  Because of Neplunker.

Allow me to explain.  Neplunker is, ostensibly, the game's nod to the game [i]Spelunker.[/i]
However, it comes across as a reference to either [i]Dark Souls[/i], [i]Super Mario Sunshine[/i], or [i][b]both.[/b][/i]
Those of you who have played either of these games will understand what I'm talking about.
Those of you who have not, for you I will attempt to explain.  It is the absolute most [i]unforgiving[/i] platformer, ever.  You will fall from ankle height, proceed to presumably [i]break[/i] said ankle, and have to start all over again.  And this is merely an example.

Neplunker was a bad idea.  This is not my opinion, this is a fact.  Neplunker was a singularly bad move from Compile Factory, and including it in Megadimension VIIR was an even [i]worse[/i] move.  It is the most unforgiving aspect of the game, and should never have been included.  Clearing either of the Neplunker dungeons more than once in a day is next to impossible, and the New Game+ flag "Sturdy Heart" does nothing to ease it.  All it does is prevent you from getting a game over if you fail the dungeon.  A better idea would have been to include that, [i]and[/i] a flag that makes you immune to steam vents, bat poop, and non-bottomless ledges.

I would [i]gladly[/i] fight the God of Woe thirty times if it meant that Neplunker would have become easier to bear.

As it stands, all I can reccomend is that you not engage Neplunker until after activating New Game+.

Aside from Neplunker, this is an [i]amazing[/i] game, with wonderful characters and a beautiful story.

I would definitely reccomend playing this game.

But I would reccomend it more if it wasn't for Neplunker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051654867', 'num_games_owned': 1354, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 8998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7209, 'last_played': 1529301823}
review:
Another 50% Recommendation (but gonna thumb down just because we didn't get the patch that they put out for other platform-regiion)

[b]Pros: [/b]
Nep stories. it's kinda funny and cute. as always.
Very Pretty to look at
- Good Musics and Sounds
- Interesting RPG Tactical Mechanics with customizable combos and combine attacks (the combine attack effect are kinda - just explosion effect pretty sad)

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Steam version won't get Patch anymore? so we won't get all the patch and fixes that we should
- Neplunker (Jumping puzzle dungeon) the movement controls is not good for platforming. it can get very frustrating.
- without the latest patch all the EXE special attacks damage are super underwhelming despite fancy animations and effects.

so it's a 50-50 
the combat is fun but the fact that we didn't get that one important patch. is a huge dissapointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059560758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 14913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14913, 'last_played': 1562553873}
review:
Alright, what do I think about this game. For information, I bought it in a bundle with all DLCs during a sale.

First.
The game max level is 999. But IF and CH estimated that western players werent worth getting the patch to fix skills damage and experience beyond level 100, leaving us with a broken game past said level.
Quick math max level 999, game broken past 100: that leaves us with approximatively 90% of the game broken, with useless character skills, awfully long to reach max level and endgame arena challenges uncompletables.

Second.
New game+ is bugged. If you try to start a new game+ with all the character unlocked you wont be able to unlock any party skills with all characters that arent available at the start of a game. So no Megadimension Blanc VII...

Third.
If you dont like plateforms games, be aware that in this neptunia game you'll have some key items blocked behind the worst platformer I've ever played in my life... And if you like platform games, trust me it will change after a few run into the first neplunker (yeah there's more than one...)

Fourth.
The combo sytem.
I'm new to the serie and it was new and refreshing at first...
But it's actually utterly pointless in this game and will quickly become tedious and annoying: For everysingle normal attack in the game you'll have to press the attack button half a dozen times per character and per turn with no other purpose whatsoever than having to press it several times. And even if you only finish one rushed playtrough, you will have to use a LOT of normal attacks...
This will also make changing weapon on a character something obnoxious since you'll have to reconfigurate your combo every single time too, for everysingle characters.... Really feels like a useless feature to me.

Fifth.
One last thing. Dungeon without an automap....Automaps in rpg are a QoL feature so the player dont have to bring a pen and paper and draw his own map... removing said automap in some dungeons doesnt make the gameplay more challenging nor interesting nor fun, it makes it retrograde and obnoxious.
Well I guess it blend well with the neplunker if the only purpose was to make the game irritating.

Verdict: Nope. I can pass on some issues (or cheat engine my way trough), but without the exp/skill damages patches that the asian version have western version of the game is just uncomplete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080512529', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6445, 'last_played': 1526114138}
review:
This was my 2nd Neptunia game after 4 Goddesses Online, and I just finished completing the game 100%. I adore this game. It was a blast, I absolutely love it. At first it's a little bit difficult to get into due to the high amounts of cutscenes, but if you stick with it the story is actually really interesting and fun.

I like how the game teaches you its mechanics gradually throughout the experience so you never feel overwhelmed. That makes it more accessible than a lot of other JRPGs right off the bat. The combat is fun, engaging and can get pretty tense at times. It's turn based combat, where you can also reposition your characters to do special attacks and such. The dungeons are fun to explore and are visually interesting. (There are a few exceptions, specifically 2 secret dungeons where they try to make you do precise platforming with JRPG dungeon crawling controls. This game was just not meant for that type of gameplay.) 

I liked all the characters, and really enjoyed Uzume's character arc. The only character I didn't like whatsoever was K-sha. I felt she was bland and only had one character trait, I won't spoil but you'll know if you get there. Overall this is probably one of my favorite JRPGs you can get on Steam. I highly recommend this game if you like JRPGs and are willing to put up with a lot of cutscenes. If you can get past that you have a great game in store for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198829421683', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3764, 'last_played': 1525052059}
review:
I am a anime/rpg fan. This is my first time playing a game from this series. 

Story: Uninteresting, Predictable Story and slow progression. Too much unnecessary dialog that does not move the story that seems like fillers. Unless your 12 years old i wouldnt buy this game for the story. 5/10

Sound:  Probably the best part of the game. Sound effects are good with good music. 8/10
 
Graphics: Not bad. Passable for a jrpg. There is some cool skills an animation in combat. But dont expect fancy cutscenes. Story is mostly told as a visual novel style. 7/10

Gameplay: I found the gameplay to be more interesting than the story. Although the game can get repetitive, where you just pretty much run through dungeons to progress the story; theres many things to unlock and characters to play with. I think its a bit too easy. 7/10

In conclusion, the game is lacking in too many ways to recommend. It was all fun and games for about a quarter of the game but then started to get repetive and slowly got uninterested in the story and the characters. Might be a good game for kids or someone that is fan of the series otherwise i would pass on this game. My overall experience: 6.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007097117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2581, 'last_played': 1496106875}
review:
Pros:
[list]
[*] The music is amazing. I could play a pile of garbage with this music on and still be happy.
[*] Combat mechanics are better than the other games I've played in the series (imo)
[*] The skits and story dialogue are amusing, and often break the fourth wall
[*] The story is decently long, which may be expected of a JRPG
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
[*] Game difficulty is very spiky. There were a few points in the story (one particularly bad one) where I had to grind levels to stand a reasonable chance of beating a boss. I would be fine with it for optional bosses, but it's a bit annoying when you can't see what happens next because the mandatory boss stops you cold.
[*] Sometimes the dialogue goes on for a long, long time. If you're into that sort of thing, great! I was personally itching to get back to combat or move on with my life on several occasions.
[/list]

As a whole, the game is very silly / lighthearted and definitely worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019112527', 'num_games_owned': 1395, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 5519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5519, 'last_played': 1524289504}
review:
To be honest, gameplaywise this game is kind of lame. You could end the battle spamming skills and that's it. It's absolutly lineal, the dungeons are really easy and you could just walk straight forward to the next event. Just get some good equipement and level some main characters. That's all.
Now let's be hones you play this game because of the kawaii anime girls, plus they represent videogame consoles and such. Choose your waifu that's all this game is good for, they all have different personalities so you'll end up defending one Nep as the best girl (Pro Tip: It's Noire).
Story wise the game is pretty good, many of the plot details make sense in the end. As a visual novel with some JRPG elements the game works perfectly fine. I was heartbroken with both ending they were absolutly awesome.
The characters are very well managed in this version, all of the godess get a more mature look, even neptune, she goes and does work because that's her duty as a godess. They stopped huge amount the jokes about: vert's breast, neptune slacking, noire beign a loner and blanc's breast. There are some but, boy, in Rebirth 3 every interaction was just about those godess details I got fed up, repeating again and again the same joke.
Finally they developers are going the extra mile to make sure their characters are completly straight, in this game the godess state in their stories that they are not attracted to girls and show that they like good looking guys.
This is not a game for everyone . It's just for the people that love the characters. Buy the special edition with the OST on sale, because the songs are really beautiful; Katharsis by Mariko Honda and Rie Tanaka tears me apart everytime .

author: {'steamid': '76561198155680165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1524253023}
review:
Game full of anime fan service, bad graphic design and lousy battle mechanics and storyline.

- The menus, battle and character customization mechanics are badly designed and definitely take time to get the hang of. Nowhere near user friendly. Ever heard of Game Learning Curve?
- Characters, storyline and even the music offer nothing special. Character animations are somehow blocky and unfinished looking and the dungeons are boring.

On the +side, I do like the finished look of the art.

Conclusion: Not worth time and definitely not the money.

P.s. Getting out of the tutorial takes longer than the accepted refundable playtime. Regrets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274899411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1689024520}
review:
I'm not one to usually write reviews for anything, but I feel l must for this game.  I've played all of the other Neptunia games in the series and loved all of them.  What really got my attention for Megadimension was the introduction of what you could call a "Giant Enemy," along with the Giant Battles.  If you've played the other titles then you should know grinding tends to be manditory, especially for the Post Game Colosseum.  The Post Colosseum Giant Battles made me feel that grinding feel worth it (aside from the fact i tend to perfer facing the giant battles while 200 lvls under what is recommended.)  I find myself coming back time and time again to replay this game.  Overall, I feel this is the best that Idea Factory/Compile Heart has to offer, and I definately would recommend getting it.  If you are new to the HDN series, I would recommend at least starting from the Re; Birth series to avoid any confusion.

"One can never get enough Nep in their life"

author: {'steamid': '76561197985940099', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 6425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6243, 'last_played': 1523239181}
review:
He jugado a la saga Neptunia desde el Rebirth 1 y en resumen puedo decir lo siguiente:

Rebirth 2 < Rebirth 1 < Neptunia V II < Rebirth 3 V

Ahora paso a explicar.

Los que somos fan de los Neptunia, siempre nos vamos a encontrar con un juego divertido. Si bien este Neptunia V II tiene muchos puntos fuertes, tiene otros en los que flaquea un poco. Me parece que en cuanto a la jugabilidad quitaron algunas mecÃ¡nicas interesantes que estaban presentes en Neptunia V (Rebirth 3), que deberÃ­an haber mantenido, como por ejemplo el estado Awakened de los personajes humanos no CPU (If, Compa), aunque por otra parte hay algo parecido como el estado Gold de las Gold Third (B-Sha, K-Sha, C-Sha, S-Sha) por ahÃ­ se compensa un poco. Pero por otra parte quitaron la posibilidad de cambiar un personaje cuando otro muere... aunque se equilibra con otras cosas. Vuelve la barra EX Ãºnica, aunque incorporaron otras mecÃ¡nicas de los combos segÃºn el tipo de arma. 

Pero sin duda la principal novedad jugable es que ahora las 4 waifus principales pueden acceder a una segunda transformaciÃ³n y liberar skills muy poderosas, a cambio de volver al estado original, lo cual te obliga a jugar estratÃ©gicamente y saber cuÃ¡ndo gastar otra barra EX para activar la segunda transformaciÃ³n para luego utilizar dichas skills. Esta novedad jugable sin duda es la que mÃ¡s me gustÃ³.

En fin. Hay varias novedades de jugabilidad las cuales en lo personal algunas me gustaron, otras son interesantes aunque no me gustaron tanto.

En cuanto a la historia, dividirla en tres no se si fue un acierto, pero en lo personal me pareciÃ³ como que las dos primeras no tenÃ­an nada que ver hasta ya bastante avanzado el juego. ReciÃ©n en Heart Dimension (la tercera historia), todas las piezas empiezan a encajar y reciÃ©n ahÃ­ te enteras de todo, lo cual puede hacer que algunos jugadores desistan de continuar con el juego porque pareciera ser que la historia es inconexa y no va para ningÃºn lado, pero ocurre un Plot Break en Heart Dimension donde la calidad de la historia crece exponencialmente en interes y se pone extremadamente buena. Como siempre, muchos chistes y referencias a otros juegos y a la cultura gamer.

Por cierto, me pareciÃ³ extremadamente genial, en una misiÃ³n secundaria que tiene que hacer Neptune, en donde hay un diÃ¡logo que ella hace y donde le pegan un tremendo palo a todas esas compaÃ±ias mierdas con sus microtransacciones. Simplemente genial!!

TÃ©cnicamente hay un salto grÃ¡fico, aunque nada como para tirar cohetes, pero sin duda es de agradecer.

Por otra parte, el sello Neptunia: muchas waifus como siempre, mucho moe, mucho fanservice aunque sin abusar de el. TambiÃ©n muchos personajes nuevos, aunque no tanto como en Victory (Rebirth 3), Uzume Tennoboshi tiene su carisma, es un excelente personaje, y su forma CPU es algo totalmente diferente a cÃ³mo es normalmente. Es un completo acierto la inclusiÃ³n de este personaje. 

Otro tremendo acierto es la inclusiÃ³n de la Neptune versiÃ³n adulta. Aquellos que hayan jugado a Victory antes (Rebirth 3), y sacaron el final verdadero entenderÃ¡n de dÃ³nde y por quÃ© aparece.

En resumen, un Neptunia muy bueno, aunque por solo unas pocas dÃ©cimas menos por debajo de Victory, principalmente porque en este Ãºltimo habiÃ¡n unas mecÃ¡nicas que me gustaron mucho y que acÃ¡ no estuvieron presentes, y por cÃ³mo estaba estructurada la historia en este Victory II. Todo lo demÃ¡s fue de mi total satisfacciÃ³n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198384048429', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2374, 'last_played': 1529823253}
review:
My 4th Nep game. My first game that I buy in steam is Re;birth 1 and the second is Re;birth 3 ( couldn't buy Re;birth 2 because I don't have enough money. I'm not big fan of CPU candidates tho. But still, I watch the playthrough on YouTube. It's not bad. Maybe sometime if I have enough money I would buy Re;birth 2.), and still having fun playing it. I love how it have a lot of funny scene.

Megadimension is different from all Re;birth series. They have Gold Third's and my favourite is C-Sha, she so kind xD. 

Sorry about my bad English. But I definely recomend Neptunia fans playing this. Worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046440221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1519994820}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia: The next part of the never ending series.
I really liked playing it and could successfully waste a couple of hours with it, but I also have the feeling that it doesnt appeal to me as much anymore (repetition reasons maybe?)

tl;dr: Polished successor with a variety of improved features. Nothing greatly surprising though.

Story: Most of Neptunias content is comedy after all. There a ton of funny scenes that made me laugh. And also the  overall plot plays fine. It isnt very complex (at the end the power of friendship and goodwill will win) but it creates a nice flow and atmosphere throughout the game. Surprisingly the game plays like a sequence of subgames (each with an individual starting screen), which gives it an even fresher touch. Even one of those parts lets you play individual routes for our protagonists, which lets you see a part story with solely them as a protagonist, which is a nice change of pace.

Gameplay: The usual grinding we know and love from the previous games. The world map and scouts work slightly different. Also It gets a little enhanced with additional forms and especially an overworked combo-system as well as support system (front and back line). Overall that doesnt change much for your playstyle, but it is ineed nice to see a minor changes there. The whole game offers hell a lot of customisable things: unlockable shop items, developing items, combos, equipment, investments, etc. and also offers special quests and dungeons for you to explore. For me I cannot say that I explored all of them and merely followed the main story + happy end. But there really is much more to explore and customise. Nevertheless you will be able to clear the game even when you dont put that much effort into trying to always have the best equipment possible. Even the new game + options make this game far more enjoyable (higher runspeed, avoiding battles).

Technical Stuff: This game really is polished. Not a single crash occured to me while playing (instead of previous titles) and the overall menu navigation is much smoother and easier to comprehend (there are also more help screens to explain things). I played with a controller and had no issue, though i know that it can be painful playing without one so be warned. Also the VN-style options work very well. You can scroll back lines and even replay their audio (the game is fully voiced [except for unimportant minor scenes]).

Atmosphere (Music): I really liked the original music brought to this title. There is also some old music from the previous titles (which bring out nostalgic feelings), but the new songs befit the scenes they are played in very nicely.

Characters: I really enjoyed the variety of characters i this title. You have your well known protagonists, as well as a completely new protagonist, combined with hell a lot of new bad guys (even some old ones) and side characters whill all will have their part in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198453699955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5970, 'last_played': 1659026300}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII is simply the best game of the series. With three different stories inside, a familiar gameplay with many and notorious improvements and the same charming presentations, we guarantee you that you will pass many hours enjoying this new Nep-Nep adventure. 

PS. There are more waifus in this game besides the four CPUs and the candidates, but I presonally still stick with the Neps cause Nepu Nepu Neppp ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198242961256', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2898, 'last_played': 1519730197}
review:
This is probably the only Neptunia game that has interesting story I have ever played to date.

[b]- New characters.[/b]
We got:
Uzume Tennouboshi/Orange Heart, as reference to Dreamcast console.
The Gold Third: B-Sha (ref. to Bandai-Namco), K-Sha (ref. to Konami), C-Sha (ref. to Capcom), and S-Sha/E-Sha (ref. to Square-Enix).
The enemy, Steamax, as reference to Steam, probably.
Sadly, the Makers from Rebirth game is not present (Falcom, Tekken, etc), but other Makers can join via DLC, named Million Arthur, God Eater, and Nitroplus.
[b]- New combo system.[/b]
The combo here is little different from Rebirth games, where in this game there's a feature called Combo Trait where if a certain condition is fulfilled, executing a move will increase its damage. Also, each weapon has different combo slots so different weapon means different combo. This gives another take to creating a combo effective enough for defeating your enemies.
[b]- New CPU Form: the Next Form.[/b]
As you can see the from the game screenshot, each CPU has their new form where you can unlock as you progress the story. It's kinda cool where they transform for the first time.

If you've played through Rebirth 1-2-3, this entry is (sort of) the continuation of the Rebirth series and a must for Neptunia fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140331454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1475582752}
review:
Honestly From my perspective idea factory has lost its edge, i loved the neptunia series but i just think its too repetitive.
you start as nep and you save the world from a great evil for the 4th time?(i only play the games) and in the end they made new friends. I'd like to see something serious for a change instead of these cute moe girls fighting " a great evil " every sequal.

I Wouldn't Say this game is story rich, feels like fillers everytime you see an optional cutscene.
I use to really love this game, i loved it so much that i even disagree and ignore anyone who says that this series is awful eventho they give good reasons why. 

overall improved graphics, more unnecessary fanservice and the same lovable cast.

review: This game makes me cry tears of joy. I come back to listen to the music and re-watch events in the gallery, even after 100%-ing it, just because it makes me that happy. Considering restarting just to have an excuse to play it again. Waifus and etc aside, this really is the landmark for Compile Heart/Idea Factory in the Neptunia series in gameplay, story, graphics, and just feel-good factor. I love the first re; birth too, but this.. this is what they showed us they can do with a real budget. I'm hoping they continue producing this amount of quality, it's good for the soul.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416383874', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1572130092}
review:
Overall, I'd give the game an 8/10.

Megadimension Neptunia VII (That's V2, by the way) is a solid Neptunia game for both veterans and newcomers. There are plenty of lovable characters, with some of the better writing in the series. The art is beautiful to look at, even held to modern anime standards. Gameplay is very similar to Re;Birth, where you traverse dungeons and battle with combo attacks and skills. It's simple to pick up, yet still fun throughout the game. The soundtrack is upbeat, with rock and electronic inspirations. There's even fully voiced cutscenes with dual audio, with one of the better dubs for an anime-style game, for those of you who care!

As for the game's flaws, the characters and story still heavily rely on tropes seen in anime. The fanservice is heavy, the most there's been in a Neptunia game. That's saying a lot. Running around dungeons can feel awkward, with disjointed enemy hitboxes and slightly stiff movement. There aren't too many puzzles or mechanics in dungeons, as well. Not all cutscenes are voiced, and even less are dubbed in English. For those of you who care about that, be warned. Finally, grinding is something you should expect in this game, as it has a fairly high difficulty and a level cap of 99 (999 with free dlc). This may reduce your enjoyment of the battle system, as you'll most likely be using the same attacks over and over at this point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198397720556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2418, 'last_played': 1549588003}
review:
If you like JRPGs, cool and funny story, awesome characters with [strike] generic [/strike] different personalities and pudding, this game is for you. I'm absolutely in love with this game and i can play this for hours. It's a nice farming game with a long variety of dungeons and monsters. Certainly you'll find your waifu in this game. The best of this game, undoubtedly, are the soundtracks, they're incredible. 

Pros:

1. The history is awesome and cute. 
2. Entire game is a reference!!!
3. Can be a easy game if you put effort on this. If don't, you may suffer a lil bit with some bosses or even monsters. 
4. [b] Marvelous soundtrack [/b]
5. [b] NEP NEP NEP NEP!! [/b]

Cons:

1. If you don't have a good computer, maybe you'll be in trouble in some Dungeons or battles.
2. Can be tiresome by playing for a lot of hours because it's genre (JRPG, Farming Game). That's not a really con [u] for me [/u] afterall, [u] but some people can think this way. [/u]

9.5/10. I'll buy even the others games because the franchise! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198121684319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3104, 'last_played': 1583679511}
review:
This game was fun to play through  it made me laugh alot for some reason. This also a long game it took me 50hrs for my first play through and now I'm stating my second play through  so I can get the true ending.Now I well go over the pros and cons of the game

Pros:
.The game is long 
.The combat is fun but can take some time to get use to 
.fun boss fights
.funny and colorful characters
.The game references

Cons:
.The pc controls suck ass ( Just use a controller) :)
.The game is cap at 60fps unlike some of the other games they have on steam :P

But all in all I think this game is worth the buy and of course if you have played any of the other Nep games this is a must buy for all of you out there and if you are new to the games I do recommend this game and the other nep games on steam but just make sure that your computer can run the game befor you buy the game. I have seen some reviews that say the games sucks because they can't run the game that good. :P Here is my rateing fot the game 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008303595', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 554, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1514805040}
review: Megadimension Neptunia VII is simply the best game of the series. With three different stories inside, a familiar gameplay with many and notorious improvements and the same charming presentations, we guarantee you that you will pass many hours enjoying this new Nep-Nep adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347282826', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7163, 'last_played': 1690157570}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII es un juego que revitalizÃ³ la serie, tanto de en gameplay y en la historia, y era un cambio que, sinceramente, ya necesitaba la saga, pues ya habÃ­a llegado un punto donde el sistema de combates limitaba los propios juegos en vez de fortalecerlos. AsÃ­ que, si ya eres fan de la serie, existen varias razones por las que este juego puede convencerte para jugarlo durante muchas horas, sin importar que tanto te hayan gustado o disustado los juegos anteriores.

En el aspecto superficial el juego hace bien su trabajo, los grÃ¡ficos son bastante buenos y el diseÃ±o tanto de personajes (sobretodo en las nuevas formas que desarrollan los personajes principales) asÃ­ como de los dungeons (haciendo un especial Ã©nfasis en los dungeons de la primera parte del juego), es bastante creativo y, al mismo tiempo, estilizado.

Hablando ya en un aspecto mÃ¡s profundo, el juego reinventa algunas mecÃ¡nicas ya utilizadas anteriormente y juntando eso con el hecho de que el balanceo de estadÃ­sticas es bastante bueno (ej. Un enemigo con mucha defensa fÃ­sica serÃ¡ casi inmune ante un personaje que lo ataque asÃ­, a menos que estÃ© sea unos 20 niveles superior) hacen que el juego sea desafiante si no tienes la estrategia adecuada de acercamiento al enemigo o los suficiente Ã­tems de apoyo para sobrevivir lo suficiente.

Una de las mecÃ¡nicas mÃ¡s importantes en el juego es el sistema de scouts, un reemplazo del Remake System, con el cual consigues nuevos dungeons, Ã­tems, dinero o enemigos, al hacer que unos personajes, llamados scouts, exploren dungeons durante un tiempo predeterminado. AdemÃ¡s, mientras no hagas que el scout reporte sus descubrimientos, el dungeon que lo tenga tendrÃ¡ ciertas caracterÃ­sticas, las cuales ya estÃ¡n determinadas en cada scout, que pueden tanto ayudar como empeorar el desempeÃ±o del jugador en el dungeon (+10% de experiencia, -10% de ganancia de oro, etc.). Esto permite que dependiendo como nuevas tus scouts puedas duplicar tu velocidad de farmear o de ganancia de oro dependiendo de tu estilo de juego.

Otra elemento importante es el hecho de que al subir de nivel o al salir del dungeon ya no recuperas tu vida y manÃ¡, esto hace que si quieres luchar en dungeons de nivel superior tengan un elemento de riesgo mÃ¡s alto, pues puedes perder tus 2 horas de farmear continuo si no estÃ¡s atento a tus recursos y a tus personajes, que animado con el balanceo ya antes explicado hacen que un dungeon de solo 5 niveles superior sea mÃ¡s complicado de lo que era en los juegos anteriores. En especial cuando, debido a la historia, estÃ¡s forzado a luchar solo en en un equipo de 2 sin alguien especializado en cuaraciones.

Sin embargo el cambio mÃ¡s grande que se puede notar entre los juegos anteriores y este es, obviamente, el sistema de combate, el cual sufriÃ³ una necesaria evoluciÃ³n comparado con el anterior. Para ser simple, ahora ya no existen los Guard Points en los enemigos, sino que para causar el daÃ±o mÃ¡s grande ocupas encadenar golpes los cuales permitan al siguiente golpe ser mÃ¡s poderoso, al cumplir la condiciÃ³n que estÃ© necesita para hacerlo (ej. Realiza solo ataques de tipo rush, No utilices ataque de tipo Standard, etc.). Lo importante es que el nÃºmero de combos que puedes realizar se viene limitado debido al arma, pues cada arma solo permite que cierto nÃºmero de ataques sean realizados (ej. 3 Rush, 1 Power, 4 Standard) y dependiendo de los ataques que tengas disponibles ciertas armas no convendrÃ¡n, aÃºn asÃ­ esa es la libertad que genera este sistema de combate, pues cada quien tiene sus formas de pelear y a diferencia del otro sistema basado en Puntos y ataques, existe mÃ¡s de un camino de eficiencia.

En tÃ©rminos de historia, esta se presenta en tres actos, y cada una tiene un enfoque que no solo hace variada la historia en todo el juego, pues no sÃ© siente como pequeÃ±os eventos que eventualmente se convertirÃ¡n en algo grande, como en los otros juegos, sino como grandes eventos los cuales tendrÃ¡n su final de forma bastante gigantesca, pues con tantos personajes e ideas entre actos se profundiza en el mundo de una forma que solo habÃ­a sido explorada en Sisters Generation, y aÃºn asÃ­ el sentido del humor hace que no se sienta pesada, sino que ademÃ¡s logra una gran empatÃ­a con los nuevos personajes, que apesar de ser humoristicos tienen ese toque de humanidad y alegrÃ­a que en verdad sientes que quieres estar con ellos para apoyarlos.

Concluyendo, este juego es lo que los fans necesitaban en el momento indicado, pues refrescÃ³ las ideas que en su momento Rebirth habÃ­a desarrollado, y creo un nuevo estÃ¡ndar en cuanto a cÃ³mo debe ser un juego de Neptunia, siendo desafiante, pero al mismo tiempo entretenido, creando una historia cuya madurez se hace notar en los momentos necesarios, sin necesidad de ser pretenciosa en ningÃºn momento y con un gran sentido del humor. Recomendado si en verdad quieres una nueva y fresca aventura de las consolas favoritas para muchos, en PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117961905', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 6791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3240, 'last_played': 1680833552}
review:
Since I've made it near the end, it's time for a more serious review.

The Neptunia franchise is the first anime franchise that I ever got into. The quirkyness, the overall theme and plot were among the most interesting to me at the time. But... We're not here to talk about the entire franchise.

What can I say about Megadimension Neptunia VII? It's enjoyable, it's lengthy, it can be challenging at points. It has everything you need for a good JRPG. The combat system isn't the greatest, as sometimes it seems a bit rigged. For example, enemies will target a very specific character from your party, even though it seems like the opposite would be logical. Sometimes certain characters and/or enemies will gain extra turns for seemingly no reason. It's not perfect, but it's enjoyable at the least.

The story - or rather, storieS - are what sold this game for me. There's always a twist around every corner, for example [spoiler] when Gold Third takes over, or when Uzume turns out to be evil but not really because it's really just a doppelganger (Kurome) [/spoiler]. And when you least expect it, there's always a boss battle. 

Speaking of bosses, I heavily enjoy the new Parts system. If an enemy has certain defensive parts, you can perform a Parts Break on them. That is, attacking said parts enough to the point where they will shatter, leaving the enemy vulnerable. The only area I found this mechanic to be an issue is during [spoiler] the battle with Affimojas [/spoiler]. It felt like it was put in to create a false sense of difficulty - [spoiler] having to break many parts just to be able to get a single hit in wasn't very enjoyable [/spoiler].

The quests system has stayed the same throughout the franchise, giving the players optional side-quests to perform for Shares, extra items, EXP, etc. It's useful if you want to grind the game to hell, I suppose.

Speaking of grinding, I found this installment to be far less grindy than previous ones. I only had to go grinding for one or two levels per character every now and then, which is extremely welcome for someone like me who hates the idea of grinding for hours on end.

The route system. Sometimes the route system felt like an unnecessary nuisance to pad the game for length at certain points [spoiler] for example, the part where you're forced to go from city to city picking up all the members of Gold Third, but being stopped every now and then for pointless battles [/spoiler].

Now on to probably the best part about the game: The soundtrack. God damn, I LOVE Neptunia's soundtrack. Kenji Kaneko and all the other composers did an excellent job in making music for these games, and I applaud them a million times over. My favourite track out of this game would probably have to be "Absolute."

Overall, I really enjoyed this game. I feel like I got my money's worth, given the 50+ hour length and the sheer amount of content within. The story was great, the gameplay was solid. I have few bad things to say about this game.

Pros and Cons time, folks!

Pros:
-Great story.
-Fucking amazing soundtrack.
-Great mechanics.
-Great combat system.
-Minimal grinding (At least for me).
-It's Neptunia. What more could you want?

Cons:
-Combat seemed to be rigged at points.
-Route system seemed unnecessary.
-Enemies and Characters alike seemed to gain extra turns for no reason.

All in all, this game is great. I highly recommend it to any Neptunia fan, or for anyone who enjoys a good JRPG.

I give Megadimension Neptunia VII a 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 5853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5853, 'last_played': 1513197174}
review:
[b]Megadimension Neptunia VII[/b] ist ein klassisches, Humorvolles J-RPG mit Runden Kampfsystem
Wer nur eine kurze Zusammenfassung wÃ¼nscht, kann diese ganz unten im Review finden.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Das Gameplay ist verglichen mit den VorgÃ¤ngern im GroÃŸen und Ganzen Ã¤hnlich.
Wie in den VorgÃ¤ngern auch bestehen die KÃ¤mpfe darin, die Charaktere auf dem Schlachtfeld zu positionieren und entweder Comboangriffe oder Spezialattacken einzusetzen. Neu ist hier, dass Gegner jetzt manchmal AusrÃ¼stung mit sich tragen, die man zerstÃ¶ren kann, indem man den Gegner von bestimmten Seiten aus angreift. Auf diese Weise werden die Gegner oft entweder schwÃ¤cher oder kÃ¶nnen bestimmte Angriffe nicht mehr nutzen. AuÃŸerdem gibt es Extraloot.

Formationangriffe, bei denen die ausfÃ¼hrenden Charaktere das oder die Ziele flankiert oder umzingelt haben mÃ¼ssen, sind ebenfalls neu und sind vorallem dann nÃ¼tzlich, wenn es darum geht, alle vom Gegner getragenen AusrÃ¼stungsgegenstÃ¤nde anzugreifen. 

Eine weitere Neuerung ist die EXE-DRIVE-Leiste, die nicht wie in den VorgÃ¤ngern noch fÃ¼r jeden Charakter separat zur VerfÃ¼gung steht, sondern fÃ¼r die ganze Gruppe.

Insgesamt machen die Neuerungen im Kampfsystem keinen allzu groÃŸen Unterschied bis auf einige Ausnahmen, da die Gegner oft schon in den Seilen hÃ¤ngen, bevor ihre AusrÃ¼stung zerbricht.

Eine neue Art des Kampfes sind die GigantenkÃ¤mpfe, in denen man sich Ã¼ber das Schlachtfeld bewegt, indem man von einer schwebenden Plattform zur anderen springt. Hier stehen Combos und einige Spezialangriffe nicht zur VerfÃ¼gung, dafÃ¼r regeneriert man jede Runde einige Spezialpunkte. Generell habe ich diese KÃ¤mpfe fast nie als sonderlich anspruchsvoll empfunden, aber die Idee ist nett.

In diesem Teil haben die Entwickler versucht, Gameplayelemente auf der Weltkarte und den Dungeons einzufÃ¼gen, um sie besser zu machen. Mit relativ Ã¼berschaubarem Erfolg, sofern man Backtracking und Randomencounter auf der Weltkarte als stÃ¶rend empfindet. Backtracking, weil man so ziemlich alle Dungeons spÃ¤ter noch ein Mal besuchen muss, wenn man sich alle SchÃ¤tze holen will, da man spÃ¤ter die FÃ¤higkeiten erlangt, Hindernisse aus dem Weg zu rÃ¤umen oder hÃ¶her zu springen und Randomencounter erscheinen auf der Weltkarte im schnitt alle paar Schritte (man muss jetzt von jeder Location zur anderen laufen, anstelle wie in den VorgÃ¤ngern einfach via schnellreise hin zu gelangen und die Vernetzung der Wege kÃ¶nnte besser sein. Hier wurde eindeutig Spielzeitstreckung betrieben, was ich als Fan der Reihe ziemlich schade finde. 

Was ebenfalls einigen Ã„nderungen zum Opfer gefallen ist, ist die Itementwicklung. Diese ist zwar immernoch vorhanden, allerdings nicht mehr in der Weise, dass man wie im VorgÃ¤nger BauplÃ¤ne finden muss (bis auf einige Ausnahmen). Die meisten Entwicklungen schaltet man frei, indem man in den einzelnen Ortschaften in Forschung etc investiert, also Geld rein steckt. Ich kam zwar ganz gut zurecht, ohne frÃ¼h im Spiel groÃŸ was investieren zu mÃ¼ssen, aber unnÃ¶tig finde ich das Feature trotzdem.

Ein gutes Feature ist, wie ich finde, das Scoutsystem, in dem man Scouts in die einzelnen Dungeons schickt, wo sie durch ihre Entdeckungen verbesserungen fÃ¼r den Dungeon wie neue Gegner, neue Dungeons oder neue Scouts freischalten.
ZusÃ¤tzlich geben Scouts dem Spieler, sofern er sich im Dungeon befindet, einige Boni wie Erfahrungsbonus oder hÃ¶here Chancen, dass Gegner Items fallen lassen.

Positiv erwÃ¤hnen mÃ¼sste man noch, dass das Spiel insgesammt weniger grindlastig ist, als die VorgÃ¤nger (mit Ausnahme eines Kampfes im dritten Kapitel, aber da war die Arena schon verfÃ¼gbar) zumindest habe ich es so empfunden.

[h1]Grafik, Soundtrack[/h1]
Die Grafik kÃ¶nnte auf leistungsschwÃ¤cheren GerÃ¤ten Probleme machen (vorallem die Schattendarstellung) kann aber in den Optionen relativ frei verÃ¤ndert werden, so dass auch alte GerÃ¤te damit zurecht kommen. Zu erwÃ¤hnen wÃ¤hre, dass die meisten Charaktere neue Butshots bekommen haben, die wie ich finde, sehr gut aussehen.
Der Soundtrack ist mit dem der VorgÃ¤nger nicht mehr zu vergleichen. Es sind einige gesungene StÃ¼cke dabei, die ziemlich gut klingen. Einige StÃ¼cke aus den VorgÃ¤ngern haben mir besser gefallen, aber naja~

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]
[b]Pro[/b]
[list]
    [*]Ãœberarbeitetes KS mit interessanten Features wie zerstÃ¶rbarer Bewaffnung der Gegner
    [*]GigantenbosskÃ¤mpfe, die sich von normalen KÃ¤mpfen grundlegend unterscheiden
    [*]Einige beliebte Features aus den VorgÃ¤ngern wie Itementwicklung
    [*]Scoutsystem, um Items, Geld, neue Gegner oder Scouts zu finden
[/list]

[b]Neutral[/b]
[list]
    [*]Teils komplett neue Charaktere (MarvelousAQL, Tekken, Red und Co sind nicht mehr dabei)
    [*]Gruppe Teilt sich eine Driveleiste ansatt dass wie in den VorgÃ¤ngern jeder eine eigene hat
[/list]

[b]Kontra[/b]
[list]
    [*]Einige Features redundant oder seltsam umgesetzt
    [*]Randomencounter auf der Weltkarte
    [*]einiges wirkt spielzeitstreckend und nervt
[/list]

[b]Fazit[/b]
Megadimension Neptunia VII macht vieles anders als die VorgÃ¤nger, einiges besser und manches falsch (finde ich)
Die Handlung ist ein wenig besser als die der anderen Spiele wie ich finde, gewinnt aber trotzdem noch keinen Oscar und das Spiel wird wieder in erster Linie von den Charakteren getragen. Wenn man ein heiteres, farbenfrohes J-RPG mit lockerer Atmosphere (und einigem Fanservice) sucht, kann man zugreifen. Wer hingegen ein Spiel mit minutiÃ¶s ausgefeiltem Gameplay, tiefsinniger Handlung und facettnreichen Charakteren sucht, sollte weiter suchen.
Wer die VorgÃ¤nger mochte, muss dieses Spiel nicht unbedingt auch mÃ¶gen, gerade weil es so anders ist als die anderen Teile, aber ich hatte meinen SpaÃŸ und gebe daher eine Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034722152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1624266313}
review:
Bei Megadimension Neptunia VII handelt es sich um ein JRPG von Idea Factory und Compile Heart, welches sich selbst nicht zu ernst nehmen will. 
Schon die Welt Gamindustri und die hier beheimateten vier Reiche, welche die Videospielgiganten Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo und Sega(=Videospielgigant?) parodieren, zeigt den Humor der Reihe. 
Trotz des Titels handelt es sich hierbei um den 4ten Hauptteil der Hyperdimension Neptunia-Spielreihe nicht um den 7ten.

Das Design der Charaktere ist liebevoll und wurde auch hier wieder von Tsunako (Date a Live) erstellt.
Grafisch hat sich im Vergleich zu den vorherigen Teilen hier etwas getan. Eine neue Engine hat fÃ¼r bessere 3D-Modelle, sowie Animationen gesorgt. Auch die Spezialattacken und Verwandlungsszenen sind hÃ¼bsch anzusehen.

Das Spiel kann wahlweise mit Japanischem oder Englischen Dub gespielt werden, wobei hier die Japanische Syncrofassung empfehlenswerter ist als die Englische. Die japanischen Stimmen sind meiner Meinung nach nicht nur fÃ¼r die Charaktere passender, sondern werden auch noch durch GrÃ¶ÃŸen wie beispielsweise Yui Horie und Asami Imai synchronisiert. 

Seit dem zweiten Teil der Reihe, welcher damals auf der PS3 erschien, besitzen alle Neptuniaspiele der Hauptreihe ein rundenbasiertes Kampfsystem mit Bewegungselementen. Hier ist nichts bahnbrechendes neues zu erwarten. Spielerisch ist das Spiel nicht zu anspruchsvoll und kann auch gut mal zwischendurch gespielt werden. Zwar ist es mÃ¶glich das Spiel mit der Tastatur zu spielen, jedoch finde ich als Veteran der PS3-Spiele einen Controller hier angenehmer, dies mag fÃ¼r Leute, die mit den auf Steam erschienen Remakes mit der Reihe angefangen haben, jedoch anders sein.

ErzÃ¤hlerisch ist hier kein Meisterwerk zu erwarten, da das Spiel mehr auf die ungewÃ¶hnlichen Charaktere und ihre jeweiligen Macken setzt, als auf die Story. Weiterhin wird das Geschehen oftmals von den Charakteren kommentiert, wobei hier oftmals die 4te Wand gebrochen wird.

Insgesamt ist Megadimension Neptunia VII eine Empfehlung fÃ¼r Fans von JRPGs aller "Tales of" oder den vorherigen Teilen der Nepuniareihe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034312985', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4293, 'last_played': 1681904543}
review:
3 inter-twining campaigns, same gameplay that we all love, new characters, and most of all, amazing music.

VII (pronounced V2) is the latest in the main Neptunia series. It has the same type of humour, just more of it. New forms, new maps, new gear.

Pros: - Humour
         - 6 new playable characters (11 if you buy all of the character DLCs)
         - Blanc
         - New development mechanics (these are really streamlined, but have a guide for Godly Games)
         - Controls are very simple (haven't tried the keyboard. I play with a controller)
         - Everything that makes a Neptunia game so nepping good.

Cons: - Vert

author: {'steamid': '76561198123089594', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 43128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32436, 'last_played': 1599300647}
review:
Amazing game with a Solid plot that doesn't require you to play any of the previous games to fully understand. The characters are well thought out and developed as the game progresses. The multiple endings provide reasons to reply the game over and over. All the dialogue is also well thought out and amazingly voiced, although there could be a full dub I really can't ask for more. The only down sides to this game is the Dungeon Exploration and Some Reused Assets. The game does not work well with keyboard controls due to it being a consle port, so a controller is fully recommended. Futhermore the Dungeon Exploration is fully thought out and is very simple in design.

Overall the game has great story and plot events, but lacks in player controls and choices. 9/10

review: Como seguidor de toda la saga de Hyperdimension, este juego mejoro en gran medida a los anteriores desde las mecanicas hasta el rendimiento en PC, la historia es genial, y los combates aun mas fluidos, la NEXT form mejora bastante el combate, inclusive puedo decir que es mas dificil y se necesita mas leveo que en los anteriores, ademas no podemos olvidar la rejugabilidad que tiene, ya que conseguir todos los items y desbloquear todos los dungeons es igual de trabajoso que el 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328354801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5033, 'last_played': 1538023195}
review:
The characters in Megadimension Neptunia VII are very relatable and yet extremely abstract from a robot who has a secret crush to a girl who has had her world destroyed. Megadimension Neptunia VII is also very anime/VN oriented with a bit of an rpg as a bonus.

(First review, don't judge)

author: {'steamid': '76561198236541800', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 4107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1595056736}
review:
Starting off was ok and I thought I was gonna be in for a treat. The story line was getting better and better as I progressed. The cutscenes were enjoyable to watch and voice acting was superb, especially 4th wall breaks and comedy. It indeed is a very fun game and I love the Megadimension Neptunia series. Unfortunately, I made a big mistake to buy it as it turned out to be really bad (at least for pc). Why you may ask?

Poorly developed for PC: There are still incredible lag issues. The devs didn't really optimize it properly for PC. When you go wandering around (most of the lag issues stem from here) or in battle, that's when it happens. FPS drops to around 10-15. Another thing to note is that all the controls are based on the PS4 controls when playing on PC. The devs didn't even properly explain the PC controls, even if you go to the controls optimization menu or read the manual or PDF. You basically have to jumble your fingers around the keyboard as you struggle to find the correct controls. It was very difficult to search the controls to find the correct buttons. Plus it demands the most expensive upgrades to your PC to play it.

Devs not listening: The devs don't really take the time to listen to concerns. Valvo, 2K, Firaxis, Psyonix and other game devs of similar strategy and turn-based games actually take the time to listen to concerns and address them. IF Int'l doesn't really communicate effectively and that's why some issues haven't been fixed. 

Lack of effective updates: When was the last effective update for this game? Over four phahkin' years ago when it initially came out. Two years later, they left Uzume to disappear with Zero dimension. 

Game engine: The game engine used is Sony's PhyreEngine, which is meant for PS4. It doesn't work on PC because the IF devs didn't properly optimize it for this platform. That probably answers the fact why it's not correctly optimized for PC. The best engine to use would have been Unreal Engine 3 or 4. 

Oversexualization: Some characters are somewhat oversexualized. Cases of bouncing bÃ¼Ã¼bs (particularly Vert's for example) and whatever, I mean I understand that could be typical of anime, but it goes a little too far. It happens way too much and should be cut down somewhat. There should be an option to disable the jiggle physics for those who don't feel comfortable with them.

This game is really fun, fellow denizens of Zero Dimension, and I would recommend it all the way ONLY if you buy on PS4, not PC unless your PC supports the game smoothly.

TL;DR: Works poorly for PC, and the devs need to improve a lot on that said platform. ONLY buy on PS4 or get something else for a strategy game like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/200510] XCOM: Enemy Unknown [/url] or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/268500/XCOM_2/] XCOM 2[/url].

Refunded it. Review will stay negative until the devs phahkin' fix it. I'll still keep it in my library to show my support for fixing it. 

#FixMDN

author: {'steamid': '76561198068209094', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4446, 'last_played': 1511652219}
review:
[h1]"nep out of 10",[/h1]

Megadimension Neptunia VII (Victory II). I got to admit, this game is brilliant for both people who are new and experienced with the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. It'll probably provide you upwards of 50 hours of unadulterated gameplay and story through it's unique trilogy based structure with 2(3) seperate endings and Visual Novel styled story telling.

The enemies aren't all that difficult most of the time, but the bosses make up for that. On my first playthrough many bosses I only survived by the skin of my teeth. The post-game content and DLC (Which isn't needed at all to enjoy the game) provides quite a bit of gameplay for anyone looking to get the most out of the game.

Many dungeons, enemies, backgrounds/assets, etc are commonly reused with minor modifications, especially in post game content or further into the story. (This is common in JRPGs)

I personally enjoyed the story and would recommend it to anyone who wants a darker more serious theme from the Neptunia series. The comedic moments were abundant and well placed. (I'll admit, I smiled more than I should've), the story wasn't too predictable and the self-aware nature (Like the rest of the Neptunia series) that many games with bad stories try to use as a coverup was actually executed well and bought everything together. It's definitely a step up from other Neptunia games.

The fan service ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°) is less frequent but still strongly present in the game in some scenes (As expected of a Hyperdimension game) if you like fan service you'll be rewarded quite well in the "True Ending"! (Which I only reccomend doing on your 2nd run of the game!)

The combat system is interesting, the skills and the combo attacks aren't always scaled together correctly, and DLC weapons almost "break" the game at some points (Which is your choice to buy and enable anyway). Apart from this I'd say its pretty good for a turned based combat system. The skill animations are interesting, comedic and full of energy until you end up skipping all of them the 10th time you've seen them but you always end up taking a peek every so often especially on that last finishing blow.

Overall, if you're a Neptunia fan why haven't you bought this yet, seriously? If you've played other JRPGs and Visual novels before I'd also reccomend this, it has it all. If you're new to eastern games you might be put off by the hyperbolic nature (anime), post-game grinding and fan-service :^).
