author: {'steamid': '76561198015318197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1583084363}
review:
After giving it as much time as I could to try to get it to run properly, I have finally given up.  I love this series and have played through to near 100% completion Rebirth 1 2 and 3, and for what I got to experience I really enjoed in this game.  I absolutely cannot recommend this pc port to anyone however because it is an extremely poor port.  Every computer I tried it on, ranging from dual core processor with GTX970M to a quad core processor with a GTX1070, has had stuttering and lag issues that make the game extremely offputting to play.  From what people in the forums have been reporting for over a year, is the way the game loads sound files is extremly broken and has never been fixed, controller support has basically been given up on for the Xbox One controller.  last update about the controller was July 2016, where even their solution had you remap the triggers if things were still working incorrectly, hit or miss if things happen to work properly for you but for me even chosing the controller is an issue as the game tries to switch back to the mouse after half a second.  I was forced to switch back to the mouse and keyboard to beat the first mega boss, as the game will not recognize holding any button for longer than half a second before dropping the input, making it impossible for me to enter HDD state (later figured out that you can either hold the input for a full second OR double press the input)

In the end I like the game but it is bugged to the point of being unplayable for me on pc, if you like the series and want another game in the series that slightly mixes up combat from the ReBirth games: GET IT ON THE PS4 AND AVOID THIS AWFUL PORT
If you have never played a Hyperdimension Neptunia game, I suggest giving this an attempt, but immediately ask for a refund if you have any stuttering issues because nothing you do on your end can fix the port itself being bad.

edit 11/6 - No, installing it on an SSD did not fix it idiot who downvoted me and claimed it would, do you really think in 20 hours of fiddling with installations and settings that I WOULDN'T F'ING TRY THAT? It did literally nothing, exact same result as having it installed on an HDD as an SSD, game stutters and plays like crap with terrible controller support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218122799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 11423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7517, 'last_played': 1637290387}
review:
You can see how long i've played this game.

I love this game to pieces. From the characters to the story, this game is amazing.
Rewarding combos? Check.
Cute girls? Check.
Challenging enemies? Eh...it kinda lacks there, but at least the bosses are a challenge!

Let's just say this is probably the least grindy Neptunia game unless you're going for 100% Completion.

Last thing before i go: Uzume...



Is Uzubae.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060684664', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1542, 'last_played': 1508761039}
review:
- No difficulty sitting that made the grinding in the past games bearable.
- They screwed up the camera controls with mouse which were working perfectly in the past games
- Have to constantly back-track to the base to heal, no longer heal on level up.
- I'm at the part of the story where they constantly force you to do 1 player boss fights which is incredibly annoying. 

A part of me feels that the morons over at Idea Factory purposely removed difficulty settings to force players to buy their overpriced "weapons packs". At least I bought your garbage game on sale. Total waste of money though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019048563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 5313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4044, 'last_played': 1594794834}
review:
If you played the others... actually... this one stands out. The game actually has a good story. The other games had pretty easy / canned stories, but the story in this game is fantastic. It feels like an entirely different series

If you don't know what Neptunia is, then you... actually may like this game. With the others, they are pretty much the same fanservices cringey story (I liked them overall for the gameplay), but this game cut down on that and probably actually hired writers that weren't just going for the easy cash in. It was easy though and I did beat it faster than the others

author: {'steamid': '76561198094737880', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1603141256}
review:
[h1] tldr: Look, I know this series is stupid. You know this series is stupid. Let's shake hands, and have some fun with this game series about anime console wars, with the game in the (main) series that (so far) is the most polished.

megadimension neptunia v-ii[/h1] 

Let's cut to the chase. There's no reason to make a review for this. The game's fucking dumb and you'll know if you'll love it or hate it instantly. The gameplay is the same as always, albiet with much, MUCH less grinding (thank fucking god) and the story is filled to the brim with meta and hilarious dialogue. The story's probably the best in the series, though that's not saying much, and elaborating would be dumb cause this is a dumb game with a dumb story. So what makes this one the best game?

[h1]it's much more polished [/h1]

This game was originally released on the PS4 as opposed to the Vita Re;Birth series, and it really shows. The models are nicer, the UI cleaner, the framerates smoother, the animations crisper, everything just looks and feels better. The sound design's a very notable example of this: weapons hit with just enough of an edge to feel fucking glorious and the soundtrack's got some pretty great tunes that go beyond the "fantasy with electronic" tunes of the original series.

I do miss the pixel Nep in the world map. Ugh. I hate the new world map. Yeah, the segments look nicer and the map flows together much better, but you're always running into an enemy that takes up way too much of your time and having to run across the entire world just to activate a small bit of dialogue. Huh, wha-? Oh right, a review.

[h1]and there's some small but notable gameplay differences[/h1]

They're really, really small. They do make a pretty damn big difference, though. The game's been turned into somewhat more of a strategy game- weapons have their own combo slot now and combos their own crits activated by certain criteria, so there's no more just hitting away at enemies with the latest weapon you grab- you have to think about if the extra damage would outweigh the advantages of the current combo setup, and if your new combo setup would be better, and if you'd be better off with the rush attacks instead of the power, and-where am I going with this?

The EXE gauge has been heavily nerfed. That thing was basically a "im bored kill it now just lets get it over with" button. Neat. Luckily, the gauge fills up much faster, so that's nice. Also, some of the EXE skills involve having the characters arrange themselves in a certain formation, so there's a bit of planning on "should i move my character there and risk being targeted and hit by an attack so i can use this skill" or some nonsense like that...I don't really know what to say. This review's pointless. Let's just skip to the conclusion.

[h1] so basically [/h1]

Yeah, let's just skip to here. You know exactly what this will be. If you like Nep Nep, you'll love this game. Don't like Nep Nep? You'll hate this game. People call this one the best one, and to an extent, I agree. (Still adamant on Re;Birth 3 being the best.) But, we all know this series is fucking dumb. Let's shake hands, and put those flaws aside to enjoy one of the most gloriously stupid fucking game series of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994792550', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4002, 'last_played': 1506373657}
review:
I am glad that it seems like with every installment the series keeps getting better. This time, it was a really nice eulogy for Sega as a console maker and the Dreamcast specifically.

The game uses the usual fighting system and adds a few things on top (Next forms, parts breaking, combat traits) without being too loaded. Outside battle, you still have a lot to do in the cities, shops, with the scouts, the dungeons and the world map. The story is slightly better this time around, the humour also seems to have improved. I really liked the OST, although they reused many tracks. The Japanese voice acting is excellent. Graphics are fine, too - nothing too fancy, but solid for this kind of colorful JRPG.

On the downside, the itemization pacing seems a bit off. You lose access to the investment option for a good amount of your game, but it is vital for improvements and even a key item. I ran around with the same weapons and processors  for quite a bit to suddenly drown in dozens of new ones when the game opened up again. Accessories and clothes still don't have stats (for a few exceptions).

All in all, I enjoyed playing this game a lot. Probably even more than any of the predecessors. If you like round-based JRPGs, meta humour (especially regarding videogames, character stereotypes and storytelling) and can stand the occasional fan service (nothing too revealing, they also poke fun at themselves for that, too), this might be your game. If you didn't like the series before, however, this game probably won't change that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123391007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4406, 'last_played': 1510335182}
review:
Finally got to play this, and boi! It was worth the wait!
So what made this so good?

Pros:
+ Awesome new characters!
+ New combo and EXE settings (Makes it a bit more fun, for me atleast)
+ Different story telling (Makes sense if you've played it)
+ Even more new music (YAS!!)
+ New scouts
+ Better graphics and quality
+ alot more!

Cons:
- No plutia....
- Arbore... 


Rating: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198095153113', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1687734280}
review: Uzume and adult Neptune are the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055075965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2943, 'last_played': 1555212045}
review:
I've played a whole slew of Neptunia games before and this is definitely a worthy entry.  All the characters are their usual quirky selves.  The 4th wall gets shattered, and rebuilt for the sole purpose of shattering it again.  There's a ton of meta references.  And the new characters are cool, especially Uzume (no she didn't slip me any credits to say that).  Basically, everything you enjoy from previous titles.

There were a few small changes made: some good and some bad.  I liked that they tied the weapons to their own combos, and combo traits to ensure crits, because it causes you to think about what style works best for you and realize not every new weapon is necesarily better for you.  I enjoy the strategy part of a game, and this added to it.  Not just picking out the newest weapon because this time it may not be better for you.

The investment system was fine although forgettable and I didnt really find a need to develop items much at all.

Difficulty-wise, it's usually not difficult (except optional dungeons), but there were some situations in the main dungeons where if you fought a certain enemy it was pretty much a game over, and every enemy will actively chase you and outrun you.  Wasn't too thrilled about that.  I don't mind difficulty, but some consistency would have been nice.

The new share system was a mixed bag for me.  Shares going down from being attacked did not make sense to me because taking damage in RPGs is a given and should not be penalized.  You could also game the system through scouts and investment, but at least it would negate the damage issue.

Scouts seems like a mixed bag.  They are both necessary and not.  They help you find new dungeons, items, and enemies, which can help you unlock quests, but the luck dependency can make this a chore, and makes quest hunting less prevalent than previous games.  Better than the Stella dungeons though, in my opinion.

My biggest issue though is the route building, which was pointless, but also having to traverse the entire world over and over again, instead of  teleporting.  I HATED going to Lowee and then back to Planeptune all the time, because you would get randomly jumped by usually very weak enemies, like Dogoos, leading to very pointless fights that should not even be there, sometimes a dozen times per trip.  And then I had one time when I got jumped by a enemy so powerful it one-shotted my entire party, leading to a very frustrating game over.  Really wish that system goes out or gets an overhaul.

Still though, very very enjoyable and I'm glad I spent 50+ hours on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059602829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1504477755}
review:
First of all i got the game for free, because i sold my soul to nep-nep. (I donÂ´t regret anything...)

Right i should write my opinions...

Pros:

+ Game breaks the 4thwall :D
+ many new characters
+ good soundtrack
+ nice CGÂ´s
+ improved combat and inventory
+ [spoiler] 2 nep-nepÂ´s in one game :D	[/spoiler]

Cons:

- many old monsters from previous games and dungeons
- i think it is a bit to expensive better buy it on a sale, especcialy if you buy dlcÂ´s for new characters and swimsuits ^^

So if you are a hyperdimension fan you will like the game and you will not make much wrong with buying the game, maybe you will sell your soul to nep but then you wouldnÂ´t be a nep fan in the first place.

And for newcomers maybe you should buy one of the re birth versions first before you buy this one, then you have some experience with this whole franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090937744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4360, 'last_played': 1650503259}
review:
Lighthearted
Smut-free
Grind-free but available
Epic track by Nubuo's band

This game is strong in most content and weak in game, so bear with me. You'll like the characters and their comments and banter. The setting is over-the-top and many anime gags are reused in fairly good taste. I'm on day 3 of headbanging to an extended remix of one track. Like many games I enjoy, I found myself wanting more story and character interaction. There aren't many types of monsters either.

I can't fault a game for being like a console RPG, but I can fault many console RPGs for being power-creep-driven grindfests that lack genuine challenges or choice in party ability/class makeup which would keep our attention. Game-wise there's not much challenge. But this is the sort of game you play to enjoy the characters anyway. And since it did a good job of that, I would recommend anyone play it from start to end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054646614', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1501792790}
review:
I don't get why this game gets all it's praise, sure it isn't bad it isn't great as some people claim it to be.

-The story is meh. Is predictable and your typical save the world thing, but the focus isn't in the story but in the characters,  the situations they find themselves in and the humour/jokes.
-The homour and joke can be hit or miss, some fun moments were great but I found most of them to be predictable and forced.
+The Battle system is interesting as it forces the player to think in order to link different attacks so you can give extra damage.
-The characters are your typical anime stereotypes, nothing really unique. I find it hard to point a character that I could find interesting.
-Grindind can be a pain, since there are moments where party members separates for a long time and when they come back they are 6 levels behind and you have to grind levels for them to catch up.
-This game is so unoptimized, I mean, it needs a GTX 960 for this kind of graphics? I also heard of players having frame rate issues even with good video cards that fall into the recommended cattergory.

So my veredict:
Don't buy it if you want a good story with good deep chracters.
Buy it on sale if you just want a light hearted game where characters derp around most of the time

Depois, comeÃ§a aquele monologo que geralmente tem nos jogos explicando sobre as deusas e seus feitos, aqui ele cita sobre um CPU Shift Period. Depois disso corta pra uma cena da Nep em um parque falando que teve um sonho estranho, ela escuta um barulho e vai lÃ¡ ver oque Ã©, chegando lÃ¡, ela escuta uma voz, "AlguÃ©m me salve!", ela fica confusa e voz novamente "AlguÃ©m, qualquer um...salve a Zero Dimension!", ela nÃ£o entende nada, mas acha um console no chÃ£o(console da qual ela nunca havia visto), ainda nÃ£o entendendo nada, decide levar o console consigo. LÃ¡ ela mostra o console para Nepgear, Histoire chega e pergunta onde ela estava(mas aqui tem um detalhe importante, pois neptune cita que histoire foi criada pela primeira deusa de planeptune, coisa nunca antes falada), Histoire explica pra Neptune oque Ã© o Shift Period, ja que ela nem se lembrava, ela fala que Ã© a Ã©poca em que as pessoas procuram novas deusas para seguir em vez das existentes, e fala pra ela levar isso a sÃ©rio pois mal rumores seriam espalhados sobre ela, a Nep nÃ£o da muita atenÃ§Ã£o e fala pra Nepgear ver o console, e mais uma vez a voz do console "AlguÃ©m, nos salve", a Nepgear acha muito estranho e aperta o botÃ£o do console, oque faz com que abra um portal e sugue as duas para outra dimensÃ£o. E Ã© aÃ­ que o jogo comeÃ§a.

Bom, e sobre a histÃ³ria, Ã© a melhor de toda a saga, o jogo cria todo um mistÃ©rio em volta da nova personagem, a Uzume Tennouboushi(aquela da primeira cena), criando todo um desenvolvimento pra ela, e outra, a histÃ³ria estÃ¡ cheia de detalhes e cheio de explicaÃ§Ãµes, tudo tem uma razÃ£o, alÃ©m disso ele ainda consegue concertar alguns furos dos jogos anteriores e fala sobre coisas nunca antes faladas na sÃ©rie, e o jogo ainda consegue conectar todas as histÃ³rias...apesar de deixar pequenos furos, mas sÃ³ pra quem Ã© mais observador para perceber. E como o jogo Ã© feito para novos fÃ£s tambÃ©m, nÃ£o Ã© necessÃ¡rio jogar os jogos anteriores para entender a histÃ³ria, mas se vocÃª nÃ£o jogou, vai pensar que estÃ¡ faltando coisa. Mas, ainda assim, no jogo tem alguns textos lÃ¡ na aba Nepedia que explicarÃ¡ algumas coisas.

E agora, falando sobre o jogo em si, ele Ã© composto de 3 histÃ³rias ou grandes capÃ­tulos, ZerodimensionZ, HyperdimensionG e HeartdimensionH. Cada um se passando em uma dimensÃ£o, como o nome jÃ¡ diz, e cada uma tem uma "abertura", similar aquela do comeÃ§o do jogo. E agora sobre o sistema de batalha, esse que teve algumas modificaÃ§Ãµes, a primeira delas Ã© que agora, um dos 3 ataques mudou, agora sÃ£o: Power(dano), Rush(combo) e Standart(algo entre os dois), a segunda mudanÃ§a Ã© que agora, cada arma possui diferentes combos, por exemplo, em determinada arma vocÃª sÃ³ pode botar 2 rushs, 3 powers e 1 standart, e vocÃª nÃ£o pode equipar um mesmo ataque mais de uma vez. E agora, foi adicionado os combo trait, cada ataque terÃ¡ um condiÃ§Ã£o do tipo "o ataque anterior Ã© Power", se vocÃª cumpre essa condiÃ§Ã£o sempre darÃ¡ dano critico. Sobre os skills e Exe Drive, a barra de EXE Drive voltou, mas ele tÃ¡ bem enfraquecido, porÃ©m Ã© mais fÃ¡cil de se usa-lo, a barra enche mais rÃ¡pido e em contrapartida, os skills ficaram mais fortes, o HDD tambÃ©m se ativa com o EXE Drive. Agora, alÃ©m de boss battle normais, no jogo existem as Giant Battle, nelas vocÃª enfrenta aqueles gigantes, vocÃª sÃ³ pode usar skills e fica se movendo em plataformas.

Sobre as Dungeons, elas receberam uma melhora impressionante, elas estÃ£o bem mais amplas e bem mais detalhadas, chegando ao ponto de eu me perder em uma delas, e agora, tem alguns objetos destrutÃ­veis dentro das dungeons, eles dropam itens ou liberam caminho pra vocÃª pegar outros itens, mas vocÃª sÃ³ poderÃ¡ destrui-los depois de ganhar o item Power Bracelet, e os monstros tambÃ©m estÃ£o melhores visualmente(uma dica, os monstros pegam mais dano quando sÃ£o atacados pelas costas ou pelos lados)...E mapa principal mudou tambÃ©m, agora vocÃª sÃ³ pode se mover em umas linhas, chamadas de rotas, vocÃª seleciona um ponto e a personagem vai atÃ© ele, mas enquanto a personagem estÃ¡ indo, vocÃª pode ser atacado, e ai, inicia-se uma batalha, eu nÃ£o vi problema nesse sistema no comeÃ§o, o problema dele Ã© perto do final, quando vocÃª tem que ir em pontos muito longes, ficar fazendo um monte de batalhas Ã© bem chatinho. O jogo tambÃ©m nÃ£o estÃ¡ difÃ­cil...sÃ£o mais alguns trechos ou chefes um pouco complicados, mas nada que vai deixar vocÃª lÃ¡ por muito tempo.

O jogo nÃ£o te da um monte de funcionalidades logo no comeÃ§o, na primeira histÃ³ria nem todas as funcionalidades do jogo estÃ£o liberadas. AlÃ©m do que jÃ¡ se podia fazer nas cidades(as lojas, disc devs, eventos e etc)agora vocÃª pode fazer mais algumas coisas(essas coisas sÃ³ sÃ£o adicionadas no segundo capÃ­tulo), existe agora o Investiment, vocÃª pode investir em 3 Ã¡reas(Comerce, os itens da loja aumentarÃ£o, Industrial, os itens do development aumentarÃ£o e Public Relation, suas shares aumentarÃ£o e vocÃª poderÃ¡ ver alguns eventos especiais, o nepstation por exemplo) e Scout, que Ã© igual o Stella Dungeon, mas agora vocÃª escolhe dungeons e coloca scouts pra explora-las, eles podem achar itens, dinheiro, outras dungeons e tesouros escondidos lÃ¡, mas vocÃª precisarÃ¡ encontrar fazendo alguns requisitos que o jogo pede, vocÃª pode upar os scouts tambÃ©m, o ruim do sistema Ã© q ele sÃ³ funciona quando vocÃª estÃ¡ no jogo. O development citado anteriormente, Ã© igual o remake system(nas cidades vocÃª tambÃ©m recupera sua vida). O lily rank recebeu mais atenÃ§Ã£o, alÃ©m de dar mais ataque ou defesa, ele serve pra usar os coupling skills, q sÃ£o quase iguais os formation skills. E falando sobre eles, agora eles  tem um novo jeito de se usar, vocÃª precisa cercar o inimigo que vocÃª quer usar, quando vocÃª estiver no local certo aparecerÃ¡ uma linha sobre elas. Agora as deusas tem tambÃ©m uma segunda transformaÃ§Ã£o, Next HDD, nÃ£o vou falar muito...mas funciona como um segundo HDD e tambÃ©m tem um skill muito forte que sÃ³ pode usar com essa transfomaÃ§Ã£o. Eu nunca havia falado sobre, mas a trilha sonora do jogo estÃ¡ muito boa, minha mÃºsicas favoritas da nep, estÃ£o nesse jogo.
Sobre os bugs, eu nÃ£o vi o da inteligÃªncia artificial desligar, mas tem um bug que acontece que se caso vocÃª conecte algum dispositivo USB no seu computador, o jogo fecha sozinho(mas talvez nÃ£o aconteÃ§a com vocÃª). 


Megadimension Neptunia VII, tem uma histÃ³ria muito boa, um gameplay bastante melhorado e uma trilha sonora Ã³tima, e eu volto a falar esse Ã© o melhor jogo da sÃ©rie Neptunia. E por fim Nep e Nep adulta>>all

author: {'steamid': '76561198060130183', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6389, 'last_played': 1501890481}
review:
[h1] First things first [/h1]

If you're looking for a game with deep story and shocking plot-twists then this game isnt for you, this game appeals to a very specific niche. But dont be affraid, enter the Neptune [h1] ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°) [/h1]

[u] Short Version [/u]

-Voice acting 10/10 (quality work right there)

-Story 8/10 (I pissed myself many times laughing)

-Art 8.5/10 (Gorgeous and non static)

-Mechanics 8.5/10 

-Characters 9/10 (This is why you keep playing, the characters just make you want to go back and play more with them)

-Replayability 8/10 (NG, NG+, etc) 

-OST 7/10 (enjoyable,average music, with the exception of 2 tracks)



Megadimension Neptunia VII is a turn-based JRPG with a funny story, magnificent characters and average OST. The mechanics are good enough to keep you entertained for a long time, you can develop items such as weapons, potions, sets, etc. This game is difficult to some extent, you're going to need better weapons and abilities in order to defeat harder bosses. 

The dungeons are ok; simple, but not big enough to make them monotonous. 
(Good) Weapons are hard to get, you gotta do some errands and defeat major enemies to get required materials or get the weapons directly by defeating them.

The strong point of this game are, without doubt, the characters. This is my very first Neptunia game and I absolutely loved every one of them, they're in synergy with the story doing things like breaking the fourth wall and making you laugh.

The art is pretty nice, very detailed, well colored. The voice acting seems to be done by pros because they are in line with the character personality and sounds great.

Neptunia's world is full of game references, in fact, you got 3 factions representing 3 major consoles:

-World; Gameindustri:

[list]
    [*]Lastation: PlayStation 3
    [*]Leanbox: Xbox 360
    [*]Lowee: Nintendo Wii
[/list]

I recommend this game if you like anime-style RPGs

author: {'steamid': '76561198102082367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7401, 'last_played': 1499173587}
review:
If you are already a fan of the series, then you should definitely pick up this addition. It's the best one yet!

If you are new to the series, there is no better time to start. It's the best one yet!

I had to play through the game twice just to get the True Ending. I wouldn't normally feel compelled to do something like that but I just couldn't leave it like that!

The PC port has some asset streaming issues, but fortunately in a game like this it doesn't really affect gameplay. It is a bit annoying, though. It does run pretty well for the most part.

For a much longer review: http://akmediablog.blogspot.com/2017/07/megadimension-neptunia-vii-game-review.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198348950233', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1500974966}
review: I'd only recommend this game to those completely uninterested in the game aspect. Characters are okay, I guess, and the writing is passable. So if you don't mind having to slog through unchallenging, dully-designed dungeons in a dully-designed world with non-existent structure in enemy designs in the middle of your visual novel, then go wild.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059091338', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1957, 'last_played': 1502073285}
review: Overall, the game feels not very different from Re;Birth 1 and 3 in my own personal opinion. The battle system changed a bit, for better or worse depends on you as they took out BREAK attacks, and EXE DRIVES seems really weak. Like I can do a full combo attack and inflict 20,000 damage, where as a 1 EXE or 2 EXE DRIVE does around 15K-18K. I'm better off just doing a full combo which requires no SP or EXE usage. The graphics just seems like they added a filter to it, and I heard from friends that you need a decently moderate GPU and CPU to play. I have a GTX 970 w/ an i5-4690K (both not overclocked) and I am not running into any crashes or issues, but the game really doesn't seem that graphically or processing intensive. I would recommend this game only if you want a time-sinker that isn't over 100 hrs for achievements, or for a jRPG that isn't serious with plot. This one definitely has better writing than the two previous Neptunia games I've played but it's still a mish-mash of memes like the previous. The girls are still adorable as ever, so for diehard Nep fans? GET IT! For non-diehard fans, don't. You may just think it is a waste of time and money. Honest opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137579844', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 4212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2572, 'last_played': 1593616348}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII
Rate: 85/100

This game has three main stories, and progressed along as you play. So, i'll tell you per chapters review.

1. Zero Dimension Neptune Z: Twilight of The Desperate CPU
This is where you start, when Neptune pressed a button at a Swirly marked console, Neptune and Nepgear thrown to Zero Dimension where in this dimension seems really a scrapyard place.

The difficulty of this main story is can't be compromised enough, i've fallen to game over screen more than twice. Why?
- No DLC except Free DLC can company you through the end of this main story
- The monsters are really tough, you can't stick with only with a combo.

But i've managed to finish this 1st trilogy at all characters gone to lvl 21.

2. Hyperdimension Neptunia G: The Golden Leaders, Recontructors of Gamindustri
After fighting with Dark CPU at Zero Dimension, Neptune and Nepgear set back to Hyper Dimension where they come from. It's was currently at CPU Shift Period where many hoaxes between four nations are spread out. Neptune came with an idea to make a Festival and held a competition. At the final phase, four unknown person named 'Gold Third' came and defeated Four CPU.

In this 2nd trilogy, all DLC can be used. If you want to play this game as challanging as enough, don't buy or use any DLCs. It'll break the game. Why?
- DLC Characters are carried over to other CPU Story.
- The chatacter levels are grown up continously, can you imagine when playing Vert's Playtrough starting with lvl 21 and you have own DLC Characters at lvl 30? Sounds easy right?

3. Heart Dimension Neptunia H: Trilogy Finale, Into the Despair...
End of the trilogy, a black hole appeared above gamindustri's sky. Neptune and gang set off to investigate about it. 

This last trilogy has it's own dimension called "Heart Dimension" which is really makes me scared about it. The dimension itself seems not realible for someone to live.

=======================================================
Main Review, comparing to Rebirth series.

1. Number of Playable Characters (Default)
Rebirth 3 > VII

2. Monster Difficulty
Rebirth Series < VII

3. EXP and Grinding
Rebirth Series > VII

4. Others
- In VII, plan are different in rebirth series. It's much more like crafting system.
- Challanges are available, but it's easier than Rebirth 3
- Combo system are different. you can't use the same combo at the time, your combo pattern is decided by the weapon itself and in addition of that, there's combo trait that increase damage if the combo trait has triggered.
- Disc Dev will no longer have increased EXP chip or anything like that, but you can Dev a disc that has "Learning" ability. Allows you to receive EXP when not at front party.
- EXP distribution is only for front party or characters has "Learning" Ability.
- There is no "Stella's Dungeon" anymore and has replaced with "Scout" which has ability to explore a dungeon which gains items, credits, discover a new dungeon, found a hidden treasure secrets, found a new enemy, also found a new scout to send it to scout.
- EXE Drive Gauge is only per battle and not stored when finished battle. The EXE Drive Gauge easily to fill itself when facing more than 1 enemy and using rush combos.
- Haven't tried to break damage limit, since it's still too hard to get 9999 damage. My max single damage is still around 5k so i don't know too much about this.
- New skill type: Combination Skill. Link up with corresponding character to use Combination Skill (EXE Drive Gauge required)
- Transforming to HDD Form or Gold Mode cost 1 EXE Drive Gauge. Rebirth series don't even need it.
- The fastest way to increase lily power between character is to put target at front party.
- Most impartant thing at RPG. "You can STEAL ITEMS!"
- Break the breakable props to find hidden items, instead of jumping or searching with radar.
- No more "Tough Enemies". Only Enemy Change.
- No more "System Plan". You can't make enemies weaker or stronger, or something similliar with Rebirth series's System Plan.
- There's still Nepstation, but it seems like no more quiz?
- You'll face two Neptune. Yes, Two Neptunes.
- Rarity are applied to VII. Currently only saw R and SR.
- More hits means more EXP, meanwhile more Damage Dealt means more Credits.
- There are Investment features, which grants you a new shop lineup, new items to craft, and maybe free stuff from citizen.
- Entering dungeon by pointing nep cursor to dungeons? no. Create a line to target's dungeon in order to enter a dungeon, and then see your party's leader running to target.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979434217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1500269795}
review:
Well, I started the game looking forward to another mainline Neptunia game...and was rather rapidly disappointed. 

The bad:
The series has never been some grand source of storytelling but in the past it has been enjoyable and entertaining; with VII I found myself utterly uninterested in the story until maybe the last quarter of the game and even then it didn't come close to garnering the interest that the Rebirth games got from me.

Compounding the issues with the storyline were a few elements of the gameplay. I utterly detested the introduction of route building as having to connect locations with a route, and then follow the routes to get anywhere served only to waste time...especially with the random battles you would get into along the way. Simply getting anywhere for the story, never mind grinding rapidly became an annoying experience.

Lesser irritations included the game deciding the equipment on your characters whenever new characters entered the party, which wouldn't have been too bad a problem if it weren't for how often characters enter and leave (also the game would sometimes seem to change equipment setups even with characters that didn't leave the party). The investment system may have been interesting in concept but in practice it just meant grinding more credits.

We also had the new characters: Uzume/Orange Heart was ok; Adult Neptune failed to add anything (she actually at times made me dislike her) and the Gold Third (C-Sha, S-Sha, E-Sha and B-Sha) I pretty much entirely disliked. 

There's also all the characters dropped from this game such as Plutia/Iris Heart, but even more surprisingly Falcom, Mages., MarvelousAQL and Broccoli. Sure, they weren't main characters but they were still staples of the series.

Mixed impressions:
The battle system revamp, while small was a step forward in trying to get players to do more than hit a single button. The dungeons had more interesting designs, though this was coupled with some annoyances in traversing them (best exemplified by the Golden Summit in Leanbox and especially with parts of Neplunker). 

The Good:
The music for the game was easily the best of the series. Neptunia banter (pretty much the usual here, though I didn't think it was quite as good).

Summary:
I've seen a lot of people hold up Megadimension Neptunia VII as the best of the series, and quite frankly I can't see it. This was the first time I actually struggled to bring myself to finish one of the mainline Neptunia games and the only time with them that upon getting my first ending for the game I was like "Well, game finished, I'm done, time to move on to the next entry in my backlog." 

If I was to recommend a Neptunia game, it'd be Rebirth 3 or 1. In fact, I might actually recommend Rebirth 2 over this (and I never would have thought I'd recommend 2 over any mainline Neptunia games before). Megadimension Neptunia VII I honestly feel I can safely say is the worst of the mainline Neptunia games. I hope that Idea Factory can get back to the feel of the Rebirth games, as even with their faults, I vastly prefer all 3 of them to this.

review:
Pra comeÃ§ar, eu sou um fÃ£ de JRPG's, e adoro jogos como Final Fantasy, bravily, dragon quest, Fire Emblem e a lista continua...
..e na minha opiniÃ£o, esse jogo nÃ£o perde em nada para os jogos citados acima. Da trilha sonora ate a historia, com isso dito, vou a uma analize mais profunda...

#OQUE ESTA ESCRITO AQUI Ã‰ SO A MINHA OPINIÃƒO E EXPERIENCIA COMO JOGADOR, COM ISSO, VOCE PODE ACHAR OUTRA COISA...

Vamos a historia do jogo, que conta a historia de garotas que sÃ£o a personificaÃ§Ã£o de consoles e devs, com a Neptunia "a protagonista" representando um console nÃ£o lanÃ§ado da SEGA, o project neptune "que foi anunciado mais foi canÃ§elado antes de seu lanÃ§amento", a Noire, representando os consoles de mesa da sony, a Blanc, os consoles de mesa da nintendo, e a Vert, representando o xbox, e elas tem suas irmÃ£s mais novas, a Nepgear "que seria uma continuaÃ§Ã£o do gamegear, da SEGA", a Uni, que representa os portateis da sony e as irmÃ£s Rom e Ram, representando os console portateis da nintendo "a Ram Ã© a verÃ§Ã£o de tamnho normal, como o 3ds, e a Rom representa os maiores, como o 3ds xl"

Com os personagens principais explicados, a primeira coisa que eu pensei quando ouvi isso de um amigo foi: esse jogo deve ser meio cliche...
...muito pelo contrario, o jogo explora cada detalhe desses consoles, como propagandas, jogos, ate mesmo como a empressa que os vaz se comporta no mercado, e coloca tudo isso com uma historia boa, com seus momento engraÃ§ados e momento tristes "ate mesmo com momento serios que se tornÃ£o comedia total"

Sobre a qualidade grafica, se voce se emporta muito com graficos realistas, talves voce estranhe um pouco o jogo, mais depois que se acustuma voce ve que o grafico do jogo combina com ele...

A trilha sonora e muito boa tem musicas que me marcarÃ£o como minicar e remnant "e olha que eu me inporto muito com a trilha sonora..." por exemplo, quando voce ta em um momento serio e do nada comeÃ§a a tocar minicar, voce nem precila ler a fala pra seber que o momento provavelmente vai ficar engraÃ§ado

Os pontos negativo que eu achei do jogo sÃ£o seu bad ending "que eu estava esperando algo meis sombrio..." e a facilidade que voce tem na maioria do gameplay "depois eu joguei o re:birth 1, e eu levei um susto!!!"

Otimo jogo, Rcomendo

review:
Seems very similar to previous games in the series. If you like those then you'll probably like this too.

Only critiques thus far are that the characters you get to play seem very... squishy with exp grinding not really being a viable option (at least in the early game, not gotten much further than that yet) and it seems to lack the polish of previous games with a *LOT* of spelling/grammatical errors where there used to be basically none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054935029', 'num_games_owned': 1793, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 2607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2569, 'last_played': 1510958361}
review:
This is the fourth entry into the hyperdimension series. 

After the original series people started to get fed up with the amount of resources being reused in the games so this one is quite different, it uses a new engine which looks so SO much better but its still optimised nicely.

The combat system is similar to the past few games but additions have been made to to the combo system so its easier to understand and more fluid and action packed. There is a lot more emphasis on strategy in this game compared to the last ones as a result there is a higher chance of you dying several times which is nice as it was easy to steamroll through the past few games they made. 

Each of the big four get a second stage of HDD and in turn they are getting new combos and style systems to follow suit. Theres different types of combat that you will face as well with the new types of bosses which are massive, you have to move and create patterns and lines around the bosses to best them as effectively as possible. 

Story and banter is just as good as always but the theme of this seems to be a bit more mature at times but still hilarious none the less. I dont think it beats the third game though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176772574', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1778, 'last_played': 1500220660}
review:
Ok, let's get down to the review :

Pros :
- Tons of waifus to choose, each with their distinctive personality
- A lot of game content (70 Hours, first playthough)
- Decent story
- Decent english dub (TBH, i prefer nep2 english voice, the jap can be too anoying sometimes)
- Some of the dungeon looks really cool (especially Lowe)
- Nice soundtrack
- Is that a motherfucking other's JRPG reference???
- Neplunker is fun
- The way boobs bounce in this game makes you feels like a miserable human being

Cons :
- One of the heroine is a mentally unstable jailbait
- They sometimes recycle the dungeon, and just change the name and monster spawn
- Ahh, they also recycle the monster (this is problematic, since some monster share the exact same sprite but the other one can be ridiculously OP)
- Monster hitbox is a mess, this is a big problem due to symbol attack and secret treasure mechanic (the battle start when you make contact with monster, however for some monster the hitbox ridiculously bigger than it's sprite)

This is my first Neptunia game, overall i'm very pleased with this game and planning to buy Neptunia VS Sega Hard Girls. 
At 7-8 USD, this game is ridiculously cheap and extremely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171951447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1107, 'last_played': 1502484013}
review:
Best Neptunia game so far.
If you likes the other games (say Re;Birth or the PS3 ones), chances are you will fall in love with this game in the first hours of gameplay.
Graphically speaking the game looks better than ever and the dungeos look more alive than before (at least there's more this time around).
The soundtrack is just too good, and is worth the 6$ price for the deluxe set.
The DLC tho i don recommend using it in your first playthroug, while is not that OP as in other Compile Heart games (im looking at you Mugen Souls) i can ruin your adventure making you invincible for the most time of your adventure.

So basically, i higly recommend this game, if you like a good JRPG this game is four you. And if youÂ´re new to the series, i higly suggest you to buy the Re;Birth trilogy, as they're algo good games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000878931', 'num_games_owned': 1177, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 2774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2696, 'last_played': 1498487512}
review:
It's another adventure with nep nep and freinds! 

This game story is played out a little differently then others. It is broken up into sections. Theres the begining. Then there is a part where you play 4 different story sections with the 4 cpus. Then there is the wierd gold third part. Then finally the end. 

The onlly part i did not like about the game is they pretty much re used the same jokes over and over again from the previous games. If you do not have a lewd since of humor you may not get any of them. 

Anyways battle is your typical action turn based rpg game play where it is pretty much like the tales of series. If you 
played the previous nep nep games then you basically played them all. 

Except this game adds giant battles. Even though there is very few of them and all you have to do is spam your skills and heal ever now and then.  In the gian battles you are in your cpu forms right away you need to use the rock formations to move around on the field. 

My only advice is to not have the cpuson the same rock section.
The music is more or less the same i didn't really notice any new tracks. 

Dungeons play out the game you are in a 3d space and you move around in it. The monsters apear on the field if you touch them then you will trigger a battle sequence. The only time random battle happens is on the world map. 
One cool feature i will give idea factory credit for is the 3d scenes even though there are very few in the game what is there looks awesome. 


Once again though if you played the other nep nep games then you've played this one. Other then the neat new addition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018920874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7904, 'last_played': 1515596085}
review:
Not much to say. 
It's te best example of the Neptunia JRPG series to date, but for some reason it's not avalible in Japanese.

I'm studying Japanese myself. I've also seen Japanese customers on this and other product review sections complaining about the lack of a Japanese language option for games that were clearly made in Japan. 

I distinctly recall seeing screenshots of the game in Japanese as well, so I don't understand why the option isn't there when I open up the game's properties menu. 

Am I just an idiot looking in the wrong place? 
Is this a regional thing? 

One way or the other, I think it would make a lot of people happy if the game's Japanese text was made avalible to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023427268', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2762, 'last_played': 1495400041}
review:
Oooh this series... This new one that came out (As in 6/17/2017 Review one year later)

The graphic was "drastically improved" in a way that look like the New Gen on PS4. The graphics are meh in my taste. The new form is even more broken, A new protagonist Uzume Tennouboshi I wanted to become attached. She is amazingly funny with her sudden imagination of her somehow lewd fantasy. The new way of mapping, investing, and items are kawl (No more RNG Hidden Boxes yey). Has some Spelunky reference which is also cool, and having backups that help you with buffs is really dandy. I like this game for being a weirdly well-done performance. Also, has strange performance issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034039927', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3480, 'last_played': 1527196300}
review:
I love the Neptunia series despite the odd choices they make at times, and when it comes to the core games this entry is the best yet on Steam. The story covers three campaigns following multiple character paths and plenty of content to dig into. HDD forms feel awkwardly limited this time around but the combat features plenty of other options that I can overlook it. General pacing is done better than past games, especially the beginning which is difficult but more focused. The world map random battles are a pain though. The game nails it on the presentation side of things though. The OST is one of the best I've ever heard in a video game and it's not shy about showing off the fantastic graphical designs.

[url=http://www.neoseeker.com/hyperdimension-neptunia-victory-2/user_reviews/37041/]Full review here.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197974004598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 5240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4816, 'last_played': 1497321798}
review:
This is a game that changed it all for me. 

I thought Neptunia games were just some kind of fanservice grindfests, which they admittedly to a certain degree are, but they are also more than that.

In this game you travel between dimensions and meet fun and interesting characters. The story seems simple at first, but it quickly gets more interesting and addicting, and towards the end when you think you know the ending, you don't. It pulls the rug from under you and surprises you by just being a great story.

Its just wonderful how they managed to make a story that connects everything so well together.

Other than that this game is filled with anime and gaming tropes, and it references both mediums a lot. 4th wall is broken constantly and the fun, lovable *bubbly* characters just bring a smile to my face every time I see them.

Gameplay is a bit repetetive, but its nothing new if you have played JRPGs before. It looks like one, and it plays like one. Grinding might be needed at times.

The DLC are all worth it somehow(?) Now that's a surprise!

This game made me understand why I love video games and anime better than anything before... and I never thought a Neptunia game would do that. 

Don't underestimate or overlook this game. Its great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105144358', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 4378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4378, 'last_played': 1698667505}
review: This is the fourth game in the mainline series. It has a fun combat system. Introduces Next forms for the CPUs. Monsters look creepy like they did in the first Neptunia game on the PS3. Collectible trading cards and figures which are fun to collect from consumable items. Investments for each nation offer rewards and events. The Colosseum looks more like a colosseum than it ever has in the series. I don't see the point in route building when CPUs never built routes anywhere in the previous games which makes it seem odd now. This game introduces Adult Neptune and tbh I find this to be the ideal version of Neptune because long hair and longer legs. Just saying. There is one dungeon in Heart Dimension that brings back the maze-like layout like what the dungeons in the first Neptunia for the PS3 had. There's a lot to do in this game and it is the best of what the series has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114339588', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 10632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6712, 'last_played': 1497056077}
review:
TL;DR: 8/10 nep game, definitely get it if you're a fan of the series but it's also a good rpg for newcomers.

Now.. some reviews are saying this is "more of the same", but it really isn't. If you're coming from the Re;Birth games, know that there are some fundamental differences between this game and them. I'm on my second playthrough at the moment to get another ending, the first took about 60 hours. I'll list the pros and cons now:

PROS

+ Improved graphics. Didn't think I'd ever say that about a Neptunia game, but there you have it. You'll notice the improvements right away when you take control of Nep for the first time.
+ New cool enemies. They made a bunch of new monsters to keep things fresh.
+ There are fewer dungeons, but each is now massive compared to the previous games. Some have up to 4 different areas.
+ Improved battle gameplay. EXE gauge is back but balanced. It charges way faster but is depleted after every fight. EXE moves are now better balanced and considerably weaker, sometimes it's better to just use a skill or a normal combo instead of an EXE.
+ Combos have changed. There's no easy way to explain this, but the combos you build will depend on your weapon. You can't repeat the same move, and each of them has a certain condition that if met, will land a sure critical hit. Choosing weapons is not just about stats and area of attack anymore.
+ The controller vibrates with attacks, making them pretty satysfying.
+ Formation skills. Like EXEs, they aren't particularly strong but now you need to make an actual formation to use them (line, triangle or square) and the move will hit every enemy caught inside.
+ Scout system. Some may dislike this, some my like it. Instead of Stella's Dungeon, now you have multiple Scouts that you can send everywhere to get items for you and provide bonuses while you're in the dungeon they were deployed to. For example, if you want to grind for credits you can send every Scout with a Credits UP bonus to a dungeon you like and then go grind there. The Scouts will also find new dungeons, unlock new monsters in dungeons and bring back new scouts.
+ More challenging than the previous games.
+ A new epic type of boss battle. Not too difficult, but looks awesome!
+ New fun characters. I don't think anyone can dislike Steamax.
+ Great story. Lots of mysteries that you'll piece back together at the end.

CONS

- Routes and route building. In my opinion, a major flaw in this game's design. Now instead of just selecting from the map the dungeon or city you want to go, they are now connected by routes that your character will need to traverse to get from one place to another. This process may trigger random encounters and can take quite a bit of time if you want to go from a dungeon in Leanbox to another near Lowee, for example. It's extremely annoying and time consuming for no good reason.
- Party building. This may or may not be a small story spoiler, so read at your own risk. [spoiler]Thought you could get a stable party early on? Nope. The girls will get constantly separated into parties of two or three through the whole game. Only near the end you'll have all of them together to finally form your dream party. The way this is handled story-wise is pretty cool, but considering it's an RPG this was very frustrating. [/spoiler]
- Investment. You can now invest in cities to unlock new plans, items for sale and events. Compared to the previous games where you would find this stuff while exploring.. this is a big money sink.
- There are fewer plans, from what I can tell. I ended up only making a few (6 or so) because for some reason the materials seemed very hard to come by.
- The Scouts can be bothersome to manage. You need to be in a city to get their report, not from the menu like Stella's Dungeon. Also minor (and expected) story spoiler: [spoiler]There are three different dimensions. You can't get a report from a Scout that you sent to another dimension, so you have to travel all the way there through the annoying routes to get their stuff, and then come back to whatever you're doing. Of course, this can be avoided by not sending them to other dimensions. [/spoiler]
- Characters won't level up if they aren't in the main fighting party. Some of them have the "Learning" ability that lets them do so, but most don't.
- Lily rank seems to increase very slowly when coupling. But now it also increases very quickly between all the four front row characters. So before coupling a pair, you might want to let them fight side by side first.

Overall this is a great addition to the Neptunia series. There are some mechanics that could be improved, but this is a mostly fresh game, different from what we're used to. I'm extremely happy that Idea Factory and Compile Heart came this far with Nep games. Now we wait for Cyber Dimension 4 GO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031826186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5236, 'last_played': 1525997245}
review:
Slightly sad that some of the classic makers don't make a reappearance, especially me waifu MAGES..

However, the new -Sha girls are cool, the dlc characters are cool (except nitroplus imo, but even I can't denie her insanely powerful debuffs. Milly though is way cool) and all the classic cpu's, their sisters, and the 2 og makers IF and Compa are all here.

If your a fan of the Neptunia series, this is still a solid game. If your new, I'd recomend Re;birth 1 or 2 just to make the rest of the games a bit more enjoyable. If there is anything I've learned from the Neptunia series, it's that doing some basic research makes the funny references even more enjoyable. It's how I found my favorate anime after all, I researched the background of me waifu MAGES. and found Stiens; Gate.

review:
Ce jeu est une suite a Hyperdimension Re;birth 3 (sans avoir besoin d'y avoir jouÃ©) avec une trame de voyage  entre les dimensions afin de les sauver. De nouveaux personnages (surtouts dans les DLC), une durÃ©e de jeu immense, des graphismes de qualitÃ© et des nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s  ! Un Gameplay largement plus facile que les prÃ©cÃ©dents opus mais reste tout de mÃªme, a mon avis, un jeu assez difficile pour les nouveaux joueurs/joueuses , comme pour leur premier opus "Hyperdimension Re;birth 1".

 Il est sans doute le meilleur jeu de la saga "Hyperdimension Neptunia" et il n'est pas nÃ©cessaire d'avoir jouer Ã  tous les jeux pour comprendre la trame, Ã  chaque opus, toujours une prÃ©sentation des personnages pour le bonheur des fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075338993', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4400, 'last_played': 1557534544}
review:
If you are a fan of the Hyperdimension series, this is a must have. This is the best game in the series in my opinion. The game basically has 3 different games put together into one. Each part has its own story, last boss, and credits.
Pros:
   Gameplay is very long(40-45hours)
   Better and more engaging gameplay mechanics
   So much more playable characters(Later in the game)
Cons:
   Does not feel like a sequel to Victory. 
Score:9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198274858100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2907, 'last_played': 1591430727}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII is not the best game ever, but somehow it become very memorable to me. Why? Because it has taken me by surprise. First let me tell you about what I think as pros and cons of this game:

Pros: 

-Great story
-Loveable characters, even the new ones
-Transformation sequence (Finally!)
-Great voice actors
-Amazing VN artworks
-Great soundtracks
-Dedicated cutscenes with 3D graphics (It's not great, but it's a progress)

Cons:

-Outdated graphics
-Uninspiring and tedious dungeons
-The second arc of the story feel more like a filler 
-Awkward animations
-Random encounters (can only be disabled in new game+)
-They still reusing some assets from previous games and sometimes doesn't even bother to 
 make it look a little bit different

While the previous installments are loveable by many fans (including me), I always find myself struggling to finish it because of the generic, cliche story and boring gameplay. But that's not the case with Megadimension Neptunia VII. The main reason why I love Megadimension Neptunia so much is because the story is above my expectation. It's not the usual "all time fun" story like the previous games, it's more emotional, serious and engaging. Many of the characters that has appeared since the beginning of the series show more depth in their personality, especially Nepgear. The new characters: Uzume, Umio and the Gold Third is also loveable. I will even admit that Uzume has become my favorite character in Neptunia series.

It's not a perfect game, no, and maybe I overhyping it a bit in my review. But it certainly the best game that the series has to offer as for now and I really like it. Other people might have a different opinion, but If I must rate this game, I would rate it 8.5/10

well i been playing all of the other series (and getting all the achivement except rebirth 2) and this is my personal opinion.

New waifu and its Uzume

author: {'steamid': '76561198181200775', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3260, 'last_played': 1547947988}
review:
Where to start...

The overall game is great, the story as some turn of event that hook me all along, even on my second run, the characters are, as always, full of the Nepnep atmosphere that you would expect from the serie, I wouldn't ask more from the graphic, and I could say more and get boring with technical stuff.

Lets be honest, its a Neptunia game, so its perfect as that if you find a con, there will be one or more pro to balance to the awesome side. I could say some stuff, but I won't spoil.

The game as a great replayability (sorry if i have a bad grammar). After your first run, which as big chance to get the normal ending, you get new features that, thanks whatever God or thing you believe in, you were wishing for in the first run.

First playable male character is a fish. See Umio DLC. No, seriously, a fish, and the most awesome fish you will ever see. Pretty fashion fish.

I'd say, buy this game as soon as you want. Hunt the specials or whatever, but get it. Umio is a life saver, and the other DLC character are up to you and your knowledge if the reference they are. I got God Eater because I love that serie and understand all the little references, but sadly getting Nitroplus for me would be a cool character that is unknown to me.
Weapons and Processor Unit are overkill, only activate them after you get the perfect ending. My opinion, you do what you want.

Music wise, I love it. Deluxe pack give you all, ordered, named, divided in two themed disc folder.

Buy it, but play the previous titles before to not lose some greatness of Nepnep. You don't want to miss Plutia, I swear you don't. Get the previous titles.

I give it the rating of Uni Curry out of Lastation Curry. You want something plain, you get greatness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043575278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 7860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5058, 'last_played': 1527239758}
review:
There's a very good chance you already know what this game is about, so I'm gonna keep it short and assume you know what I'm talking about.

So basically Megadimension Neptunia VII has two major areas worth discussing, and those would be the gameplay and the art/plot/voice acting/character design/music.
The gameplay is more or less what you'd expect, standard jrpg turn based battles, but they changed a lot of things. EXE bar charges quicker but resets every battle, the map is connected by roads, you can invest, send scouts around, play neplunker, they removed that thing that tells you where the items drop, there are epic as fuck battles against giant enemies, you can break body parts --- The list would be very long. Some of those changes are good, some aren't, and you're gonna find many complaints about said elements, but let me tell you something.

It doesn't really matter if they are good or bad. The fact that they are there is to make you feel you're playing something new, to make you understand that they didn't just copypaste RE;Birth 3. And I believe it worked: the game feels fresh, even if it's basically the same Neptunia game in the end.

As for the second area, well, it's AMAZING. The music is a masterpiece, the plot is meh (not bad, but not that exciting either), new characters are awesome (Uzume is such a great one I couldn't believe it), the art and animation is really funny and greatly improved, and the voice acting is the stuff of legends. You know how there are some characters that are not that interesting like Ram or Nepgear? Well forget all that shiet, because they now have GREAT lines and are voiced in a way that you can't do anything else but love them.

Something I was a little disappointed with was the video quality for the video sequences. They feel weird, the colors are strange looking, IDK.
Also there are some new drawings for characters like Vert and Noire, they are not at an angle but stare directly at you, and they look a little puffy and silly. The others are good, but those two are way worse.

Overall, yes, definitely buy this game. It's the most fun I've had since a very long time.
And it has Nep Nep in it, so that should be enough by itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111003032', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4630, 'last_played': 1515011569}
review:
I love this franchise with all my kokoro! 
Nep-nep! Fanservice, trolling, dialogs, plot, chatacters, references, soundtrack, breaking the fourth wall, maho girls, transformation and more and more and more...UMIO! Fish with Hayami Sho (Aizen Sousuke) voice!!!! It's f***ing incredible! Even if you don't like neptune - play a game of it for Umio and Uzume! And third form! It's really adorable, cute and incredible!!!!
Part of the Uzume is the best part in the entire franchise, but most part a golden piece sucks (exception - Blank part).
The worst combat system of the entire franchise. There is no point in a normal attack, use only skills. Absolutely useless giant boss batlles.
Very good game for anime lovers and real funny and intresting visual novel.
I can reccomend this game only for anime lovers, not for ordinary people!

MegaDimension Neptunia VII - Supreme Nep

review:
[u] Review #2 --- Finished the game --- HalfWay for my second playthrough. [/u]
**The First part of the review is the stats review for those who fly throught the reviews, Text part will be lower :Csha_VII: !**
[h1] STATS Review: [/h1]
[table]
    [tr]

        [td]Overall[/td]
        [td][b]8/10[/b][/td]
[tr]

        [td][b]9/10[/b][/td]
    [/tr]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[b]What I dislike:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Everytime you jump it spam an anoying random quote
    [*]Waaay too much text to read (its not a really bad thing) *1 (read what I like)
    [*]Some "Evil characters" are kinda lame.
    [*]Hard to really master. (Every part of the game)
    [*]Contents are too much for one playthrough. *2 (read what I like)
[/list]

[b]What I REALLY loved: [/b]
[list]
    [*]The English dubbed voices are better than most animes !
    [*]A LOT of voice acting *1
    [*]The Story <3
    [*]The character developement.
    [*]The content is really riche !
    [*]The characters in general are interesting.
    [*]The Special attacks animation is worth watching any times XD
    [*]The imprevisibility of the game.
    [*]A second playthrought is SO worth it ! *2
[/list]

[h1] Review Intro: [/h1]
(its the first time that i'll put a lot of effort into a review, I might do some similar reviews for other games ^^.)
Megadimension Neptunia VII was actually the first nep-nep I bought. 
I first started to play neptuniaVII because I was looking for a J-RPG that was openworld.. (I was wrong AF) I didnt knew nothing about Neptunia games.. But in the end.. I was completely blown away from the content this game offered for the price !
I played many type of games before and I never had the sense of a "full" solo game since "SaintsRow2".
I'm not saying that those other games I've played between the time I've play SR2 to the time I do this review were not games that were not "full". But rather say that.. 3D, 2D, VisualNovel, MMO, or whatever Does not matter when it comes to a games that is made almost flawlesly (Or personally Flawless).
To me, NeptuniaVII just felt Perfect in content and story.

I have now started Hyperdevotion Noire and Re:Brith3. 
I have also started to watch the anime of Hyperdimension Neptunia :) (Its really good IMO)

[b] My Gaming path: (Sub Intro)[/b]
(Some said in my past reviews that I dont know gaming, Its ok I dont want to prove I know something. But rather explaine my perception of view on games)

I am the type of gamer that play most of the time MMO's and Competition games. Since i'm very open toward any type of game, I gave the chance of SO many different games.. But in the end 99% of them made me feel like the game was just designed to look good visualy, to show revolutionare features or to look really apealing. 
Some of those personal "PublicStuntGames" Include: Apb:Reloaded, Watchdog, GTA5, Battlefield 1, CoD:Bo2-Zombies, Black Desert Online, (and more). (Ps. I Love BDO)
I know many love those games, But to me.. They are games the biggest aspect that were polished in those game.. were the selling points.
[b] Example of How I see those games (Not actual review): [/b] Watchdog was pushed to be sold for graphics(even tho they failed there anyways) they also didn't delivered the possiblities that the game could had offer.. /// Apb is a game made to lure those who ever wanted a "Gta-like MMO" But deliver the minimum basic of a "Gta-Like".. (Basic.. might be too much to say how low the quality of "gta-like" content is in the game) And also dont deliver many mmo features. /// BDO... an mmorpg that is Over-polished on the graphics side.. The content is big.. but 0 tutorial from the devs, 0 explaination, 0 guides from the devs.. The "What im I gonna do next?" is not answered by the game at all. The story is rushed to the point of being almost inexistant.

[h1] THE REVIEW ! [/h1]

[b] First playthrough: [/b]

[u] Ending: Failed(Bad ending) --- Gamestyle: Rushed --- Cutscenes / Voice: Listened - Videos: Watched - Text: Skiped	[/u]

When I entered the game I didnt knew what to expect !
FIRST thing I did.. what to trow my headphone away and die... (Or almost) XD
Went in my sound volume and lowered the Neptunia game volume T_T
First the little cinematic that rocks xD And then the little "arcade" Menu.. Its when I was like "Oh no... The game looks really empty :/"(I was so wrong..).
Then I clicked with a MOUSE "New game". 
[b] The NEXT part will contain spoilers, "Black boxes" over the text mean its a spoilers, dont hover your mouse on it if you dont want to be spoiled ![/b]
At first its start like a visual novel, The voices (English) were AMAZING, The animation Really great and the first little bit of the story got me hooked :)
[spoiler] Then The game REALLY started o.o" After the little "intro" the game started in Zero dimension with a Super awesome Anime-like Intro ! Music 9/10, animation 8/10 OP(overall) 9/10.

I was hyped ! The OP got me like OMG.. its not started yet O.o? XD
Another "start the game menu" apear... Im like.. "WTF? oh.. so its like many mini games?"..(I was so wrong AGAIN xD) 
[/spoiler]
So I start the gameplay with a MOUSE. and im like.. wow.. wtf? Its unplayable... eww...
What is this gameplay anyways? ._. 
I then pluged my Xbox Controller in my PC, Had to restart the game.
Hit "Continue" and IM BACK :D
Ajusted my sensivity, took a little look at the menu. Every think looked great !

First "3D" Interactions:
So I was HEY :D Im in a 3d anime game :D Might aswell jump of joy :D !...
*Hit the button (A)" *YAAH*..... Oh.. I see... (A) is for attacks.. okeeey..
*Hit the button (x)" *Menu pops up* No ! *Back*
*Hit (B)* *Nep: Jump like a kangerou!!!* xD okey cool. I dont really like that but.. hey.. I can jump at least..
*do the tutorial* (its really quick and easy... I mostly just skipped everything Histy told me lol)
[spoiler] *Moved a little bit and BAM its a visual novel again.. im like What? xD[/spoiler]
More tutorials and some bla bla, Now I just want  to FIGHT !
*Move toward enemy* *Enemies on sight >:D* Imma hit them with my SLOW attack (A) *Getting closer to them !*
AAAAAND *Hit (A)*... *Loading* .... What??...... The heck is this? .. well ok? '-'


First battle sequance: 
*Tutorial* Oh shut up histy -.-"" *Skip, skip, skip*
All right Im ready to FIGHT !
.. wait what is that UI? weird... OOOH I SEE Its like the old Final Fantasys OOOH !
Well ok... ok.

So yah at first I didnt really "enjoy"(?) the game (not as I do now).
But after [spoiler] Zero dimension [/spoiler] The first chapiter I was Hooked AF !
I just loved the first chapiter's story ! It was REALLY big for just a "Chapiter" omg XD
Every episode finish with [spoiler] Neptune in a TV station[/spoiler] and every time I was like shit... its already the end of the game? But after like 5-6 episiode 2h+ long each I was like... wow....... [b] Reminder that I skipped EVERY "Text only"
 scenes !![/b] The first episode was a blast.. seriously !

Ill end this review here, Ill might add more soon :)
Let me know if its a good review or not, tell me what you dont like or like ^_^ Peace !

author: {'steamid': '76561198035391503', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 467, 'playtime_forever': 4829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1539100009}
review:
This is a loved JRPG series for manny reasons.
That the fanservice and waifu's are a part of it is a no brainer.
But the story and humor are great, and extremely funny.

The gameplay is solid and plays like a true Jrpg. The world is well crafted.
The characters are extremely likeable and the dialogue between them is just hilarious.

A solid port, 60fps, good looking graphics, great art style, Lot to do, TONS of content.

A great game for people who love some nep with some nep. Or people looking for a solid Jrpg experience.
Enjoy !

author: {'steamid': '76561198038371482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 8304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6496, 'last_played': 1521614285}
review:
I am a humble fan, I see Nep I buy. 

But is the lattest game in series is still good? Is Nep still pudding? And does IF and Compa still have something to provide for those who love Gameindustri? Well, let's go through pros and cons:

Pros

1) Story: VII puts a spin on a traditional formula of Neptunia games. Where previous were following chapter by chapter scheme, this time game separated in three diffrent stories, all connected by a global plot. Each story follows a certan charecter and her story in one of three dimensions (later in the game you can travel between them). Without giving away too much spoilers, let's just say that plots are quite entertaining, espechially for those who played this series for a while.

2) Humor: Since VII provides new structure to plot telling, new charecters and refrences modern gameing as well as Dreamcast rise and fall... It does amazing job with making fun of todays console wars, trends and directions at wich gameindustry rolls, as well as simply being Neptastic in it's usuall well known way, After all most of us play this series for good laughs and this game provides them.

3) Combat: Best in series. This time it's not a simpel as get best weapon, set best combos and just spam those or use all the best SP moves. This time, each weapon have a certan ammount of slots for combos, and many of them connect to each other in diffrent ways for crit hits, so you will have to chose between weapon with low dmg but a lot of combo slots, or strong dmg weapon wich hold less. But overall it's not far fetched from previous games, just a little tweak that makes combat more intresting. Another change was done to EXE meter, unlike Neptunia 1 and 2 -- you can't fill it in diffrent battles and later use to your advantage in tough fight, and unlike Neptunia VI it came back: still it's same good old EXE meter, when heroes or enemies  takes damage it will be filled, and player can use it to transform, unleash a devistating drive attack or use it for coordination. What is coordination? Well if you remember, in previous games, heroines could do double-overdrives, now player have ability to execute a moves with 3 or 4 heroines, if they present and set on field.
Finaly we have so called Dark CPU bosses. Battles with them are diffrent from standart, but not much, you simply can not harm them with weapon and left with SP moves and coordination attacks, but the epicness is overwhelming.

4) Music and Sound: Amazing! Although some of trecks in OST are remakes of other games, and while it's understandable with Spelunky (to which there's a two dungeons as a huge nod) then with Guilty Gear or Phantom Break (and correct me if I am wrong, but isn't "Whirlpool of Insanity" kinda sound like one of God Eater themes?) it feels outta place. Still even remakes are awesome.

Neutral

1) DLC: By themself it's same old same old, a wee bit of overpowered equip and some charecters. However DLC charecters do have their events, dialogues and they feel like they should've been in the game from the start. Although they wont provide anything story related, it's still feels like a sort of scam... Not mad, simply dissapointed at you IF and Compa.

2) Random encounters on a world map. Random encounters on a world map Carl! Random encounters on a world map in modern JRPG! Well in NG+ you can turn them off, still very annoying, though not fatal and hey if you like 'em -- good for you.

3) Endings. With no spoilers, fuck Normal Ending! Fuck it! Fuck it! Not very dark (this honor still belongs to Neptunia 2 and conquest ending) but my god it's sad, be aware. True ending is better, but it still fells quite depressing... I thought I played Neptunia not Tales of! But with all honesty, they both are strong endings and I put them in neutral section mostly because of subjective view.

Cons

1) Short
2) Auto-equip
3) Many boring dungeons and enemy variety
4) Hunting for secret treaures still sucks
5) Scouts (just play and you will know the pain)


Final verdict? 8 Neps out of 10. Great for those who played previous games and likes them.
